 Anna Peltovuori, Akademikerföreningen,* 
*tel* 
*070-648 17 55*
*Med kandidatens samtycke görs en bakgrundskontroll under anställningsprocessens slutskede som innebär kontroll av personalia, ekonomiska förhållanden och juridiska frågor. Även CV och annan ansökningsdokumentation kan komma att verifieras.*

title: Developer
description:
*Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.*
**Om tjänsten**
 På Fortnox Financial Services utvecklar vi innovativa lösningar som hjälper Sveriges företagare att få betalt för sina tjänster och hantera sin finansiering. Vi bygger finansiella produkter som fungerar sömlöst med Fortnox core-produkter och vårt uppdrag är att komplettera och förstärka Business Platforms erbjudande med värdeskapande fintech-lösningar som gör livet enklare för Sveriges företagare. Vi är alltså den finansiella motorn i plattformen och en växande satsning inom Fortnox.
   

  

 Vi söker nu utvecklare som vill ta nästa steg tillsammans med oss och forma framtidens FinTech lösning på Fortnox – i Malmö, Växjö, Linköping och Stockholm. Som utvecklare hos oss blir du en nyckelspelare i ett tvärfunktionellt team med helhetsansvar för utvecklingen - från idé till lansering. Vi arbetar agilt, produktnära och med stort fokus på kundvärde. Som utvecklare får du möjlighet att arbeta genom hela teknikstacken och påverka såväl tekniska val som metoder och leverans. Vi jobbar enligt Product Operating Model - ett nära samarbete mellan utvecklare, produktchefer och designers, där vi bygger skalbara och användarvänliga FinTech-tjänster. Du blir del av en kultur som präglas av innovation, nyfikenhet, kunskapsdelning och ständig utveckling.
   

  

**Vi arbetar med**
* Frontend: JavaScript/TypeScript, React
* Backend: Java, Kotlin
* Integrationer och data: REST-API:er, SQL-databaser, Kafka
* Övrigt: Microservices, AI/Machine Learning, GitHub/Bitbucket


**Om dig**
 Du är en erfaren utvecklare med ett genuint teknikintresse, som trivs i en föränderlig miljö där nya idéer välkomnas och omsätts i praktiken. Du är självgående, lösningsorienterad och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap till andra.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har:
   

  

* Flera års erfarenhet av professionell mjukvaruutveckling.
* Stark kompetens inom backend (Java, Kotlin) och gärna även frontend (React, TypeScript).
* Kunskap och intresse för ML/Algoritmer.
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt och produktnära utveckling.
* God kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska.


**Våra orter**
 Oavsett var du utgår ifrån kommer du att tillhöra ett team med stort ansvar och starkt driv. Vi tillämpar en
 **hybridmodell** 
 med 3 dagar på kontoret och 2 dagar hemifrån. Varje team har stort inflytande över hur det organiserar sig.
   

  

* Stockholm – på Linnégatan 89 hittar du en komplett fin-tech hubb! Här finns en bredd av kompetenser och du blir del av ett tvärfunktionellt team som tillsammans positionerar Fortnox som Sveriges mest spännande fin-tech bolag!
* Växjö – Fortnox huvudkontor och vår största hubb för utveckling!
* Malmö – Centralt kontor på Drottninggatan 34, här är nya utvecklingsteam under uppbyggnad så du får vara med på något nytt i tidigt skede!
* Linköping – Här bygger vi något helt nytt: algoritmer, ML och nästa generations finansiella system!


**Varför Fortnox?**
 Vi erbjuder inte bara en plats i ett av Sveriges mest spännande FinTech-bolag – vi erbjuder även:
   

  

* En kultur där lärande och utveckling står i centrum.
* En plats i ett av Sveriges mest snabbväxande företag.
* Möjlighet att göra skillnad, för Sveriges företagare och samhället i stort.
* Flexibla arbetssätt och en hybridmodell som fungerar i vardagen.
* Kollegor som bryr sig – om produkten, om våra användare och om varandra.


**Fortnox – mitt i företagslivet**
 Fortnox hjälper företag att starta, växa och utvecklas. Med smarta tekniska lösningar för företag och redovisningsbyråer, smidig finansiering och ett ekosystem av starka partnerskap är Fortnox ett nav för företagande i Sverige. Vi drivs av visionen om ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag.
   

  

 Fortnox grundades 2001 med huvudkontor i Växjö. Läs mer på www.fortnoxgroup.com.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Unity Developer Intern [Remote]
description:
**About XR Solutions** 




 XR Solutions is a technology-driven company pioneering
 **machine learning-powered augmented reality solutions** 
 for industrial clients.
 



 Our mission is to revolutionize how machines are operated, maintained, and optimized — enabling workflows and innovations that were once impossible. We combine research-based optimizations with cutting-edge AR technology to create
 **practical, reliable, and high-performance solutions** 
 that reshape industries.
 



 This internship offers a rare opportunity to
 **build backend systems that directly power advanced AR applications** 
 used in real-world industrial environments.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 We’re looking for a
 **passionate, detail-oriented Unity Developer Intern** 
 with a strong interest in XR interaction and immersive technologies.
 



 While the internship is
 **initially unpaid** 
 , outstanding performance could lead to a
 **future paid opportunity** 
 .
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Collaborate with developers on
 **XR features** 
 and infrastructure
* Design, develop, and test interactive UI/UX for AR applications
* Integrate and support backend systems and services
* Conduct research into AR technologies, including hardware like
 **HMDs**
* Contribute to product design and optimization ahead of our first pilot launch
* Help solve complex, real-world challenges using cutting-edge tools



  





**What You’ll Gain** 



* Hands-on experience building XR applications used in industry
* Deep exposure to
 **Unity** 
 ,
 **ARKit** 
 , and backend systems integration
* Real-world application of UI/UX principles in immersive environments
* Insight into the full development lifecycle of AR products
* A chance to work on a product preparing for its first commercial deployment
* Experience in a collaborative, startup-style tech environment



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* Proficiency in
 **Unity** 
 and
 **ARKit**
* Proficiency in
 **C#**
* Experience with
 **3D modeling** 
 tools (e.g., Blender, Maya)
* Knowledge of
 **Figma** 
 for UI/UX design
* Passion for XR, AR, and immersive technologies
* Familiarity with
 **Xcode** 
 and
 **HMDs** 
 (head-mounted displays) is a plus



  





  





 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in backend development.

title: Developer
description:
*Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.*
**Om tjänsten**
 I vårt affärsområde Business Platform utvecklar vi Fortnox centrala SaaS-produkter, vilka utgör kärnan i vårt erbjudande. Här skapar vi smarta, skalbara och användarvänliga lösningar som dagligen används av hundratusentals företag i Sverige. Bland våra kunder finns en stor variation, från enskilda företagare till redovisningsbyråer. Vårt ansvar sträcker sig över produktområdena Redovisa, Ta Betalt, Medarbetare och Byråstöd & Rapportera – allt det som utgör grunden i kundernas vardag. Samtidigt jobbar vi tätt ihop med våra kollegor inom Financial Services för att tillsammans erbjuda en sömlös helhetslösning, där kärnprodukterna möter smarta tilläggstjänster inom t.ex. betalningar och finansiering.
   

  

 Som utvecklare På Business Platform får du vara med och utveckla produkter som spelar en avgörande roll i Fortnox plattform och där varje förbättring får stor effekt för våra kunder. Som utvecklare hos oss blir du en del av ett autonomt team med helhetsansvar för sina produkter – från idé till produktion. Vi jobbar agilt och produktnära, med stort fokus på teknik, innovation och kundnytta. Du kommer att ha möjlighet att arbeta både frontend och backend och att bidra till tekniska beslut, arkitektur och metodutveckling.
   

  

**Vår Tech-stack (varierar mellan team)**
* Backend: Java, Kotlin, Go, PHP, Node.js
* Frontend: Backbone.js/JavaScript, React/React Native/TypeScript, Databaser & integrationslager: PostgreSQL, REST, Kafka
* DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub, GitHub Copilot, Bitbucket


**Vi tror att du**
* Har flera års erfarenhet av professionell mjukvaruutveckling
* Har goda kunskaper inom Java, Kotlin eller PHP. Erfarenhet av React eller annan modern frontend-teknik är också meriterande
* Har erfarenhet av agila team och produktutveckling
* Trivs i en föränderlig miljö där du får bidra med din kompetens, nyfikenhet och kreativitet
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska


**Våra orter**
* Växjö – Fortnox huvudkontor! Här utvecklar vi flera av våra centrala core-produkter och huserar majoriteten av Business Platforms 27 utvecklingsteam.
* Stockholm – På Linnégatan 89 skapar vi morgondagens digitala verktyg! Här utvecklar vi vår nya AI-plattform och effektiva lösningar för styrelseportal, koncern, dokument- och ärendehantering.
* Linköping - ett av våra mindre kontor som präglas av sammansvetsade team och stark gemenskap. Här utvecklar vi företagsbrevlådan och våra värdefulla rapport- och analysprodukter, vilka är centrala för våra kunders framgång.


 Vi arbetar hybrid: 3 dagar på kontoret och 2 dagar hemifrån. Vi uppmuntrar teamen att själva organisera sitt arbetssätt.
   

  

**Varför Fortnox?**
* En plats i ett av Sveriges mest snabbväxande techbolag
* Möjlighet att påverka teknik, arkitektur och produktutveckling
* Kollegor som delar din passion för kod, kundvärde och ständig förbättring
* En kultur där lärande, delaktighet och samarbete står i centrum
* Flexibla arbetssätt som fungerar i livet – inte bara på jobbet


**Fortnox – mitt i företagslivet**
 Fortnox hjälper företag att starta, växa och utvecklas. Med smarta tekniska lösningar för företag och redovisningsbyråer, smidig finansiering och ett ekosystem av starka partnerskap är Fortnox ett nav för företagande i Sverige. Vi drivs av visionen om ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag.
   

  

 Fortnox grundades 2001 med huvudkontor i Växjö. Läs mer på www.fortnoxgroup.com.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Frontend developer at Thermo-Calc Software
description:
Are you ready to create intuitive, modern user experiences for complex scientific tools? Thermo-Calc Software in Solna is looking for a skilled Frontend Developer (React) to join our passionate team in shaping the future of materials science software.
   

  

 We’re a fast-growing tech company at the intersection of engineering, research, and user-centered design. With customers around the globe and a product that truly makes a difference in research and industry, your frontend skills will directly contribute to innovation in materials development, sustainability, and beyond. Help us build the Future of Scientific Software!
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Strong experience with React and modern JavaScript/TypeScript frameworks
* Solid understanding of frontend architecture and state management (e.g. Redux, Context)
* Solid understanding of HTML5, CSS3, and modern CSS frameworks (e.g., SASS, Styled Components, Tailwind)
* Experience with REST APIs and integrating complex backend logic into the UI using tRPC
* Familiarity with version control systems like Git and Continuous Integration such as Jenkins
* Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset
* A degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience


**Meritorious**
* Knowledge of backend tools like Java Spring Boot
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud)
* Exposure to containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes)
* Experience integrating scientific or numerical code into a GUI
* Agile development experience (Scrum, Kanban, etc.)


**Responsibilities**
 As Frontend Developer, you’ll take a leading role in developing the user interface for our next-generation web platform. Working in a cross-functional environment with backend developers, FORTRAN specialists, designers, and scientists, you’ll ensure that complex scientific workflows are transformed into elegant, user-friendly web applications.
   

  

 You’ll primarily work with React, TypeScript, and modern frameworks such as Fastify, alongside Spring Boot and Azure on the backend. Your focus will be on delivering robust, scalable, and visually intuitive frontends that meet high technical and usability standards.
   

  

**In This Role, You Will**
* Design and build dynamic, interactive web interfaces using React and TypeScript
* Collaborate with backend and scientific developers to integrate advanced functionality
* Maintain a high standard of UI performance, accessibility, and responsiveness
* Contribute to architectural decisions and continuous improvement processes
* Participate in code reviews and team discussions to maintain quality and consistency
* Stay updated on frontend trends, tools, and best practices


 Selection is ongoing, so please submit your application as soon as possible. We are collaborating with Randstad Digital for this recruitment. If you have any questions about the role or the process, feel free to contact Julia Rhönnstad at julia.rhonnstad@randstad.se.
   

  

 Welcome to a workplace where your code truly matters.
   

  

 If you’ve ever wished that your phone were lighter, a battery lasted longer, or your plane flight required less fuel for the environment, then you’ve wished for a better material. At Thermo-Calc Software, we make software and databases that are used by materials scientists and engineers to generate data that helps them design better materials and improve materials processing conditions. Our flagship product, Thermo-Calc, is used by more than 1900 organizations located in more than 60 countries around the world to drive innovation through improved, advanced materials.

title: Data Engineer / Cloud Developer within Advanced Analytics
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We are now looking for a seasoned developer within Data Engineering to strengthen the Product Analytics team within the Connected Analytics unit. You will be working as part of an agile team to enable various units within TRATON R&D worldwide in accessing comprehensive amounts of connected vehicle data and create data products, self-service analytics and visualizations based on the data of a fleet of several hundred thousand vehicles. As part of the team, you will participate in the short- and long-term planning of deliveries and technologies, the prioritization and according implementation.
   

  

 In your role, you will bring in your competence and efforts to continuously improve and scale the toolset through which we create data availability and insights for the various consumers within TRATON R&D. You will cooperate with data providers and consumers alike (data engineers, data scientists and AI experts, engineers, analysts, statisticians, product and service owners) and develop high quality data products and self-service in a sustainable and scalable way.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Scale up and continuously improve the toolset to enable advanced analytics and data sharing for TRATON R&D
* Develop data products and create insights based on connected vehicle data
* Take ownership for the complete life-cycle of the solutions you create, from requirements, planning, implementation to maintenance and continuous improvements
* Accelerate and scale the team’s efforts by applying latest technologies and methods
* Contribute to the continuous improvement process of the team and share your knowledge to support the journey to being a data-driven and AI-ready company
* Ensure reliable, scalable and cyber secure solutions by applying and continuously improving the team’s DevSecOps methods
* Keep a clear focus on efficiency, managing the balance between cost, customer value and elimination of waste


**Who You Are**
 As a person, you are analytical and communicative. Establishing a personal network within the organization to find the best possible solution to a problem is easy for you. You embrace diversity and cooperation and are experienced in mentoring and leading teams. You have a supportive mindset when engaging stakeholders and consumers of your solutions, and like to put in an extra effort for satisfied customers.
   

  

 In your career, you have worked with large scale data sets and industrial solutions in cloud environments. You show professional habits and skills when it comes to tooling, coding, testing, deploying and documentation. You have a proven track record in at least some of the relevant areas of the field such as cloud data warehouses, data processing, statistics, data science and analytics, data- and ML-pipelining, DevSecOps, cloud infrastructure and agile development.
   

  

 Having worked with operational vehicle data, diagnostic data, geospatial data, or comparable large data sets in similar industries is a merit; as is leadership experience as Scrum Master, Project Lead or similar.
   

  

 Your work is based on the following (or comparable) skills and tooling (examples): Python / SQL / C#, AWS, CICD, Gitlab, Grafana, Snowflake, Databricks, Azure AD, front-end development (e.g. Vue) and visualization, statistics and analytics (e.g. SAS Viya, Power-BI).
   

  

 You have an academic education at university level in computer science, engineering physics, electrical engineering or equivalent work experience. You communicate fluently in English, in both speech and writing.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 Our unit is part of the Connected Vehicle Data and Analytics section within the Cloud Embedded Platform domain of TRATON R&D, which is the global development organization for the brands Scania and MAN in Europe and the brand International in the US. With our global organization, we deliver innovative and sustainable solutions with the customer value at the heart of everything.
   

  

 The team Product Analytics is part of a line- and flow-organization which is working globally according to SAFe. We ensure that TRATON R&D has access to the data and analytics capabilities needed for informed decision making.
   

  

 Within our organization, we value a culture of collaboration and learning, with respect for the individual. As a member of the team, you have the opportunity to shape your work and the future of the transportation industry with us.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-12-10. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Frank Deubzer, Group Manager, frank.deubzer@scania.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Software Engineer (Scala/Go), Courier Group
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 Are you excited about building services that cater to the unique tastes of millions of users? Do you thrive in an environment where you can learn and grow? Would you enjoy working with modern backend technologies and building scalable systems from scratch? If so, great news—Wolt is looking for multiple Backend Engineers to join different engineering teams across our Courier Group!
   

  

 Our Courier Group consists of 11 teams dedicated to enhancing the customer experience, optimizing courier partnerships, and shaping the logistics platform of the future. We are investing in the next generation Go-based systems, while Scala is a key part of our current tech stack. We also work with other technologies, and we welcome engineers who bring diverse backend experience and a passion for writing high-quality, maintainable code. We actively stay up-to-date with modern backend ecosystems and have a strong engineering community that fosters best practices and continuous learning.
   

  

 If you're interested in backend development in general and want to collaborate with like-minded engineers, we have a lot to offer—we hope you join us for the ride! 🚀
   

  

 📍All these roles are open for candidates who are based in Finland but some of the teams are also open to hiring for Tallinn, Berlin or Stockholm. So if you are based either in Finland or Tallinn, Berlin or Stockholm, don’t hesitate to apply. We offer a flexible hybrid setup: you can choose to work from the office, remotely, or a mix of both - whatever suits you best. We also offer relocation support if interested in relocating to Helsinki from another country.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 👉 You have solid experience designing, building, and integrating quality software (microservices) at scale within a complex domain.
   

  

 👉 You have strong technical leadership skills.
   

  

 👉 You have experience with cloud platforms (AWS or similar), container orchestration (Kubernetes, Docker), observability tools (such as DataDog), and database technologies (SQL and NoSQL).
   

  

 👉 Your stakeholder management skills are excellent.
   

  

 👉 You're a pragmatic problem-solver with a growth mindset, eager to step outside your comfort zone and continuously learn.
   

  

 👉 You're comfortable working with real-world data and its nuances.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 💯 Overall our product organization at Wolt consists of a team of over 1000 people. We aim to build none other than the best-in-the-world engineering team here.
   

  

 💙 You’ll get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognise that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind, and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement.
   

  

 🙌 Join us for an exciting journey of creating technology that brings joy, simplicity, and earnings to the neighbourhoods of the world!
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Utvecklare mobila lösningar
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vill du vara med och utveckla nästa generations mobilapplikationer – och samtidigt skapa verklig nytta för några av Sveriges mest spännande företag inom industri, transport och bygg? Då är CGI rätt arbetsplats för dig!
   

  

 Hos oss på CGI får du arbeta i teknikens framkant när det gäller kompetensutveckling och ny teknik – för att kunna stötta våra kunder i den digitala transformationens snabba förändringstakt.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som utvecklare av mobila lösningar blir du en viktig del av ett team som designar, utvecklar och förvaltar mobilapplikationer för både iOS och Android. Du arbetar nära UX/UI-designers, backend-utvecklare och produktägare för att skapa användarvänliga, prestandaeffektiva och säkra applikationer – ofta i projekt som påverkar stora delar av våra kunders verksamheter.
   

  

 Hos oss får du:
   

  

* Arbeta med både native (Swift, SwiftUI, Java) och cross-plattform-lösningar (.NET MAUI, hybridappar).
* Samarbeta tvärfunktionellt med UX/UI-designers, backend-utvecklare och produktägare.
* Hantera publicering till App Store och Google Play.
* Delta i DevOps-arbete och bidra till CI/CD-pipelines för mobila applikationer.
* Säkerställa hög kodkvalitet och en trygg användarupplevelse genom testdriven utveckling.


 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi tror att du har minst fyra års erfarenhet av mobilutveckling, men viktigast är din vilja att lära, dela kunskap och ta ansvar för helheten, från idé till slutprodukt.
   

  

 Du har även:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av minst en mobilplattform (iOS, Android eller cross-plattform).
* Kunskap om RESTful API, databaser (SQL, NoSQL), och Azure.
* Förståelse för säkerhet i mobilappar (OAuth, JWT, användardata).
* Vana vid arkitekturmönster som MVVM och Clean Architecture.
* Erfarenhet av agila metoder (Scrum, Agile).


 För att trivas och lyckas i rollen tror vi att du drivs av att skapa lösningar med hög kvalitet och stark användarupplevelse. Du har en naturlig nyfikenhet på ny teknik och ett genuint intresse för att förstå användarnas behov. Du arbetar självständigt men uppskattar det agila samarbetet med kollegor, där kunskapsdelning och gemensamt ansvar för resultatet är en självklarhet. Du tycker om att bidra till teamets utveckling, coacha andra och vara en aktiv del i tekniska beslut.
   

  

 I rollen har du möjlighet att arbeta både in-house och hos kund, beroende på projekt.
   

  

 Vill du vara med och skapa digitala lösningar som gör verklig skillnad – i en miljö där du får växa, påverka och trivas? Välkommen till CGI!
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande så skicka in din ansökan redan i dag! Om du har frågor om rollen, hör gärna av dig till rekryterande ledare Annika Widell, Director Consulting Services/ Konsultchef, på annika.widell@cgi.com
   

  

**Om CGI**
 CGI leder digitaliseringen av Sverige och är världsledande på att omvandla innovation, information och teknologi. Genom djup branschkunskap och en förståelse för kundens utmaningar, bidrar vi med insikter för att skapa hållbara resultat. Vi finns i 40 länder med 90 000 medarbetare globalt. I Sverige är vi ca 4000 anställda på 30 orter med huvudkontor i Stockholm. Läs mer om CGI på vår hemsida: www.cgi.se
   

  

 Läs mer om CGI på vår hemsida: www.cgi.se
   

  

 Mer information om våra förmåner:
   

  

* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4000 kr.
* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Trygg anställning: Våra konsulter anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Integration Developer (Azure Integration Services)
description:
Nu söker vi vår nästa härliga kollega med erfarenhet av att bygga integrationslösningar. Vi är ett gäng utvecklare som jobbar i
 *C#/.NET stacken och drivs av uppdrag med mycket logik och avancerade integrationer. Om du vill bygga unikt anpassade lösningar - då är vi rätt gäng för dig!*
****Vad ingår i jobbet som integrationsutvecklare på Accigo?****
 Som integrationsutvecklare hos oss bygger du nya integrationer med Azure Integration Services & API:er. Självklart har du stor möjlighet att påverka och tycka till om teknikval, det är också något vi både uppmuntrar och uppskattar.
   

  

 Du kommer även att utveckla och underhålla befintliga kundlösningar i förvaltningsåtaganden. Rollen är dynamisk och bjuder på variationsrika och spännande tekniska utmaningar med stora möjligheter att utveckla dina kunskaper och bredda din erfarenhet utifrån dina egna ambitioner.
   

  

 Några exempel på vad du kan komma jobba med:
   

  

* Designa och skapa integrationslösningar i Microsoft Azure
* Designa och skapa API:er och fasader för integrationer
* Möjlighet att jobba med webbutveckling om det lockar
* Samarbeta med kunder och kollegor
* Arbeta självständigt i mindre uppdrag


**Vi söker dig som**
* Under ca 3+ år har jobbat med C# och byggt API:er
* Har kunskap inom Microsoft Azure utifrån att bygga integrationslösningar
* Har erfarenhet inom Azure integration services, tex. Logic Apps, Azure functions, API Management, Azure services bus, data factory och event grid
* Tycker att CI/CD är lika självklart som att solen går upp varje dag
* Är van att jobba i agil scrum-process
* Du är kommunikativ och älskar att ta ansvar från start till slut.


**Det är meriterande om du dessutom har**
* Erfarenhet av att arbetat med BizTalk eller liknande integrationsmotor
* Erfarenhet av konsultrollen


 Vem är du?
   

  

 Du är en riktig team-player som antagligen gillar att umgås mycket med dina kollegor. För att lyckas på Accigo är det viktigt att du är kommunikativ, nyfiken och prestigelös.
   

  

 Du är en problemlösare som vågar gå utanför din "comfort zone" och testa nya tankar, perspektiv och tekniker.
   

  

 Du gillar att coacha andra och förstår skillnaden mellan att ge kritik och konstruktiv feedback. Sist men inte minst, strävar du alltid efter att göra ditt bästa i alla lägen.
   

  

 Vårt team
   

  

 Teamet Cloud & Development är ett gäng utvecklare och affräsledare som mer än ofta är ute hos kunder och projektleder eller kravställer nya spännande lösningar.
   

  

 För oss är laganda och glädje jätteviktigt och vi ser därför till att hitta på roliga aktiviteter med teamet både på och utanför arbetstid. Det ska vara kul att jobba och alla ska ha möjlighet att utvecklas i linje med sin egen ambition. Det innebär att vi arbetar med många utmanande och spännande projekt i ett lagom tempo. Hos oss är det bara din egen ambition och lust som sätter gränsen för hur mycket du kan utvecklas!
   

  

**Nyfiken?** 
 Vi svarar gärna på frågor, eller berättar mer om oss över en kaffe - du kan enkelt komma i kontakt med oss: tyra.drakenberg@accigo.se.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om oss och träffa våra medarbetare på vår karriärsida.

title: CRM Developer, Salesforce focus
description:
**Solve real business problems by building and scaling CRMs and applying AI into digital strategy. We are looking for you who want to work in cross-functional teams, have autonomy in your work and build our CRM offering together with us. Let's find your Road!**
 Who we are
   

  

 We are Columbia Road, a Nordic digital sales consultancy dedicated to transforming how companies grow. We create scalable, data-driven solutions with customer experience at the core. By combining CRM expertise, modern data platforms, and AI-enabled marketing and sales, we help our clients orchestrate personalised customer journeys, automate at scale, and deliver measurable commercial impact.
   

  

 Our clients include ambitious B2B and B2C companies — from global consumer brands to leading industrial players. We work at the intersection of technology, design, and business, solving complex challenges and building solutions that drive sustainable growth.
   

  

 At Columbia Road, you’ll join a flat and entrepreneurial organisation with the freedom to lead, challenge, and shape both your own career and our growing presence in Sweden. You will join a small ambitious team in Sweden and be a part of a group of hundreds of experts in the nordics.
   

  

 The job & what you’d be working on
   

  

 We are strengthening our Salesforce and CRM capabilities in Stockholm and looking for experienced consultants who want to play a key role in both client success and our local growth journey.
   

  

 As a CRM / Salesforce Developer at Columbia Road, you will:
   

  

* Build and scale CRM solutions (preferably Salesforce) that unlock data-driven insights and improved customer experiences within sales, marketing and service.
* Act as a trusted advisor to clients — helping them connect business strategy with technology, improve sales processes, and identify opportunities for automation and AI.
* Contribute to developing new commercial opportunities, building networks, and growing our presence in Sweden.
* Work in cross-functional teams with consultants, designers, and developers to deliver real business impact.


 This is a senior role suited to someone who enjoys combining technical expertise with business acumen, and who is curious about the potential of AI and intelligent agents in transforming sales and marketing.
   

  

**Skills And Experience We Expect You To Have**
* Hunger to drive change and create business value
* Solid hands-on experience with CRM, preferably Salesforce (Sales, Service, Marketing, Experience and Data Clouds).
* Ability to connect business requirements with technical solutions — turning data into insights and scalable processes.
* Experience with integrations between CRM and other business systems (ERP, marketing automation, data platforms).
* Knowledge of data modelling and customer data architecture to enable scalable solutions.
* Curiosity around AI and automation in marketing and sales.
* Proven consulting skills: problem-solving, communication, and client management.
* Track record in developing commercial relationships and contributing to business growth.
* Fluency in Swedish and English (professional level).


**The Following Are Considered An Advantage**
* Agency or consultancy experience
* Familiarity with marketing automation tools (e.g. Marketing Cloud, Pardot).
* Salesforce development skills (Lightning, APEX, Visualforce) and architectural understanding.


 Why join us
   

  

* Work with the best: Collaborate with top CRM (in addition to Salesforce), data, design, and tech experts across the Nordics.
* Get to solve real business problems (not just implementing solutions), applying AI into digital strategy, implementation and operations.
* Freedom to lead: Shape projects, influence decisions, and build our Salesforce practice in Sweden.
* Competitive package: Salary, benefits, flexible work, and a modern office in central Stockholm.
* Never stop learning: Support for Salesforce certifications and growth towards roles like Salesforce Architect or Team Lead.
* Culture that connects: Regular team events, offsites, and a strong Nordic community that values collaboration and fun.


 Recruitment process
   

  

 Our recruitment process typically involves 2-3 interviews where we learn about your skills and what motivates you. You'll discover more about Columbia Road and meet various Roadies along the way. After our discussions, we'll reach out to your chosen references. We look forward to hearing from you soon!
   

  

**Benefits**
* A community-led organisation with a high level of autonomy
* A diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace
* Option to buy stocks of the company through the common employee share program
* A yearly bonus based on company performance (equal to all full-time Roadies)
* Recurring training and learning sessions to support your professional growth
* Offices in central Stockholm, Drottninggatan 33, with daily breakfast & snacks
* A wide selection of quality tools to use for your work (laptop, phone etc.) and a mobile phone subscription
* Health services incl. mental health, and insurance
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Recurring Roadie-ideated events and activities
* Compensation for working on open source or social programs in your free time


 We help companies sell better by building seamless digital solutions and running concrete growth activities. Find your Road with us by exploring open jobs or Connecting with us!

title: Dynamics 365 CE utvecklare
description:
**Att jobba som Dynamics 365 CE utvecklare**
 Som Dynamics 365 CE utvecklare på Skandia får du arbeta med verksamhetskritiska lösningar för kund- och ärendehantering inom både bank- och försäkringsområdet. Plattformen är central för vår affär, och vårt användande sträcker sig över Customer Service, Sales och Customer Insights.
   

  

 Du blir en nyckelperson i ett agilt team där teknik, affär och användarbehov möts. Din vardag kommer att innehålla utveckling och konfiguration i Dynamics 365 CE, arbete med Power Platform och optimering av integrationer mot andra interna system.
   

  

 Vi har en ambitiös utvecklingsplan för Dynamics och arbetar kontinuerligt med att modernisera vår arkitektur, bland annat genom molnbaserade lösningar i Azure, ständigt med fokus på hållbarhet, skalbarhet och kundnytta. Du blir också en viktig del i vår strävan att ligga i teknikens framkant, både vad gäller plattformen och hur vi arbetar.
   

  

 Du kommer att ingå i ett tvärfunktionellt team om cirka 15 kollegor med roller som utvecklare, mjukvaruarkitekt, testare och Scrum master. Vi arbetar tätt tillsammans, med stor öppenhet och en vilja att skapa värde, både för varandra och för våra kunder. Det här är ett team där vänlighet, nyfikenhet och framåtdriv är självklara delar av kulturen. I rollen får du vara med och påverka Skandias CRM-system där vi satsar stort med en tydlig riktning framåt.
   

  

 Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du att rapportera till gruppchef IT kund.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Ser vi att du har flera års erfarenhet av att utveckla och förvalta lösningar inom Dynamics 365 CE och Power Platform. Du är trygg i att arbeta med Power Automate, dataverse, utveckling av plugins och C#/.NET. Du har god förståelse för releasehantering och är van vid att bygga och optimera integrationer med hjälp av exempelvis Azure Functions och Service Bus. Ett grundkrav i rollen är att du kan svenska flytande, både i tal och skrift. Det är meriterande om du även har erfarenhet av JavaScript, TypeScript, React och arbete med säkerhetsaspekter i komplexa IT-miljöer.
   

  

 Vi har påbörjat resan med AI stöd inom CRM-området och vi ser det som en självklarhet att du vill ligga i framkant inom området.
   

  

 Som person är du en engagerad och nyfiken med ett genuint intresse för microsofts ekosystem och CRM-plattformens framtida möjligheter. Du är målmedveten där du driver ditt arbete framåt med både struktur och ansvarstagande. Samtidigt är du en god lagspelare som trivs i ett team, bidrar till ett öppet klimat och gärna delar med dig av din kunskap till andra.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Jonas Olsson på jonas.olsson@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocess, vänligen ta kontakt med Talent Acquisition Partner Harald Brehmer på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Mainframe Developer
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world. At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 We are seeking a skilled Software Engineer with 4 to 8 years of experience in IBM Mainframe Utilities VSAM JCL and COBOL. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Data Management and will work from our office during day shifts. This role does not require travel.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain software applications using IBM Mainframe Utilities VSAM JCL and COBOL.
* Ensure the integrity and quality of data management processes.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze requirements.
* Provide technical support and troubleshooting for mainframe applications.
* Optimize and enhance existing software systems for improved performance.
* Conduct code reviews and ensure adherence to best practices and standards.
* Create and maintain documentation for software applications and processes.
* Participate in the full software development lifecycle including design coding testing and deployment.
* Implement data management solutions that align with business objectives.
* Monitor and resolve issues related to data integrity and performance.
* Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies in mainframe and data management.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of development processes and methodologies.
* Ensure compliance with company policies and regulatory requirements.


**Qualifications**
* Possess a strong understanding of IBM Mainframe Utilities VSAM JCL and COBOL.
* Have a solid background in data management and related processes.
* Demonstrate excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Exhibit strong communication and collaboration abilities.
* Show proficiency in software development lifecycle methodologies.
* Have experience in optimizing and enhancing software systems.
* Display attention to detail and commitment to quality.
* Be capable of working independently and as part of a team.
* Show adaptability to new technologies and industry trends.
* Demonstrate the ability to create and maintain comprehensive documentation.
* Possess a proactive approach to identifying and resolving issues.
* Exhibit a strong commitment to continuous learning and improvement.
* Ensure compliance with all relevant standards and regulations.


**Certifications Required**
 Certified Application Developer on IBM Mainframe or equivalent certification relevant to mainframe technologies.

title: Application Security Engineer
description:
****🔐 Utveckla fr** 
**amtiden med oss!****
 Omegapoint är ett ledande cybersäkerhetsföretag som arbetar med säker digitalisering. Här får du möjligheten att arbeta med branchens mest erfarna experter och utveckla samhällskritiska lösningar. Vi utvecklar och skyddar säkra system tillsammans med våra kunder och nu söker vi fler vassa utvecklare till vårt område Applied Security i Stockholm.
   

  

**Att jobba som Software Security Developer på Omegapoint kan exempelvis innebära att du:**
* Stöttar utvecklingsteam i allt som rör applikationssäkerhet, från planering till implementation.
* Sätter upp användning av säkerhetsverktyg i pipelines.
* Analyserar och förklarar säkerhetsfynd, till exempel relaterade till vanliga sårbarheter som beskrivs i OWASP top 10.
* Är involverad i genomförande av hotmodelleringar.
* Granskar säkerheten i applikationer eller molnmiljöer.
* Hjälper till att utveckla eller skripta mindre komponenter.


 För att trivas tror vi att du är utåtriktad, driven och kvalitetsmedveten. Vi ser gärna att du har en stark vilja att utvecklas och håller dig uppdaterad om de senaste teknikerna och idéerna inom domänen.
   

  

 Vi ser även att du är en stolt utvecklare som alltid strävar efter att skapa värde. Vidare är du prestigelös och delar gärna med dig av din erfarenhet och kompetens både internt och externt.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du:**
* Har minst tre års erfarenhet och en utbildning inom systemutveckling, datavetenskap eller cybersäkerhet.
* Har förståelse för kombinationen av utveckling och säkerhet.
* Har erfarenhet av att utveckla i exempelvis Java, C# eller Python.
* Talar och skriver flytande svenska och engelska.


**Om Omegapoint**
 Omegapoint grundades 2001 och är Norra Europas ledande konsultbolag inom cybersäker digitalisering. Med en vision om en framtid där vi fullt ut kan lita på teknik använder vi vår expertis för att säkra våra kunders och medarbetares utveckling. Vi är vassa och snälla, något som karaktäriseras av vår kompetensutvecklingskultur och viljan att dela vår kunskap med varandra. För närvarande är vi över 900 anställda konsulter i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Örebro, Västerås, Enköping, Uppsala, Umeå och Montreal.
   

  

**✅ Vi satsar på dig**
 På Omegapoint Sätter Vi Din Kompetens i Centrum Och Ger Dig Alla Förutsättningar För Ett Utvecklande Och Varierat Jobb
   

  

* Utveckling och aktiviteter: vi ordnar regelbundet aktiviteter på vårt kontor på Vasagatan i Stockholm för att vi ska utvecklas och ha roligt tillsammans. Vi har bland annat en egen idrottsförening och festkommitté.
* Kompetenskultur: vi samarbetar, delar kunskap och stärker varandra. Årliga kompetenskonferenser är ett självklart inslag. En gång i månaden har vi även Kompetensdag på kontoret.
* Spännande uppdrag: vår kundbas sträcker sig från små specialistföretag till stora välkända företag och myndigheter, vilket ger både utmanande och roliga projekt.
* Förmåner och trygghet: vi erbjuder marknadsmässiga löner, förstärkt föräldralön, anpassade förmånspaket, friskvårdsbidrag, sjukvårdsförsäkring och möjlighet till delägarskap.


 Men viktigast av allt – vi har en kultur där vi utvecklas tillsammans, delar kunskap och har riktigt roligt längs vägen.

title: Technical Director - Toca Boca World
description:
We’re looking for a Technical Director to shape the long-term technology vision and strategy of our live game service and ensure the architectural foundation that powers our app, backend systems, and production workflows. This is a high-impact leadership role for someone who thrives on solving complex technical challenges, influencing across disciplines, and elevating engineering craft at scale.
   

  

 As Technical Director, you’ll act as the chief architect and strategic technology leader, partnering closely with Production, Product, and Creative leadership to turn big ideas into robust, scalable technical realities. You’ll also work close to the code and the teams, partnering with the Director of Engineering to drive engineering excellence, optimize developer productivity, and mentor our next generation of technical leaders.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Set & Own the Technical Vision and Strategy: Define the long-term architecture, roadmap, and technology direction for the entire game service, ensuring scalability, stability, and maintainability
* Guide High-Impact Engineering Decisions: Act as the final authority on complex technical choices, proactively identifying and mitigating risks across all systems
* Elevate Engineering Excellence: Partner with the Director of Engineering to improve productivity, refine tooling, establish best practices, and drive continuous quality across teams
* Develop Technical Leaders: Mentor senior engineers and tech leads to strengthen their technical expertise, strategic thinking, and leadership capabilities
* Align the Studio: Collaborate closely with Production, Product, and Creative stakeholders to translate creative goals into feasible technical plans and communicate vision, progress, KPIs, and risks


**What You Bring**
* 10+ years in professional game development across the tech stack, with 5+ years in senior leadership or principal engineering roles on a major mobile titles
* Deep and proven experience architecting large-scale, persistent live-service games and high-traffic backend systems
* Strong understanding of mobile development constraints—performance, memory, and platform-specific considerations
* Mastery of core languages such as C# or Typescript
* Experience with Unity (our core engine) is a great bonus
* Proven success driving large, cross-team technical initiatives from concept through launch and live operations
* Exceptional communication and influence skills, especially when aligning teams and leaders without direct authority


 If you’re excited by the idea of defining the technical future of a major live game, mentoring top-tier engineers, and shaping a world-class development environment, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and help us build what’s next.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**This is us!**
 Toca Boca captures the spirit of play. We create digital toys and everyday products that are filled with fun and silliness that kids from any corner of the world can instantly relate to. Everything is designed from their perspective. We celebrate the diversity and quirkiness of their world and give them the freedom to play in ways that only they can.
   

  

**Good to know!**
 This position is full time and based in our Stockholm office with a hybrid working model. We apply a 6 month probationary period. You’ll need to be located in Sweden as we are unable to support with relocation. As we’re an international company, with over 20 nationalities working here, and millions of users all over the world, you need to be fluent in English. Your application should therefore be in English.

title: Staff Software Engineer - Content Experience Platform
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***








**Who We Are…**





 When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the
 *storytellers* 
 bringing our characters to life, the
 *creators* 
 bringing them to your living rooms and the
 *dreamers* 
 creating what’s next…
 









 From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.
 




  


 Warner Bros. has been entertaining audiences for more than 90 years through the world’s most-loved characters and franchises. Warner Bros. employs people all over the world in a wide variety of disciplines. We're always on the lookout for energetic, creative people to join our team.
 




  


**Your New Role...** 








 The Direct to Consumer (DTC) Group is a technology company within Warner Bros Discovery. We are building a global streaming video platform (OTT), and a suite of applications to support all of our network’s brands globally. We are building modern container-based micro-services operated on AWS. Our platform covers everything from search, content catalogue, video transcoding, personalization, to global subscriptions, and much more. We enable performant streaming experiences across connected TVs, web, mobile phones, tablets, and consoles for a large footprint of WBD owned streaming services (HBO Max, Discovery+, CNN, and others). This is a growing, global engineering group crucial to WBD’s future.
 







 We are hiring a Staff Software Engineer within the DTC Content Experience Platform. The team is responsible for aggregating, enabling, and serving the personalized Content Discovery experience within our DTC streaming video platforms through our Experience Services APIs. We ensure all client applications worldwide have seamless access to the latest and relevant content metadata, personalized browse experiences and curations, and presentational elements to deliver a best-in-class content discovery experience to our hundreds of millions of streaming users globally across our different streaming service platforms.
 



  


**Your Role Accountabilities...** 



* Shape the long-term technical direction of major workstreams in close partnership with Engineering peers, Product Managers, Technical Program Managers, and Designers.
* Lead system design and development of large, complex features and infrastructure, either in new domains or across multiple existing systems.
* Partner with other technical leaders to drive successful end-to-end delivery, from discovery and planning through execution and operations.
* Support the growth and development of engineers in your workstreams through coaching, design collaboration, and fostering technical excellence.
* Define and uphold standards for code quality, operational excellence, and reliable delivery across teams.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define MVPs, milestones, and product requirements that align engineering efforts with business outcomes.
* Drive architectural decisions that enable scalability, reliability, and adaptability for the future.
* Identify and address gaps, bottlenecks, or misalignments—working proactively to ensure long-term success for your team and the organization.



  


**Qualifications and Experience...** 



* At least 8 years of experience with deep expertise in Java or other JVM-based languages, including advanced language features, performance tuning, and designing systems for scale and reliability.
* Extensive experience building and operating cloud-native applications using Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS, including architecture design and production deployment.
* Strong command of distributed systems, microservice architectures, and synchronous /asynchronous communication patterns using technologies like gRPC and Kafka.
* Proven ability to design and evolve high-performance, low-latency APIs and backend systems that serve real-time, high-throughput workloads.
* Practical and architectural-level experience with persistence and caching technologies such as PostgreSQL, Redis, Elasticsearch, and Caffeine, including data modeling and performance optimization.
* Deep understanding of observability and tracing, with experience driving adoption of tools like OpenTelemetry, Jaeger, or Zipkin to improve system transparency and incident response.
* Experience defining and scaling infrastructure as code practices using Terraform, Helm, ArgoCD, and GitOps workflows.
* Ability to establish robust monitoring, alerting, and logging systems using tools such as Prometheus, CloudWatch, Kibana, and PagerDuty, and ensure teams operate systems with confidence.
* Familiarity with non-blocking, asynchronous, and reactive programming paradigms, including frameworks like Spring WebFlux or Vert.x, and when to apply them effectively.
* Comfortable evaluating, introducing, and scaling technical choices across multiple teams to drive engineering velocity and system robustness.



  


**Additional Information** 
  
 







 On June 9, 2025, Warner Bros. Discovery announced plans to separate into two publicly traded companies, Warner Bros. and Discovery Global, with an expected completion in mid-2026. For more details, including leadership appointments and information on individual brands, please visit our newsroom
 
 here
 
 . 
 







 Although you will be hired by Warner Bros. Discovery, upon the planned separation in 2026, your employment likely will transition to Warner Bros. Company. During this period of transformation, you’ll have an exciting opportunity to lay the foundation at one of the world’s premier entertainment brands.  
 



























  


**How We Get Things Done…**









 This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at
 












 www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/
 











  
 
 along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.
 








**Championing Inclusion at WBD**



 Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects a wide array of perspectives, backgrounds and experiences. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, regardless of sex, gender identity, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy, parenthood, disability or any other category protected by law.
 









 If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you require adjustments or accommodations during the job application and/or recruitment process, please visit our
 
 accessibility page
 
 for instructions to submit your request.

title: Nordic Business Developer
description:
Business Development & Strategy - Large, Complex & International Claims
   

  

**Nordic Business Developer**
**You could call it Nordic Business Developer, but we are actually looking for a complexity eliminator & solutions innovator.**
 When unexpected things happen in our customers’ lives, we are always by their side. At If, customer focus permeates our entire culture. We strive to create the best claims handling service possible for our customers by eliminating any waste or complexity within our processes. Effective & efficient processes aimed at delivering the best possible service for our customers.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The core purpose of the role is to lead & drive operational process improvement initiatives across the Large, Complex & International (LCI) claims group. To do this you will be working closely with other members of the Business Development & Strategy team. In addition to your role in the team, you are expected to actively share experiences & knowledge with local operational teams within the Large, Complex & International claim unit.
   

  

 Your tasks & responsibilities will vary depending on the needs, but will include:
   

  

* Identifying process optimisation opportunities across the LCI claims function.
* Analysing performance data to identify improvement opportunities.
* Coaching teams to improve their operational performance measures.
* Delivering key improvement projects across the Nordic region.
* Coaching & supporting local operational teams to implement strategic improvement initiatives.
* Supporting the Claims strategy deployment process in Sweden or Denmark.
* Implementing & managing the LCI continual improvement framwork for the unit.


**About The Unit**
 The Business Development & Strategy team is a Nordic group that forms part of the Large, Complex & International claims function. Our focus is to help create a positive change for the teams we work with through operational excellence. (Lean, Six Sigma, ToC, TQM)
   

  

 Our role varies from supporting local improvement initiatives in each country through to managing complex projects across the Nordic region. We are now offering an exciting opportunity to work in a dynamic environment with a great team.
   

  

 Although you are an integral member of Business Development & Strategy team, you will also work closely with one of the country based Large, Complex & International claim management teams. The aim is to help & support them to make positive improvements to the way they work, to share experiences and to create best practices together.
   

  

 Join us for a cup of coffee and we will tell you more!
   

  

**Who are you…?**
 We think that you identify yourself with the following:
   

  

* You love continual improvement & ideally are certified in one of the core improvement philosophies. (Lean, six sigma, Theory of Constraints (ToC) or Total Quality Management (TQM))
* You are pragmatic & can easily apply your knowledge to different situations. (I.e. you don't take a one size fits all to problem solving.)
* You like helping people by actively collaborating with them to find common ground & to make a difference.
* You like figuring out how things work & why. When you realize that something could work better or more efficiently, you try your best to change it.
* You can motivate & inspire others to make change by talking of future possibilities.
* You can establish effective improvement teams with people from different backgrounds & skills by building trust & communicating openly with them.
* You’re not just an expert in continuous improvement but you’re also a coach. Someone that enjoys sharing their knowledge with others.
* You cherish your work-life-balance and you know your limits.
* You can be counted on to finish what you started & deliver on your promises.
* You are comfortable working in English.


**Practicalities**
 The position is a full-time position and located in Sweden or Denmark. Some travel to other offices across the Nordic region is required.
   

  

 Last day to apply is 19th of December 2025. Register your CV and personal letter in Workday. ‘Final candidates will undergo a background check before employment.
   

  

 For more information please contact:
   

  

 Adam Franklin, Head of Business Development & Strategy +358 50 567 9648.
   

  

 Last day to apply is 19th of December 2025.

title: Senior Product Designer (Stockholm)
description:
**Why Polar?**
 It's never been easier to build, ship and scale software.
   

  

 But it's never been harder to monetize it.
   

  

 We're obsessed over solving this to empower the future one-developer unicorns.
   

  

 These Unicorns Will Be Rare But Inevitable. Whether In 3, 5, Or 10+ Years, They Also Symbolize a Broader Shift Already In Motion And Accelerating
   

  

* Smaller & smaller teams with...
* Exponential revenue/employee growth
* Focusing fully on their core product and marketing. Delegating & automating everything else that's boilerplate – be it in their codebase or business operations.


 Exceptional billing primitives, APIs, SDKs and abstractions are a crucial foundation, but not enough. They will need a full-fledged platform to oversee, manage and scale their business.
   

  

 Turning their software into an international business in 6 lines of code.
   

  

 Join our small, talented and engineering-led team across Europe to shape how future software businesses are built. We focus on shipping at high velocity to serve developers in unlocking their next stage with their business. Everything else is secondary.
   

  

**Role & Responsibilities**
 We’re hiring a
 **Senior Product Designer** 
 to craft the experience of Polar across our dashboard, SDKs, and developer-facing surfaces. You’ll design end-to-end product flows — from onboarding, checkout, dashboard to customer portals and emails — always with the goal of making complex billing feel effortless and magical for developers and their customers.
   

  

 You’ll own our design system, collaborate closely with engineers, and bring clarity and polish to every part of the product. You’ll also help shape product direction directly, working hand-in-hand with Birk (Founder), design- and product engineers, and our community.
   

  

* Design end-to-end product experiences: flows, interfaces, prototypes, and interactions
* Create and maintain a design system that balances speed, consistency, and craft
* Collaborate with team to scope, refine, and iterate to ship world-class features and user experiences
* Work directly with developers (customers + open source community) to understand needs and turn feedback into elegant solutions
* Prototype and test concepts quickly — from Figma mocks to prototypes made in Cursor / Claude Code.
* Champion craft: typography, animations, micro-interactions, and developer ergonomics
* Contribute to our open source repos where design and developer experience overlap


**What We're Looking For**
* 7+ years of experience designing digital products end-to-end
* Strong portfolio showcasing thoughtful UX, clean UI, and polished interactions
* Comfortable designing complex, data-rich, or developer-facing products
* Proficient with modern design and AI tools (Figma, Cursor/Claude Code, prototyping tools, etc.)
* Excellent communicator who thrives in close collaboration with engineers and product managers
* Someone experienced setting direction and designing for the future of the product while still executing and polishing current efforts and features
* You're comfortable building the first prototype (React, Next.js, Tailwind + using AI) when needed vs. delivering a static design alone
* (Bonus) Experience designing for developer tools, SDKs, or APIs
* (Bonus) Contributions to open source design systems or component libraries


**How We Hire**
 Our process is fully remote, and all communication happens via email, GitHub issues/PRs and/or video calls:
   

  

* Application Review → Short intro call with Birk (Founder)
* Assignment → Open source PR (Engineering) or case study
* Review & interviews (2-3 video calls) to:
+ Meet future team
+ Review and discuss the assignment & feedback + technical questions
+ Meet Birk (Founder)

* Reference Calls
* Offer 🎉

title: Lead Golang Software Engineer, Commercial Systems
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open-source software and operating systems for global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in more than 80 countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a
 **Lead Golang Software Engineer** 
 at any seniority level, who strives for the highest engineering quality, seeks improvements, continuously develops their skills, and applies them at work. This is an exciting opportunity to work with many popular software systems, integrations technologies, and exciting open-source solutions.
   

  

 The Commercial Systems unit is conceived as six engineering teams that closely collaborate with other engineering and business teams at Canonical. Services designed, developed, and operated by the Commercial Systems unit are at the heart of Canonical business and Golang plays an integral role in it. We are looking for software engineers for these teams:
   

  

 The
 **Billing team** 
 designs, develops, and operates a Golang service that provides a standardized and scalable capability to turn metrics into billable amounts, enable customers to see their current spend with Canonical at any time, and ensure accurate, reliable, and timely billing. The service further integrates with other engineering, business, payment systems. This team is an excellent match for any software engineer interested in growing their skills in the billing and payment processing domain.
   

  

 The
 **Contracts** 
 team designs, develops, and operates a Golang service that will become the single source of truth for all contracts with all customers. The service provides a standardized CPQ capability and stores signed contracts in a structured format. The service further integrates with other engineering and business systems including a CRM system and an accounting system. This team is an excellent match for any software engineer interested in understanding sales and revenue processes and growing their skills beyond software engineering.
   

  

 The
 **Livepatch** 
 team designs and develops a service for the delivery of Linux kernel patches to shrink the exploit window for critical and high severity Linux kernel vulnerabilities, by patching the Linux kernel between security maintenance windows, while the system runs. The engineering team behind this product develops Golang based client and backend components, while another Canonical team, the Kernel team, develops the security patches. This team is a great opportunity for a software engineer interested in security and with a strong focus on engineering quality and reliability.
   

  

**Location** 
 : This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.
   

  

**The role entails**
* Develop engineering solutions leveraging Golang
* Lead technical designs, code reviews, and implementation
* Deploy and operate services developed by the team
* Coach, mentor, and offer career development feedback to colleagues
* Develop and evangelize great engineering and organizational practices


**What we are looking for in you**
* Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
* Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
* Experience with software development in Golang
* Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
* Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
* Ability to travel internationally twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long


**Nice-to-have skills**
* Performance engineering and security experience
* Experience with accounting, sales, sales operations, or other business roles


**What we offer colleagues**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Program
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Managing QA Lead - Hearts of Iron IV
description:
Are you a dedicated game developer & QA professional with a passion for driving quality and guiding teams toward better ways of working? Do you thrive in a hands-on role where you lead processes, support people, and collaborate closely with developers? Then you might be the Managing QA Lead we’re looking for!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As the Managing QA Lead on the Hearts of Iron team, you will play a central role in ensuring that the quality of all internally developed releases is well understood, communicated, and continuously improved. At Paradox, QA is an integrated part of the development team: we contribute to design discussions, support feature development, and help ensure that what we ship is both stable and fun for our players. In this role, you will drive the QA strategy, lead and support the QA team, coordinate testing efforts, and work closely with both internal developers and external QA partners. You will be responsible for the growth, well-being, and performance of the QA team while also engaging in hands-on QA work and improving processes across the project.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Define, plan, and execute the QA and testing needs for Hearts of Iron IV.
* Lead, support, and coach the QA team in their daily work and long-term development.
* Track, evaluate, and communicate product quality throughout the development cycle.
* Recruit, onboard, and mentor QA team members as the team evolves.
* Conduct performance check-ins and support career development within the QA craft.
* Coordinate with external QA partners, ensuring they are equipped and aligned with project needs.
* Collaborate with designers, engineers, producers, and other disciplines to support feature development with QA insight.
* Continuously improve workflows, testing methodologies, and QA processes across the project.
* Provide QA expertise and leadership to other teams in the studio when needed.


**Requirements**
 To succeed in this role, we believe you are collaborative, structured, proactive, and not afraid to dive into hands-on testing when needed. You enjoy problem-solving, communicating clearly, and helping both teams and individuals raise the overall quality bar.
   

  

**We Think You Have**
* Previous experience in QA for game development
* Experience in leading QA work, coordinating others, or managing QA teams
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
* Hands-on experience with Jira or similar bug databases
* A strong understanding of QA methodologies, test planning, and risk assessment


**Nice to have**
* Familiarity with Paradox Development Studio titles, especially Hearts of Iron
* Experience coordinating or managing external QA partners
* Experience working through full development cycles (from alpha to release)
* Strong interest in systems-heavy or grand strategy games


 We welcome applicants with a range of backgrounds, if the role sounds exciting, we highly encourage you to apply!

title: Line Manager SDI Development
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Over 40% of the world’s mobile traffic is carried through an Ericsson network. Ericsson is a recognized technology leader in bringing the 5th generation (5G) of Radio Access Networks (RAN) and Mobile Core Networks to market. The foundation for 5G use cases is built on an agile cloud environment, distributed across the network’s coverage area to deliver performance, flexibility and scale.
   

  

 Software Defined Infrastructure (SDI) is the automated equipment management component that is key to enabling this agile private cloud. To strengthen this area, we are recruiting a Line Manager for one of our SDI development sections.
   

  

 In this role, you will lead a team of 14 skilled developers working at the intersection of networks, cloud, and software. You will be part of the PDG (Product Development Group) Leadership Team, helping shape how we build, deploy and operate SDI and how emerging technologies, including AI, change the way we develop and test our software.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Provide clear direction and priorities, translating strategy into concrete team goals and outcomes.
