* A self-starter who can easily motivate themselves.
* Ability to lead and manage virtual teams to deliver quality outcomes within agreed timeframes.
* A committed, organised, confident, consistent and ambitious person.
* 5-10 years’ experience in customer management, presales and/or design of complex customer solutions
* Strong business acumen and technical aptitude in the markets and technologies XBP Europe is focusing on
* Business Development experience and aware of the future impacts of technology on business operations.
* Ability to quickly build trusting relationships with clients.
* Expert at uncovering client needs, developing compelling propositions and building comprehensive financials models and business cases.
* Excellent presentation and communication skills.
* Experience building hi-level customer relationships with both technical and business contacts.
* Evidence of flexibility and accuracy.
* A client centric and an entrepreneurial thinker.
* Good knowledge of Financial Services and operations, including use of its technology.
* Exposure to commercial situations and a solid background in transforming operations using a variety of tools and techniques.
* Recognised certs that evidence strong communications skills and numeracy.
* Excellent language skills in Swedish and English. Norwegian and/or Danish is beneficial.
* Willing to travel within the Nordics.



  





**Our Offer** 



* Working in a dynamically developing international company at the XBP Europe with global standards and systems.
* Individual Development Plan and career growth
* Social package and employee benefits of the corporate level:
* Permanent Contract
* Referral Bonus
* Annual Bonus Plan
* Medical Benefits
* Holiday entitlement
* Pension scheme



  





**Disclaimer** 




 XBP Europe prioritizes individual privacy and is devoted to safeguarding personal data. Our recruitment policy focuses on selecting the most qualified candidates based on merit and skills aligned with position requirements. Candidate information is handled in strict compliance with GDPR policies and relevant data protection laws. Read our GDPR policy here.
 



 XBP Europe is committed to creating a diverse environment. Qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their characteristics or preferences. We provide equality, fairness and respect for all in our employment, whether temporary, part-time or full-time. We oppose and avoid all forms of unlawful discrimination including those known as protected characteristics.
 



 XBP Europe recruiters or representatives will only contact you by emails ending with xbpeurope.com or exelatech.com. We would never ask you for payment or ask you to deposit a check into your personal bank account during the recruitment process.

title: Information Technology Technical Support
description:
*Vill du kickstarta din resa inom tech, utvecklas snabbt och ta ett steg in i en värld där du får ansvar, förtroende och möjligheten att påverka från dag ett? Vill du jobba med proffs och lära dig av de vassaste i branschen? Då är Scaly platsen för dig!* 




  





*Här kommer du nära tekniken, kunderna och affären – och blir en del av ett bolag där hårt arbete och ambition verkligen lönar sig. Läs nedan för en unik möjlighet.* 




  





**🚀 Om företaget** 




 Scaly är en strategisk techpartner åt nordiska företag som vill utveckla sina verksamheter med moderna, molnbaserade lösningar. Fokus ligger på tre områden: IT Service Management, Customer Experience och ERP – alltid med målet att systemen ska ge konkret, mätbart affärsvärde snarare än bara ny teknik på papperet.
 



  





 Genom samarbeten med ledande internationella SaaS-leverantörer hjälper Scaly sina kunder genom hela resan: från behovsanalys och val av plattform, via implementation och konfigurering, till långsiktig skalning och vidareutveckling.
 



  





 Bolaget är en del av en växande koncern med kontor på Strandvägen i Stockholm. Kulturen är entreprenöriell och prestationsinriktad – man jobbar nära varandra, delar kunskap generöst och kombinerar tekniskt djup med affärsmässighet.
 



  





**💼 Arbetsuppgifter** 




 Som Junior IT-Support hos Scaly får du den perfekta språngbrädan in i IT-branschen. Du hamnar i skärningspunkten mellan support, implementation och kundkontakt – en unik kombination för dig som vill bygga bred förståelse och snabb utveckling.
 



  





 Från första dagen får du en tydlig onboarding och coachning av erfarna specialister. Här jobbar du med de bästa i branschen. Du följer med i riktiga kundprojekt, ser hur system byggs upp och lär dig hantverket bakom professionell IT-leverans.
 



  





 Och när du visat vad du går för? Då växer ansvaret snabbt. Du får egna kunder, egna ärenden och egna projekt. Med tiden kan du kliva vidare mot roller som teknisk konsult, solution specialist eller implementationsexpert.
 



  





 Resor kan förekomma, t.ex. till Amsterdam eller London för utbildning hos teknikpartners, eller till interna workshops i Spanien.
 



  





**Du kommer bland annat att:** 



* Ta emot och driva kunddialoger där du tolkar behov och formulerar tydliga krav
* Konfigurera och anpassa kundernas system – och se till att lösningarna fungerar i praktiken
* Delta i implementationer: testa, justera, dokumentera och kvalitetssäkra
* Följa upp användarfrågor och äga ärenden hela vägen till mål
* På sikt ta helhetsansvar för egna kunder och mindre projekt från start till slut



  





**🔍 Utbildning, erfarenhet och personliga egenskaper** 




 Det här är inte "bara ett jobb". Det är en unik möjlighet att investera i din framtid – och att bli en nyckelspelare i ett bolag som växer. Du har ett ordentligt driv och vill omsätta ambition till verklighet, där du får möjlighet att visa vad du går för i en miljö där hårt arbete och engagemang faktiskt märks och belönas.
 



  





**Mer specifikt söker vi dig som:** 



* Har ett starkt intresse för IT och vill förstå hur system, verksamhet och teknik hänger ihop
* Gillar att lösa problem och vill bli riktigt vass på att felsöka och strukturera tekniska utmaningar
* Trivs i dialog med användare och kan förklara teknik på ett tydligt och enkelt sätt
* Är ansvarsfull, noggrann och ser till att saker blir gjorda – inte bara påbörjade
* Vill utvecklas snabbt, ta ansvar och bygga en långsiktig karriär inom tech
* Utbildning, erfarenhet från IT-support eller andra tekniska supportroller ses som ett plus men är inte ett krav



  





**Varför Scaly?** 



* Du får en unik möjlighet att växa in i avancerade tech-roller
* Du arbetar nära erfarna experter som du lär dig av på riktigt
* Du får snabbt eget ansvar och tydliga karriärvägar
* Du blir en del av ett engagerat team där prestation, vilja och driv uppmärksammas



  





**Övrig information** 



* Start: Enligt överenskommelse (med hänsyn till eventuell uppsägningstid)
* Plats: Stockholm, Strandvägen
* Lön: Enligt överenskommelse



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Den här tjänsten är en direktrekrytering vilket innebär att rekryteringsprocessen sker genom Bravura och du anställs direkt hos Scaly.
 



  





 Vi använder en kompetensbaserad metodik i alla rekryteringsprocesser för att säkerställa fördomsfria urval. Vi jobbar också med löpande urval, vilket innebär att vi tar ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har ansökt. Om du blir aktuell för tjänsten kommer vi att kontakta dig för en första telefonintervju. Oavsett om du går vidare i processen eller inte så kommer du att få återkoppling på din ansökan.
 



  





 Har du frågor? Hör gärna av dig!
 



 📧 info@bravura.se
 



 📞 010-171 47 10
 



  





 Vi rekommenderar att du skickar in din ansökan omgående då vi gör ett löpande urval.
 



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!
 



*#Nextgen*

title: Tekniker
description:
**Om Carla**
 Vi på Carla vill sätta en ny standard för hur man köper bil. Vårt mål är att det ska vara lika lätt och tryggt att köpa eller leasa en bil online, som allt annat man köper på nätet. Självklart ska alla bilar vara laddbara. Bolaget grundades 2020 i Stockholm och är nu i en spännande tillväxtfas och letar därför efter en nya härlig kollegor till vår anläggning i Kungsängen.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 En tekniker eller mekaniker utför reparationer, service och felsökning av lätta fordon. Dessutom kräver dagens bilar att du är proffs på elektronik och felsökning. Arbetet kräver kunskap inom mekanik, elektronik och IT. Moderna fordon består av ett stort antal ihopkopplade datorer, därför måste fordonsmekaniker vara datorsmarta. Kundkontakter blir allt vanligare vilket ställer krav på social kompetens. Inom Carla finns goda utvecklingsmöjligheter för dig som tekniker.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Service
* Reparationer
* Felsökning
* Däckbyte
* Demontering och montering av karossdelar inför och efter lackeringsarbete


**Meriterande egenskaper:**
 Fordonselektronik
   

  

 Felsöknings-/reparationsvana
   

  

 Fordonsteknik
   

  

 Fordonstillbehör
   

  

 Mekaniska reparationsarbeten
   

  

 Felsökning
   

  

**Omfattning**
 Heltid, provanställning 6 månader
   

  

**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har 2-3 års erfarenhet som fordonsmekaniker
* B-körkort
* Är flexibel i ditt arbetssätt och gillar att lära dig och bli bra på nya saker
* Gillar ordning och reda och arbetar strukturera
* Är en god kommunikatör och enkelt driver en tydlig dialog både i tal och skrift med ditt team och andra kollegor
* Gärna har någon erfarenhet av att arbeta med bilar eller ett intresse av det


 Ort: Stockholm, Kungsängen.
   

  

**Vad har vi att erbjuda dig?**
 Först och främst, så erbjuder vi en fantastisk möjlighet att ansluta till ett bolag som bygger en ny onlinemarknad, med starka värderingar, och en affärsmodell som ska vara hållbar på alla sätt. Utöver det så erbjuder vi:
   

  

* En möjlighet att skapa din egen väg på ett relativt nystartat bolag, men med möjligheten att växa och lära från duktiga, och trevliga medarbetare
* Möjligheten att jobba smartare, snarare än mer. Att få en balans i livet är en viktig del i att skapa resultat över en längre tid
* En arbetsplats som på riktigt tror på mångfald. Vi har anställt, och fortsätter anställa helt oberoende av etnisk bakgrund, utbildning, erfarenhet, sexuell läggning, och allt annat som borde vara självklart 2024
* Konkurrenskraftig och marknadsmässig ersättning


**Nu när du kommit såhär långt...**
* så kanske just du är vår nya kollega? Se då till att ansök idag! Urval och rekryteringsprocess sker löpande, så sök så snart du kan!

title: License Owner, Stockholm
description:
**Passionate about football (soccer) AND about business? Stranger Soccer is expanding to key cities around the world. We are looking for a License Owner to open and operate the Stranger Soccer business in Stockholm.**
 This is not your traditional management job - it is truly built for someone that wants to own and operate their own business (that happens to make the world's greatest sport accessible to everyone). This role is ideally suited for an adventurous and football-passionate entrepreneur.
   

  

**Sounds Like You?**
 As a next step, please visit www.strangersoccer.com and particularly the section Bring Stranger Soccer to your City to learn more about this dynamic opportunity.
 **If it appears to be a fit, and you wish to learn more, please fill out the form there to officially express your interest.** 
 Be sure to download and explore the Stranger Soccer mobile app as well.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Bring the Stranger Soccer brand and business to life for the assigned city
* Recruit, train, and lead a small central team (2-3 persons) as well as a few freelance Official Hosts (game hosts) to kick off the operation
* Identify and secure prime slots at football venues to run Stranger Soccer games
* Engage in creative sales and marketing digital and hands-onto ensure that customers are introduced to the platform as a convenient and preferred way to play
* Oversee a schedule of games, ensuring customers are delighted with each game they play, and keep coming back for more
* Take advantage of the strong backing and direction of Singapore headquarters, where an operations and technology team is ready to support you


**You should have**
* A passion for football, and a strong connection to your local football scene
* A business background, ideally in management and customer service
* An entrepreneurial background or spirit
* A commitment to owning, driving, and scaling the Stranger Soccer brand in the assigned market
* A hunger to succeed: financial compensation for this role will be proportionate to hard work, business acumen, and effectiveness


**About Stranger Soccer**
 With 3.5 billion football enthusiasts in over 200 countries, football is the most popular sport in the world. But why don't more people play it? Stranger Soccer (www.strangersoccer.com) makes playing football as easy as going for a jog or to the gym. Browse dozens of games on its acclaimed Mobile App. Book a slot. Turn up and play.
   

  

 Incorporated in 2017, Stranger Soccer has quickly transformed the sports & recreation scene in Singapore. In a few short years, it has grown to be the #1-way people play football and futsal in the country, amassing tens of thousands of registered users purchasing thousands of slots every week. Whether you call it Fussball, Fútbol, Calcio, or anything else, the world now awaits.
   

  

**Our Mission**
 To make playing football as easy as going for a jog.
   

  

**Our Vision**
 A world in which playing football is as popular and widespread as watching football.
   

  

**Got what it takes?**
**We encourage you to visit** 
 www.strangersoccer.com
 **to learn more about this dynamic opportunity, and to express your interest. Be sure to download and explore the Stranger Soccer mobile app as well. We look forward to meeting you.**

title: Förvaltningsledare IT-tjänster – Telge AB
description:
Välj Telge – här får du kombinera affärsmässighet med samhällsnytta och som medarbetare får du frihet under ansvar och möjlighet att påverka.
   

  

**Så här säger Per Berglund, rekryterande chef om rollen:**
 "Som förvalningsledare på Telge kommer du att ha roligt på jobbet. Du får trevliga kollegor och ett fartfyllt och utvecklingsorienterat jobb. Dessutom är det spännande att få vara med att utveckla arbetet tillsammans med vår driftleverantör."
   

  

 Uppdrag och kompetenskrav
   

  

 Som förvaltningsledare för IT-tjänster ansvarar du för att våra IT-tjänster fungerar och utvecklas. Du leder arbetet med tjänsteägare och ser till att vi har en gemensam plan för leveranser. Du följer upp leverantörer, optimerar licenser och säkerställer att tjänsterna håller hög kvalitet och fungerar stabilt för användarna.
   

  

 Du ser till att tjänsterna möter kundernas behov och utvecklar vårt tjänsteutbud. Tillsammans med IT-controllern sätter du mål och strategier och håller tjänstebeskrivningar aktuella. Du tar fram planer för framtida leveranser och bevakar omvärlden för att vidareutveckla tjänsterna.
   

  

 Eftersom Driften Sköts Av En Extern Leverantör Är Du Beställare Och Kravställare i Många Frågor. Du Driver Kampanjer För Nya Tjänster Och Funktioner Och Skapar Affärseffektiva Lösningar Med Tjänsteägarna. Rollen Omfattar Även Uppföljning Av Leverantörer Och Hantering Av Koncernens Microsoft-licenser. Som Person Ser Vi Att Du Är Strategisk, Drivande Och Relationsbyggande. Vidare Söker Vi Dig Som Har
   

  

* En akademisk utbildning inom IT, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande, alternativt arbetslivserfarenhet som vi bedömer som likvärdig.
* Minst fem års erfarenhet av arbete som förvaltningsledare eller i en liknande roll.
* Kunskap inom ITIL samt objektmodeller såsom PM3/XLPM, samt tjänsteförvaltning och avtalsstyrning.


**Välj Telge**
 Inom Telge finns alla möjligheter för dig att själv forma din framtid. Här finns det plats att växa, både i din yrkesroll och som människa. Telge är en arbetsplats med trygga anställningsvillkor. Du som anställd hos oss omfattas av kollektivavtal där viktiga saker som försäkringar och pension ingår.
   

  

 Här får du mindre pussel och mer liv. Att ha balans mellan arbetslivet och den privata sfären är viktig för ett hållbart liv. Så långt det är möjligt har vi flexibla arbetstider där var och en styr över sin tid. Vi har en rad förmåner som friskvårdsbidrag och möjlighet till löneväxling så att du kan växla in din lön mot extra tjänstepensionssparande.
   

  

 Läs mer om några av våra medarbetare som valt Telge: Vi valde Telge
   

  

**Mångfald inkludering och trygghet**
 Vi på Telge arbetar aktivt för mångfald och inkludering och välkomnar därför medarbetare med olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och kompetenser. En trygg och säker arbetsmiljö är vår högsta prioritet. Arbetspsykologiska tester ingår i våra rekryteringsprocesser till chefs- och specialisttjänster och vi genomför återkommande, slumpmässiga drogtester bland alla våra medarbetare.
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdatum**
 7 december 2025.
   

  

**Några frågor?**
 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten eller har frågor om rekryteringsprocessen? Då är det Per Berglund, operativ IT-chef, du ska kontakta på 08-55021364. Fackliga kontakter är vision@telge.se för Vision, Magnus Enderin för SACO, Jessica Borgen för Kommunal. Dessa nås på 08-550 220 00.
   

  

**Är du nyfiken på att läsa mer om oss?**
 Läs mer om oss som arbetsgivare: Jobba hos oss
   

  

 Läs mer om Telge AB

title: Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
**I hope you are doing good.** 




  





**Position – QA Automation Engineer** 




**Location – Stockholm, Sweden(Onsite)** 




**Experience - 5+ Years** 




**Language - English** 




**Duration - 6 months B2B Contract, It's extendable.** 




  





**Job Description**




 Develop and execute tests Create, execute, and maintain test plans and test cases for both manual and automated testing.Defect management Identify, document, and track defects, working with developers to resolve them.Collaboration Work with cross-functional teams, including developers, business analysts, and project managers, to understand requirements and ensure software quality.Test automation Develop automated test scripts using tools like Selenium, configure testing environments, and build automation frameworks.Reporting Analyze test results and report on test coverage and effectiveness.Regression testing Perform regression testing and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) to ensure new changes do not negatively impact existing functionality.Feedback Participate in design reviews and provide feedback from a testing perspective. QualificationsEducation A bachelors degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field is typically required.SkillsStrong analytical and problem-solving skills.Proficiency with automation tools like Selenium.Programming knowledge in languages such as Java or Python.Familiarity with test management software.Experience Experience in manual and automation testing, potentially gained through internships or entry-level positions, is valuable.Certifications Certifications like ISTQB can be beneficial.

title: Sales Manager B2B at Wolt
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 1000 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a
 **Sales Manager** 
 at Wolt, you’ll be at the forefront of our growth and we want you to be our deal-closer towards restaurants, retailers, and other local businesses. You’ll identify potential partners, pitch the value of Wolt, and work closely with merchants to onboard them successfully onto our platform.
   

  

 With solid product knowledge, you will clearly communicate how Wolt can strengthen businesses and provide tailored solutions to meet customer needs. In addition, you will work closely with other internal departments to ensure a smooth transition from sales to implementation and support.
   

  

**Who We Are Looking For**
 We are looking for a driven and experienced sales professional who is eager to take their career to the next level through hands-on sales success. At Wolt, ambition and impact matter most – and we believe your personality, track record, and ability to build strong relationships will define your success.
   

  

 This role is ideal for someone who has already demonstrated strong results in B2B sales and is excited to keep pushing for growth: building pipelines, closing deals, and exceeding targets.
   

  

**What you'll be doing:**
* Prospect, negotiate, and close partnerships with key merchants across multiple verticals (restaurants, retail, grocery.
* Drive and lead complex sales cycles with senior decision-makers
* Shape sales strategies and identify new growth opportunities in the market
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure smooth partner onboarding and long-term success
* Mentor and support junior sales colleagues by sharing best practices and expertise


 Our humble expectations
   

  

* 2–4 years of B2B sales experience, ideally in restaurant, retail, or related industries
* Proven track record in closing complex deals and achieving ambitious sales targets
* Excellent command of Swedish and English. Fluency in another language is a strong plus
* Willingness to travel extensively across Sweden, including overnight stays (up to 75% of working time)
* A driver’s license is not required, but considered a strong plus


 We will place great emphasis on your personal qualities – particularly your ability to combine drive and ambition with collaboration and leadership.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 At Wolt, you get the best of both worlds: the fast pace and opportunity of a scale-up combined with the stability and backing of a well-established company.
   

  

* A chance to shape the future of Wolt’s sales strategy in Sweden.
* A role where your ideas can make a direct impact.
* A competitive salary package and benefits.
* Ongoing coaching, clear goals, and opportunities to grow into broader leadership roles.


 Next steps
   

  

 If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Consulting Analyst
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 Visa Consulting and Analytics (VCA) is the consulting arm of Visa, and drives tangible, impactful results for clients. Drawing on our expertise in consulting, data analytics, digital marketing and economics, VCA solves the most strategic problems for our clients.
   

  





 As part of the Nordics & Baltics VCA team, you will support leading financial institutions, fintechs, and merchants across Sweden and the broader region. You will work closely with experienced consultants to deliver data-driven insights and strategic recommendations that help clients unlock growth opportunities, optimize performance, and navigate the evolving payments landscape. The role offers exposure to a diverse range of projects, from market entry strategies to digital transformation and risk management, providing a unique platform to develop your consulting and analytics skills in a dynamic, international environment.
   

  





**What it's all about..**



* Play an integral role on a team of experienced professionals in delivering strategic consulting services to key Visa clients in the Nordics
* Complete consulting engagements with other team members, including participating in interviews, analyzing confidential client data, and summarizing key findings
* Conduct industry research and identify internal and external data resources to create custom analytics
* Complete detailed analysis on client data and identify preliminary trends and themes in the data
* Develop client-specific presentations which address executive needs and deliver presentations to clients and internal Visa partners
* Play an integral role in the development of new consulting solutions and materials to train VCA team members
* Monitor industry trends and contribute to the development of whitepapers on the impact to clients



 This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 3 set days a week (Tuesday - Thursday), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.
   

  





  

  





 Visa is committed to creating an inclusive and accessible workplace. We welcome applications from individuals with disabilities and will provide reasonable accommodations as required by Swedish law.
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

**What we'd like from you -**




**Preferred Qualifications**



* Relevant experience, ideally from consulting, payments, or financial services.
* Payment industry, digital payments or payment processing experience preferred.
* Strategic and analytical thinking with a strong attention to detail that leverages multiple sources of information.
* Able to understand and start to disaggregate problem statement into distinct pieces of analysis.
* Use and adapt templates for unique client scenarios, optimizing structure to demonstrate + articulate key messages.
* Ability to execute quantitative & qualitative analysis with some guidance.
* Basic takeaways from the data + starting to craft storyline; ensure data quality + leverage data to support decision-making in project management.
* Strong team player with a willingness to collaborate across levels and functional experts.
* Strong multi-tasking skills and ability to adapt.
* Proficient and ideally a power-user of spreadsheet and presentation tools.
* An interest in learning advanced analytics tools (SAS, R, Tableau, etc.).
* An interest in payments, financial institutions or consumer lending a plus.
* An affinity for payments technology, FinTech and digital.



  

  

  

  




**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
Want to influence the bigger picture? At Saab, you can realise amazing innovations that keep people and societies safe. Together, we can truly make an impact – and your part matters.
   

  

 Your Role
   

  

 We’re seeking a highly motivated and engaged Financial Analyst to join our Global Business Control Team. This position offers a unique opportunity to work closely with a dedicated and collaborative team and the CFO as well as to play an important role in shaping Saab’s financial strategy. You will contribute by leading and supporting initiatives aimed at supporting company targets, while partnering with a broad range of internal stakeholders. This role is well suited for someone who enjoys analytical work, values continuous improvement, and thrives in an environment built on cooperation and shared success.
   

  

 As a Financial Analyst, your key responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Independently identify and drive group initiatives such as profit improvements or capital efficiency improvements
* Ad hoc analysis to support decision makings in General management team and Board
* Developing and maintaining models for strategic and financial analysis and simulation.
* Analyzing financial results, forecasts, and business plans across Saab’s Group, business areas, and market areas.
* Conducting internal and external benchmarking to ensure best practices and informed decision-making.
* Preparing clear and insightful reports and presentations for management and other stakeholders.
* Supporting the monthly closing process, as well as contributing to forecasting and business planning activities.


 At Saab, we are dedicated to developing innovative solutions that enhance security, stability, and efficiency worldwide. As part of our team, you’ll be joining a global company where continuous growth and career development are at the forefront. We believe in empowering our teams, and we provide an environment that fosters personal and professional growth, builds strong networks, and supports meaningful career progression.
   

  

 Your Profile
   

  

 We are looking for someone with strong analytical and communication as well as the ability to translate financial insights into clear, actionable recommendations. You combine a solid understanding of accounting principles with a proactive, collaborative approach. You feel comfortable taking initiative, guiding projects, and engaging with stakeholders at different levels of the organization.
   

  

 To succeed in this role, you should have:
   

  

* A minimum of 3 years of experience in financial analysis, financial or business controlling or a similar analytical role.
* relevant academic degree in economics, finance, or a related field.
* Experience as a controller in a large corporation or at Saab is considered an advantage
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office (especially Excel and PowerPoint). Experience with financial systems is an advantage.
* Fluency in both English and Swedish, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Strong business acumen and a strategic mindset, with the ability to communicate insights in a clear and collaborative way.


 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
   

  

 What you will be part of
   

  

 Explore a wealth of possibilities. Take on challenges, create smart inventions, and grow beyond. This is a place for curious minds, brave pioneers, and everyone in between. Together, we achieve the extraordinary, each bringing our unique perspectives. Your part matters.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 26,100 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

 Do you want to get to know our business and our people a little bit better? Here you can find some stories told by our employees.
   

  

 Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement.

title: Senior Frontend developer
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**
 We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose smoke-free enjoyment. How? By offering people other nicotine products online.
   

  

 Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with eleven store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches, Swedish style snus online as well as disposable vapes. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 300 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to smoke-free alternatives across all our markets globally.
   

  

**THE ROLE**
 We are looking for a Frontend Developer with 5+ years of experience to join one of our product teams with a focus on customer facing features. As part of our journey toward innovation and scaling, you’ll play an important role in building and optimizing the technical platform that drives our business.
   

  

 This is an exciting opportunity for a driven and collaborative developer who thrives in a fast-paced environment. You will contribute to developing and maintaining features for our e-commerce platform while growing your technical skills alongside experienced colleagues.
   

  

 We're highly focused on SEO, performance, and accessibility. Our frontend technologies are based on server side rendered razor views with functionality added through imperative TypeScript code.
   

  

 As part of our tech organization, you’ll step into a product team that thrives on collaboration and open dialogue. We foster a culture of curiosity and knowledge sharing, where every idea is valued and has the potential to shape the future.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop, implement, and maintain features for our e-commerce platform.
* Collaborate with the team and stakeholders to deliver quality solutions aligned with business needs.
* Contribute to platform optimization and performance improvements.
* Participate in team discussions and contribute innovative ideas for technical solutions.
* Embrace challenges, engage in continuous learning, and grow as a developer.


**What We Want From You**
 We want you to succeed and thrive within this role and our team. Here’s what we’re looking for:
   

  

* 5+ years of professional experience in frontend development and familiar with backend technologies.
* Proficiency in JavaScript, TypeScript, and modern frontend, and experience building modern frontend web solutions.
* Hands-on experience with SASS or LESS, and tools like Webpack.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to work effectively with technical and non-technical team members.
* Fluency in English, which is the working language at Haypp Group.


**Bonus Skills That Make You Stand Out:**
* Previous experience with .NET Core.
* Experience working with B2C e-commerce platforms or other consumer-facing applications.
* Knowledge of cloud services or DevOps practices.
* A willingness to take on new challenges and grow your technical expertise.


**What We Offer**
 We are a value driven company with our values
 *We team up* 
 ,
 *Innovation Drives Us* 
 ,
 *Inclusion and Non-Hierarchy* 
 and
 *Going the Extra Mile* 
 at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.
   

  

 Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:
   

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings


**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**
 If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application!
   

  

 Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Lea Sjösten at lea.sjosten@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Business Manager – Fiber to the Home
description:
*Do you want full ownership of a key business area with commercial responsibility, budget ownership, and the opportunity to work closely with decision-makers across the company? Are you excited by data, structure, and strategy and want to turn that into action across pricing, offering, and performance? Then you might be who we’re looking for.*
 As Business Manager for our Single Dwelling Unit (SDU) segment, you’ll have full commercial ownership of one of our most strategically key areas in Sweden. You’ll be responsible for what we sell, how we price it, and how the business performs with the numbers to match.
   

  

 This role works across the organization and interacts with senior stakeholders, without having direct reports. Instead, you influence through facts, insights, and clarity. If you like having broad responsibility and aren’t afraid to dig into both big strategy and operational questions, this is the right place for you.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Set the commercial strategy for SDU (Fiber-to-the-home) and define the product and price offering
* Own the P&L, budget and forecasting for your area
* Follow up on results and turn insights into actions
* Lead cross-functional projects and align with marketing, sales, operations, and other teams
* Build clear presentations and communicate with stakeholders across the company


**Why join us at Global Connect?**
 You’ll step into a business area that matters. The SDU segment is a large and important part of our Swedish business. It’s a role with high visibility, clear ownership, and real impact both commercially and organizationally. You’ll work with skilled people who are driven by clarity, facts, and delivering what we say we will.
   

  

 Our team is based in Stockholm and works in a hybrid way. We’re small in number but work widely across the company. The tempo is high, and the topics vary but if you enjoy structure and accountability, it’s a wonderful place to be.
   

  

**To Thrive In This Role, We Think You Bring**
* A university degree in business, economics, or engineering
* Experience with commercial strategy, pricing, P&L, budget and forecasting
* Experience leading cross-functional work or projects
* Confidence presenting and working with stakeholders in both Swedish and English
* Experience from telecom or fiber is a plus, but not a must.


**How To Apply**
 We don’t need a personal letter unless there’s something you’d like to explain that isn’t in your CV or LinkedIn profile. Just send in your application and let’s connect.
   

  

**About Us**
 GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
   

  

 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.

title: Designer - H&M Beauty
description:
**Job Description**

 H&M Beauty is on a bold journey to become the world’s most fashionable beauty destination. We're reimagining beauty through our elevated private label assortment—spanning makeup, fragrance, and tools—and complementing it with a curated selection of external beauty brands. Together, we offer customers the freedom to express themselves and complete their fashion looks with beauty that inspires.
   

  





 So, are you ready to shape the future of beauty? H&M Beauty’s Private Label team is on the lookout for a visionary Designer to help us redefine what beauty looks and feels like for our global customer.
   

  





 In this role, you’ll be at the heart of our design process – working hand-in-hand with our creative lead and assortment team to bring bold ideas to life. From beauty bags and accessories to product packaging, you’ll be instrumental in designing collections that excite, inspire, and push boundaries.
   

  





 We are looking for someone who is self-driven, highly motivated and has a hands-on global, curious mindset and genuine passion for Beauty and design, as well as upcoming trends in the landscape of fashion and beauty. You are well organized, love to collaborate across different teams and have a strong and clear communication style. You enjoy taking ownership and leading others while being flexible in your way of working. You are motivated by building collections, adapting, and finding new ways of working in a creative, highly entrepreneurial, and diverse environment
   

  





**Qualifications**



* BA/MA qualification in Fashion/ Packaging design


* Current experience working as a Product, Packaging, or Fashion Designer.


* A visionary mindset with true passion for and understanding of Beauty products, current and future trends for the young women’s customer


* Strategic thinker with a commercial mindset and customer-first approach


* Strong eye for product design, materials, colors, and finishes


* Agile entrepreneurial mindset and adaptable to fast changes in a start-up like environment


* Strong self drive and able to make fast decisions


* True team player with strong communication skills


* Organized & structured


* Excellent communication & presentations skills in English, written and verbal


* Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite



**Additional information**




 This is a temporary 1 year position to start as soon as possible based in Stockholm. Do these challenges and qualifications apply to you? Please send your CV & relevant portfolio, in English. The assessment process will start immediately so please apply as soon as possible!
   

  





**Benefits**
  

 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here. In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  





**Inclusion & Diversity**
  

 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process. We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  





**Why join us?**
  

 At H&M Beauty, we’re not just designing products – we’re creating experiences. You’ll be part of a fast-moving, forward-thinking team where creativity meets purpose, and where your ideas have the power to shape what’s next in beauty. If you’re ready to make your mark and grow in a global, bold, and inclusive environment – we’d love to meet you.

title: Young Potential Trainee Program - Product Research and Development
description:
We’re looking for curious, driven people who want to help shape a better tomorrow. At Scania, we’re on a mission to make transport more sustainable — for businesses, society, and the planet.
   

  

 Do you want to be a part of it?
   

  

**About Us**
 We believe great leadership starts with learning and collaboration. “The Scania Way” is our culture — built on values, openness, and trust. Here, you’ll be encouraged to grow, take ownership, and use your unique strengths to make a real impact.
   

  

 If you want to know more about our work culture you can find more information here: Diversity and inclusion | Scania Group, Meet our people | Scania Group
   

  

 We also offer a wide range of employee benefits, which you can read more about here: Scania Offers
   

  

**The Program**
 Embark on a 15-month journey of growth, leadership, and global experience—starting 17th of August 2026 at our Head Office in Södertälje.
   

  

**Here’s what awaits you:**
* A full-time position from day one Your home base will likely be one of our Södertälje offices, with flexibility for remote work depending on your role and preferences.
* Four dynamic rotations across Scania—both in Sweden and internationally Gain hands-on experience through four 2–3 month assignments in diverse departments, including cross-brand collaboration and a Scania Distributor rotation.
* Nine weeks of immersive leadership training Develop your leadership mindset through tailored sessions designed to elevate your impact and confidence with a strong foundation in the Scania Leadership Principle's.
* Collaborative projects and networking with fellow trainees Work on real-world challenges and build lasting connections with peers across the organization.
* A dedicated mentor to guide your development Receive personalized support and insights from an experienced leader throughout your journey.
* Shared projects and network assignments with your trainee year group Strengthen teamwork and broaden your perspective through joint initiatives.
* A program where you take the lead Shape your own path with the support of your mentor and managers—your growth, your way.


 You’ll get to explore Scania and the TRATON GROUP, build global connections, and learn how to lead yourself — and others — with purpose.
   

  

**Our Future Trainee**
 You’re into leadership and want to keep evolving. You care about sustainability and want to help us push that even further. Most of all, you’re excited to work with others and make amazing things happen.
   

  

**Minimum requirements to apply for the Young Potential Trainee Program 2026:**
* You hold a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in related areas within the area of Product Research and Development.
* You have graduated between 2024 and the summer of 2026.
* You have a maximum of 2 years of professional experience within your field of studies at the start of the program.
* You speak and write English fluently and other languages are seen as an advantage.
* You must be an EU/EES citizen or hold a permanent residence permit in Sweden to comply with migration laws, due to the fact that some assignments during the program will take place outside of Sweden for a minimum of three months.


 In addition to meeting the minimum requirements, we value candidates who bring extra drive and initiative. Previous leadership experience in student unions, sports clubs, housing associations or similar organizations is highly appreciated, as it shows your ability to take responsibility and inspire others. Having worked part-time in areas such as project management, event coordination, or customer service is also a strong asset. These experiences reflect your ability to collaborate, communicate, and adapt in dynamic environments. Whether you've led a team, organized an event, or supported customers, you've already demonstrated key skills that will help you thrive in our trainee program. We’re looking for individuals who take initiatives and enjoy working with others to make things happen.
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
 To ensure a smooth and fair selection process,
 **it’s important that you are ready and available online on the specified dates** 
 . All steps will be conducted digitally, and unfortunately, we are unable to offer individual time slots or alternative dates. Your participation during the scheduled times is essential for us to move forward effectively.
   

  

  

* Online Tests: 7–11 January 2026 If selected, the recruitment process begins with a web-based psychometric test who are designed to ensure an unbiased and fair screening. These tests will be sent to all applicants who meet our basic requirements and help us assess your potential and suitability for the program.
* Interviews: 22–29 January 2026 If selected, you’ll be invited to a 45–60-minute digital interview where we explore your professional interests and personal competencies.
* Assessment Days: 10 or 11 February 2026 If selected, you’ll be invited to one of these dates for a full-day online assessment depending on the business area.


 We begin by reviewing your test results, followed by your CV, formal education, and previous experience. A background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

**Application**
 A complete application includes CV and a summary of grade records or your degree certificate. If you currently study outside of Sweden or have a foreign degree from your highest studies, you need to get your degree verified by the Swedish Council for Higher Education. Please visit https://www.uhr.se/ to get recognition for your foreign qualifications. Note that this process can take up to six months. Incomplete applications will not be processed.
   

  

 For questions regarding the program or the process please contact: trainee@scania.com.
   

  

**Please apply to the area of competence that suits your interests and profile, there is one job ad for each business area. When you apply, only choose one business area. Otherwise, we will not be able to handle your application. Learn more about the different Business Area and the program HERE.**
***Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2026-01-06. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period.***

***We look forward to receiving your application!***

title: Marketing Specialist, Nordics
description:
Datasite and its associated businesses are the global center for facilitating economic value creation for companies across the globe. From data rooms to AI deal sourcing
   

  

 and more. Here you’ll find the finest technological pioneers: Datasite, Blueflame AI, Firmex, Grata, and Sherpany. They all, collectively, define the future for business growth.
   

  

 Apply for one position or as many as you like. Talent doesn’t always just go in one direction or fit in a single box. We’re happy to see whatever your superpower is and find the best place for it to flourish.
   

  

 Get started now, we look forward to meeting you.
   

  

**Job Description**
**Essential Duties & Responsibilities**
* Localize and execute the marketing plan for the Nordics based on the EMEA Marketing strategy and plan.
* Drive demand generation in Nordics, both offline and online.
* Optimize and measure the success of the different activities and initiatives.
* Report on the impact of leads, opportunities, cost per lead, cost per opportunity and the overall return on marketing investment.


**Personal Attributes**
* Ability to work productively within a virtual team environment as well as independently.
* Flexible and adaptable in approach.
* Ability to build strong working relationships, especially with the local sales team.
* Ability to collaborate across functions and regions within a multicultural environment.
* Initiative-taking, flexible, quick to adjust, and focused on execution and results.


**Skills**
* Fluency in English (written & spoken).
* Good understanding of the right and most effective marketing mix and channels in Nordics including events, conferences, email, web, social media, search, and display.
* Events and conferences management.
* Digital savviness in terms of executing local campaigns over different tools and channels.
* Experience with CRM (e.g. salesforce), marketing, and social media tools is an advantage (e.g. Pardot, LinkedIn and Sitefinity).
* Persuasive communication and people skills - written and verbal.
* Propensity to respond to deadlines ahead of schedule.
* Meticulous and analytical with strong planning skills.
* Strong organizational skills
* Experience collaborating with external partners and suppliers.
* Ability to demonstrate a high degree of confidentiality, discretion, and professionalism.
* PC proficiency with Microsoft Office 365 applications knowledge (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams, and SharePoint).


**Qualifications**
* A bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in marketing, communications, business, or related fields is desirable.
* A master’s degree in marketing or related fields is an advantage.


**Knowledge & Experience**
* Minimum 2-5 years’ experience in marketing, preferably in a similar position and within a global organization.
* Basic knowledge of B2B marketing.
* Previous experience in a technology SaaS company would be a great advantage, ideally in the financial services/legal sectors.
* Candidates must have full eligibility to work in the UK or Sweden without any restrictions.


 Our company is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workforce where all individuals are respected and valued. We are an equal opportunity employer and make all employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other protected characteristic. We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and are dedicated to building teams that reflect the diversity of our communities.

title: Customer Support Specialist
description:
Do you want to develop your skills in the IT field, thereby contributing to the development of contactless, mobile, and environmentally friendly transport solutions? Do you consider yourself a good problem solver, enjoy helping people, and want to help them find the best solutions? If you answered yes to these questions, then Ridango offers you the opportunity to take your knowledge to a new level, being close to the creation of complex systems and providing top-level user support to our international partners.
 



  





 We are looking for a
 **Customer Support Specialist** 
 to join our team, who will help our business customers and end-users find solutions to questions and technical problems related to public transport ticketing and real-time solutions.
 



  





  





**THIS POSITION IS FOR YOU IF:** 



* You want to advise and help business customers in matters related to our public transport ticketing system, real-time system, and hardware in the bus.
* You consider it important to offer the best service to customers and can put yourself in a customer’s position before replying to the inquiries.
* You are interested in IT systems and finding smart solutions to technical problems, with experience and understanding of REST API and SQL.
* You are well-prepared to sift through application and device logs to identify and resolve problems.
* You have experience working with Jira and are ready to create new documentation and update the outdated ones.
* You are interested in thoroughly testing the solutions provided to the customers to understand the logic and provide informed feedback.
* **You are fluent in Estonian, Swedish and English language** 
 in speech and writing (C1). Additional languages would be of great benefit!
* You have an active personality and are a skilled time manager who understands and can align with the company’s priorities.
* You have at least secondary education
* You feel comfortable with managing and coordinating incident and problem resolution by involving necessary parties in the discussion
* You are ready to be on on-call duty and act on incident resolution when it is needed



  





**WE OFFER:** 



* An opportunity to participate in high-impact system development with a combination of hardware and software that influence millions of people globally.
* Dynamic and challenging work in a growing international technology company.
* Passionate and experienced leaders. A company culture that empowers people and where each employee’s contribution counts and is valued.
* Opportunity to grow together with an ambitious and expanding company filled with supportive and positive people.
* Competitive compensation package recognizing your skills, accomplishments, and performance.
* A modern work environment with free fruits, candies, coffee, tea, etc.
* Passion, fun, and power to make public transportation more convenient to use.



  




* Embark on a journey with us to revolutionize public transport. Apply now and be part of reshaping the way the world moves!

title: Performance Marketing Specialist
description:
Acne Studios is a progressive luxury house and through collaboration and curiosity, we set high aspirations and strive for excellence. We value everyone’s contribution and embrace feedback to develop ourselves and others. We aim to minimise our environmental impact across all our operations and to address societal challenges in the way we conduct our business.
   

  

 As a Performance Marketing Specialist, you’ll be part of the e-commerce team, reporting to the Digital Marketing Manager. You’ll collaborate closely with internal teams and external partners to deliver data-driven campaigns that enhance customer acquisition, drive online sales and elevate the shopping experience across global markets.
   

  

 CULTURE OF COLLABORATION
   

  

 We firmly believe that when you feel supported, included, and trusted, it enables you to enjoy your work and thrive in it. You will be a part of a team of colleagues with diverse roles and backgrounds, each with their unique skills and experiences.
   

  

 WHAT YOU WILL DO
   

  

 As a Performance Marketing Specialist at Acne Studios, you will execute and optimize lower-funnel paid search, shopping, affiliate, and paid social campaigns across global markets to drive qualified traffic and convert customers. You will handle budget on a day-to-day basis to ensure strong ROI, while continuously monitoring performance data to optimize channel efficiency.
   

  

 Using digital analytics and reporting, you will surface actionable insights to improve conversion performance and identify new opportunities for incremental growth - contributing directly to a high-performing, data-driven digital funnel that supports both short-term results and long-term brand success
   

  

 Key areas of responsibility include (but are not limited to):
   

  

* Plan, execute, and optimize paid search, shopping, affiliate and paid social campaigns across global markets to drive profitable traffic and conversions
* Manage performance marketing budgets with a strong focus on ROI, efficiency and brand integrity
* Analyze campaign data and user behavior to uncover insights, improve targeting and enhance the digital customer journey
* Collaborate cross-functionally with e-commerce, CRM and creative teams to align campaigns with business goals and brand messaging
* Monitor and report on campaign performance, sharing key learnings and recommendations with internal stakeholders
* Oversee and manage product catalogues and feeds for social and search channels in close collaboration with the E-commerce and Social Media team
* Conduct research using Google Analytics or other tools to find new opportunities and customer segments to improve campaign targeting
* Effectively track campaigns within existing analytics platforms, to ensure consistent and accurate reporting


 WHO YOU ARE
   

  

 You have high aspirations and focus on details that create substantial impact. You enjoy working as a team and you embrace feedback to develop yourself and others. You are curious and thrive in a dynamic environment. Cooperation, respect, and clear communication are important, along with your ambition to learn and grow. If these qualities speak to you, we would love to have you on our team.
   

  

 Specific personal qualities for this role:
   

  

* Growth-minded with a strong grasp of performance metrics and business impact
* Curious and proactive, always exploring new trends and contributing fresh ideas
* Analytical, detail-oriented, and structured in your approach
* Adaptable and thrives in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment
* Passionate about culture, with a strong interest in the luxury and fashion industries


 Specific experience and knowledge for this role:
   

  

* 3+ years of hands-on experience in performance marketing, ideally within luxury fashion, retail, e-commerce, or media/advertising agencies
* Proven ability to manage media budgets and optimize for both short- and long-term performance outcomes
* Strong analytical skills with experience in developing paid media plans, managing timelines, and interpreting campaign data
* High proficiency in platforms such as Google Analytics, Google Ads, Meta Ads Manager, Merchant Center, and Commerce Manager
* Familiarity with A/B testing and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker Studio)
* Experience with audience segmentation and targeting strategies
* Familiarity with CRO and SEO is a strong plus
* Technical know-how in campaign setup, tag management (GTM), and reporting via Google Analytics 360 or BigQuery
* Fluent in English, with excellent communication skills


 What matters most to us is not whether you master all the listed knowledge and skills. We are dedicated to recognising the potential in each individual. We embrace diversity of people as well as ideas and viewpoints and encourage everyone's individual expression of their own identity.

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
**Senior Backend Engineer (Go, Kotlin, Java, C#) – High-Impact Role in SaaS Scaleup** 




 Help build the backbone of industrial traceability
 



  





**About ChainTraced** 




 ChainTraced provides a SaaS platform that makes it possible to share product data efficiently and securely across the entire value chain, from raw material all the way to end customer. Our customers are industrial companies that rely on metals in their production, and they use ChainTraced to streamline quality and sustainability data collection and to strengthen relationships with both suppliers and customers.
 



 Regulations around CO₂ and traceability are increasing every year. That creates a very concrete need for what we build. ChainTraced is backed by strong industrial investors, has paying customers and a clear long term demand for the product. In practical terms, that means a stable role in a company with a bright future.
 



 We are a small team based in central Stockholm. You work close to the code, close to the product and directly with the CTO. Decisions are made quickly and the distance from idea to production is short.
 



  





**Tech stack today** 




 Go
 



 PostgreSQL
 



 Redis
 



 AWS
 



 React with TypeScript
 



 Extensive automated testing with a modern CI/CD pipeline
 



  





**The role** 




 We are looking for a Senior Backend Engineer who wants to own a large part of the backend and be a technical partner to the CTO. You will join a small, experienced team where your decisions have direct impact on architecture, performance and how the platform evolves over time.
 



 The role is primarily backend focused. There is a React codebase in place, so the ability to read and maintain frontend code is helpful, but your main home will be Go, databases and cloud infrastructure.
 



 You get a permanent position with a safe base salary, qualified stock options and a very flexible way of working. The culture is based on freedom with responsibility, trust and close collaboration rather than heavy processes.
 



  





**What you will do** 




 • Design and implement backend code in Go together with the CTO
 



 • Design and implement frontend functionality in React together with the CTO
 



 • Work with PostgreSQL and Redis to model data, optimise queries and keep the system fast as volumes grow
 



 • Take ownership of availability, scalability and performance in a cloud environment on AWS
 



 • Improve and extend our CI/CD pipelines and automated tests
 



 • Collaborate with customers and internal stakeholders when technical input is needed
 



 • Help shape coding standards, architecture and ways of working in a small engineering team
 



  





**Who you are** 




 You enjoy working close to both product and infrastructure, and you are comfortable taking ownership in a small team. You like clear responsibility, but also the safety of a stable company with a long term mission.
 



  





 We believe that you:
 



 • Have several years of experience as a backend engineer in product companies or complex platforms
 



 • Are strong in at least one statically typed language such as Go, Java, Kotlin, Rust or C# in modern cloud based environments
 



 • Have solid experience with relational databases, preferably PostgreSQL
 



 • Have worked with cloud platforms, ideally AWS, including infrastructure, monitoring and operations
 



 • Are used to CI/CD and care about testing and safe releases
 



 • Can collaborate closely with a CTO and enjoy being a sounding board on technical decisions
 



 • Feel comfortable in English, both spoken and written
 



 Experience from React or TypeScript is a plus, but not a requirement as long as you are willing to learn what is needed to maintain and improve the existing frontend.
 



  





**What ChainTraced offers** 




 • Permanent full time position in a company with clear product market fit and strong industrial investors
 



 • Salary in the range of 55 000 to 65 000 SEK per month depending on experience
 



 • Qualified stock option program that lets you share in the upside if the company grows as planned
 



 • Very flexible way of working with a super hybrid setup, office in central Stockholm and high trust in remote work
 



 • Flexible working hours that make it easier to combine work and life
 



 • Thirty days of paid vacation
 



 • Wellness allowance and the equipment you need to do a great job
 



 • Breakfast and lunch available at the office on office days
 



 • A key role close to the CTO where you influence architecture, stack and direction of the platform
 



  





**The process** 




 The recruitment process is designed to be straightforward and focused on mutual fit.
 



 • Initial chat, about fifteen minutes, with the external recruiter to align expectations
 



 • Technical discussion with the CTO, around forty five minutes, focusing on your experience and our current architecture
 



 • Practical technical assessment, preferably as a pair programming session on site, where you lead the problem solving
 



 • Final discussion about offer, terms and next steps
 



  





**Interested** 




 Apply through LinkedIn or reach out directly.
 



 Recruitment for this role is handled by Thurne Consulting.
 



  





 If you have questions, contact:
 



 Filip Andén, recruitment consultant
 



 filip@thurneco.se
 



 +46 70 017 22 05

title: Mainframe application Database Administrator for DB2 | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Do you want to create innovative solutions in a global environment and collaborate with experts to meet business needs?
   

  

 SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From COBOL to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Mainframe application Database Administrator, you will be part of the Database Solutions expert group at the Mainframe & IBMi tribe, providing the required database support for the application teams around the bank. In your role, you will:
   

  

 Drive the incoming request from the application teams. Work with data modelling (physical and logical models) and maintain database models. Design, develop and manage databases in a mainframe environment. Provide design suggestions, perform SQL reviews and performance tuning checks. Do index reviews and suggestions. Proactive identification of CPU consuming SQLs. Implementation of the Db objects in Test and Production.
   

  

 To thrive in this role, we believe you have
   

  

* Previous experience working as a Mainframe application Database administrator for DB2, if you also know DL/1 that is meriting.
* Familiarity with Mainframe environment.
* Experience of COBOL development.
* Great knowledge on Db2 for z/OS.
* Experience of working with SQL.
* Analytical skills and knowledge to handle complex information.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to take ownership.
* Great communication skills and fluency in English.


 As a person we believe you to be driven, structured and take responsibility for your work and result. A team player that is happy to share your knowledge while you are curious and take advantage of the skills around you. You are passionate about Mainframe and have a strong will to develop. Through your previous experiences you have learned to analyze problems and find solutions while also daring to challenge old methods.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views.
* Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits.
* Agile and modern ways of working.
* Remote working possibilities and flexible work schedule.


 Ready to take the next step on your career journey?
   

  

 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 25th of December 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Saara Vallo Hansen at saara.vallo.hansen@seb.se.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment

title: STORE MANAGER
description:
At Mango, we inspire and unite through our passion for style and culture. We are present in 118 countries and our online presence extends to more than 80 countries. In our team we are proactive and dynamic, with communication skills and we are always open to new challenges. We are a young and multicultural team, we love the good vibes we have and we work together to achieve results. We are informed about the trends and current events in the retail world.
 



  





 For one of our
 **MANGO stores in Stockholm,** 
 we are currently recruiting for a
 **temporary full-time Store Manager** 
 to join our team.
 



  





 Reporting to the Area Manager, you will be responsible for the general running of your store. You will ensure that sales targets are exceeded, customer service is at its highest level and the store image is impeccable. You will be responsible for leading and motivating your team and maintaining an atmosphere that is always active and pleasant.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* To plan, apply and monitor the required measures in order to reach and exceed sales targets
* To analyze and review management indicators and costs in order to improve them
* To be familiar with the collection, and control and manage the stock to maximize sales
* To act as a role model and promote effective communication within the team
* To recruit, train and ensure the seamless integration of the new employees
* To lead and motivate the team, ensuring the development of staff potential
* To plan, organise, prioritise and distribute tasks, optimising resources and minimising costs



  





**What are we looking for? / Required Profile / About you** 




  





 We are looking for an individual with relevant experience in managing a dynamic store within the fashion retail industry.
 



  





 You should be self-motivated, inspire your team to work well as a team leading by example and deliver outstanding results.
 



  





 You should have a proven ability to maximise profitability. Sales-oriented, organised and tenacious, you are a problem solver, able to work well under pressure and adapt to changes.
 



  





 If you like sharing responsibility, developing both professionally and personally, and wants to grow in a dynamic fashion retail company in full expansion, then this is your opportunity!
 



  





**What Makes Us Special** 




  




* You will be part of a leading company in the fashion industry, dynamic and in full innovation.
* Close, inspiring and ambitious work environment.
* Discount on all our lines (Woman, Man, Kids & Teen, Home and Accessories).
* Constant development opportunities with varied challenges that generate on-the-job learning.
* Stable position within a well-established company in retail industry



  





 Do you want to know more about the role? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bS9CMtRrKh4
 



  





**You got it? We like you!** 




  





**Join our team!**

title: VISUAL MERCHANDISER
description:
At Mango, we inspire and unite through our passion for style and culture. We are present in 118 countries and our online presence extends to more than 80 countries. In our team we are proactive and dynamic, with communication skills and we are always open to new challenges. We are a young and multicultural team, we love the good vibes we have and we work together to achieve results. We are informed about the trends and current events in the retail world.
 



  





 For one of our
 **MANGO stores in Stockholm,** 
 we are currently recruiting for a
 **full-time Visual Merchandiser** 
 to join our team. You will be responsible for displaying the product in a commercial and fashionable manner in accordance with Mango standards in order to maximise sales.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* To be responsible for the store image at all times, ensuring that it is attractive and commercial.
* To apply the visual merchandising standards and guidelines
* To perform store changes in a quick and orderly manner
* To be aware of sales figures and performance indicators to take product-based measures accordingly
* To be aware of the customer profile, the product potential and the commercial strategies of competitors
* To communicate with the team about new products, merchandising changes and make suggestions regarding out-of-stock garments
* To continuously report to the management team and support them in specific managerial store duties



  





**What are we looking for? / Required Profile / About you** 




  




* You are results driven and sales oriented with a solid merchandising experience within a fashion environment.
* You are passionate about fashion, have great communication skills and the ability to work well both as part of a team and alone.
* You have the ability to prioritise and adapt. You are detail oriented, and work well under pressure, within strict deadlines and short notice.
* If you like sharing responsibility, developing both professionally and personally, and wants to grow in a dynamic fashion retail company in full expansion, then this is your opportunity!



  





**What Makes Us Special** 




  




* You will be part of a leading company in the fashion industry, dynamic and in full innovation.
* Close, inspiring and ambitious work environment.
* Discount on all our lines (Woman, Man, Kids & Teen, Home and Accessories).
* Constant development opportunities with varied challenges that generate on-the-job learning.
