title: Finance Manager
description:
Arex Advisor is an expert service provider in life science. We work with pharma, biotech and medtech projects from development to commercialisation.
 



 Arex Advisor was founded in 2020 on the basis of over 20 years of experience in pharma and biotech entrepreneurship.
 



 Today, Arex Advisor is a group of companies with offices in Stockholm, Lund and Basel, Switzerland comprising 40 professionals with expertise in regulatory affairs, quality assurance, pharmacovigilance and market access
 



 Arex Advisor is on a growth journey, expanding our international presence from the base of our Sweden and Switzerland. As we gear up for further global expansion, our finance team is at the heart of both operational and strategic decision-making—playing a key role in driving the business forward.
 



 We are now looking for a finance professional to join our highly integrated finance team. At Arex, finance is not a back-office function; it is a core part of our business, working closely with colleagues across all departments and countries. You will be part of a high-paced, professional, and collaborative environment where your contributions truly matter.
 



  





 Job description
 



 We are looking for a finance professional to join our team at our headquarters in Stockholm.
 



 In this role, you will be an integral part of the Arex finance team, managing day-to-day accounting operations and performing regular reconciliations. You will handle payroll-related postings and play an active role in both monthly and annual closing processes.
 



 Your responsibilities will also include supporting budget monitoring and conducting cost analysis for various projects, as well as collaborating closely with project managers to provide essential administrative and financial support.
 



 We are looking for someone with a genuine interest in financial systems and a passion for the development of automation and AI solutions within finance. This position offers a mix of operational and strategic responsibilities, providing valuable exposure to all aspects of the finance function within a dynamic organization.
 



 Tasks and responsibilities include, but is not limited to, the following:
 


* Manage day-to-day accounting operations
* Handle payroll-related postings and actively participate in monthly and annual closings
* Support budget monitoring and conduct cost analysis for projects
* Collaborate closely with project managers, providing essential administrative and financial support
* Drive improvements in financial systems



  
 



 We assume that you are comfortable in a dynamic and changing environment. You will be likely to have a lot of internal and external contacts working together with colleagues, clients and authorities. Arex is a small flexible organization, characterized by quick decision-making, entrepreneurial spirit and scientific expertise. We offer flexible working hours and a competitive benefits package.
 



  





*Qualifications and skills* 



* Academic degree in finance or administration
* Experience from accounting K2/K3 standards
* Strong communication skills
* Good accuracy and attention to detail
* Oral and written proficiency in Swedish and English
* A genuine interest in automation and AI solutions



  





  
 *Considered an advantage:* 



* Experience from an international environment, preferably experience from Swiss accounting and payroll
* Experience working with Visma.net
* Experience in financial reporting and accounting IFRS standards



  
 



 Does this sound interesting? Apply directly through Linkedin or send your CV in English or Swedish to jobs@arexadvisor.com.
 



 If you have any questions about the role, please contact CFO Emelie Terenius on
 



 +46 8 519 345 14 or e-mail emelie.terenius@arexadvisor.com
 



  





*Please note that Arex does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from candidates.* 




*Arex will not consider unsolicited referrals and/or resumes from any recruitment agencies or fee-based referral services. Unsolicited referrals and resumes sent to Arex are deemed gratuitous and Arex is not obligated to pay any kind of referral fee.*

title: Electronics & Electrical Systems Engineer
description:
**About the Role** 




 Rebaba builds circular battery systems from second-life EV batteries. Our products power buildings, industries, and charging sites while reducing costs and emissions. We design and assemble our systems in Sweden and combine hardware, embedded electronics, and control with a strong mission: democratising access to clean, affordable and modern energy for all.
 



  





 We are now hiring an
 **Electronics & Electrical Systems Engineer** 
 who wants to lead both the electronics and the electrical design that sit at the core of our technology. 
 



  





 You will design and build the circuit boards and electrical architecture that make our battery systems safe, robust, and manufacturable. Your work will span from microcontroller-level hardware to high-voltage interfaces, protection design, and EMC. This is a hands-on role where you own electronics and electrical design from concept, through schematics and layout, into lab testing and field deployment.
 



  





 If you want to build technology that accelerates the energy transition and see your work deployed in the real world, we would love to hear from you.
 



  





**What you will do** 



* Design and iterate PCB hardware for our battery control units, including sensing, communication, power electronics interfaces, and protective circuits.
* Work with microcontrollers at pin-level detail: GPIO mapping, CAN transceivers, communication interfaces, start/stop/reset, emergency stop, and diagnostic inputs.
* Take responsibility for the overall electrical design of the system: from battery and inverter connections to distribution, protection, and grounding.
* Create and maintain electrical schematics and wiring diagrams for both low-voltage and high-voltage parts of the system.
* Design for EMC and safety: grounding strategies, filtering, clearances and creepages, segregation of HV and LV, and practical measures to reduce noise and interference.
* Collaborate with mechanical engineers to ensure that layouts, clearances, cable routing, and enclosures support safe and maintainable installations.
* Work closely with software and embedded engineers so that electronics and firmware are aligned, testable, and debuggable.
* Support lab and field tests: bring-up, measurement campaigns, failure analysis, and design improvements based on real data.



  





**Who you are** 



* You have an exceptional track record of building things.
* You are eager to learn.
* You have designed real hardware and electrical systems before and understand what happens when theory meets the shop floor.
* You are confident in PCB design and enjoy owning the full chain: schematic, layout, prototyping, testing, and iteration.
* You think in terms of full electrical systems: currents, faults, fault paths, selectivity, cable sizing, earthing, and safety concepts.
* You are comfortable around high-voltage DC and AC, and you treat it with both respect and engineering structure.
* You enjoy being in the lab with real hardware: meters, scopes, loads, test rigs, and actual cabinets rather than just CAD models.
* You like understanding failure modes and designing for robustness: EMC, transients, heat, vibration, and installer mistakes.
* You are entrepreneurial: you have built things before, taken ownership, and are motivated by seeing your designs end up in real installations.
* You want to help shape a product area and continuously develop it, not just execute tasks from a spec.



**Bonus points** 



* Experience with battery systems, BMS, or power electronics.
* Knowledge of CE, UL, or IEC requirements for electronics and electrical systems.
* Experience with high-voltage DC systems or EV battery modules.
* Experience designing electronics for harsh environments.



**What we offer** 



* A central role in shaping both the electronics and the electrical architecture of our circular battery systems.
* Ownership from day one, with direct influence on safety, reliability, and serviceability of our products.
* A hardware-focused environment where your work is visible in real installations at customer sites.
* A mission-driven team building sustainable energy technology in Sweden, with ambition to scale across markets.



  





**Role Info** 




**Job Title** 




 Electronics & Electrical Systems Engineer
 



**Employment Type** 




 Full-time
 



**Location** 




 Stockholm, Sweden
 



**Workplace Model** 




 On-site with flexibility (hands-on hardware work required)
 



**Start Date** 




 As soon as possible
 



**Contract Type** 




 Permanent employment
 



**Salary** 




 Fixed monthly salary
 



 Possible equity for exceptional candidates
 



**Working Language** 




 English (Swedish helpful but not required)
 



**Required Experience Level** 




 Exceptional builder
 



**Core Responsibilities** 




 PCB design, electrical system design, HV integration, protection and grounding strategy, EMC design, lab validation, component selection, supplier technical evaluation
 



**Technical Skills** 




 PCB design (KiCad/Altium), embedded hardware, CAN/SPI, HV/LV electrical design, protective devices (breakers, fuses, contactors), EMC/EMI, grounding schemes, wiring architecture, design reviews
 



**Travel Requirements** 




 Occasional site visits to deployments and test environments
 



**Recruitment Contact** 




 Felix Kruse
 



 CTO & Co-founder
 



 careers@rebaba.se
 



 Application Process
 



 Send your CV & a short motivation that says why you are an exceptional builder and where your passion is
 



 via our webpage (link: https://rebaba.se/careers/electronics-electrical-systems-engineer)
 



**Screening Process** 




 1) Intro call
 



 2) Technical interview
 



 3) Practical work test
 



 4) Final meeting + offer
 



 We are interviewing on a rolling basis and will fill the roll as soon as possible.
 



  





**Recruitment Contact** 




 Felix Kruse
 



 CTO & Co-founder
 



 careers@rebaba.se for any questions regarding the role or the process.

title: Personal Growth & Leadership Development Consultant – Remote & Flexible
description:
Are you seeking a professional shift into a purpose-driven, digitally enabled career where your work directly contributes to meaningful personal change for others—while also creating a new income pathway for yourself?
   

  

 This remote opportunity is not a traditional coaching role or a client-by-client practice. Instead, it is a structured digital business pathway where you support individuals through proven personal and leadership development programs, using established online systems, training, and mentorship.
   

  

 We are a global organisation operating in the leadership education and personal development industry, with over 15 years of experience delivering structured learning systems, professional mentorship, and values-led leadership pathways worldwide.
   

  

**What This Role Offers**
* 100% remote work with flexible scheduling
* Independent contractor engagement with performance-based remuneration
* Structured onboarding using established digital business, marketing, and leadership systems
* Weekly mentorship, leadership training, and professional development sessions
* A supportive, values-led international community
* A long-term digital business model aligned with personal growth and professional evolution


**Who This Is For**
 This opportunity is suited to professionals who are:
   

  

* Actively seeking a career transition or new professional direction
* Drawn to personal growth, leadership, and helping others create change
* Interested in building a location-flexible, digitally enabled income stream
* Open to developing skills in digital communication, leadership, and online business systems


**Backgrounds May Include**
* Education, training, facilitation, or leadership
* Health, wellbeing, or people-focused professions
* Corporate, consulting, or professional services
* Sales, client engagement, or relationship-based roles


 This role is not designed for existing life coaches looking to supplement a current practice, but for individuals ready to build a new professional pathway in the digital personal development space.
   

  

**You Are**
* A confident communicator with strong people skills
* Self-motivated, organised, and comfortable working independently
* Purpose-driven with a genuine interest in leadership and growth
* Comfortable using digital communication tools in a remote setting
* Aligned with ethical, integrity-based professional standards


**Key Responsibilities**
* Utilise digital platforms and business systems to engage with aligned professionals globally
* Conduct structured introductory conversations to assess suitability and share information
* Support individuals through education pathways focused on personal and leadership growth
* Build and maintain professional relationships with integrity and professionalism
* Participate in weekly leadership development and business skill-building sessions
* Operate with accountability, professionalism, and ethical decision-making


 If you’re seeking a flexible, purpose-led career shift that combines personal growth, leadership education, and a structured online business pathway, we invite you to submit your expression of interest.

title: Integration Specialist
description:
**WHO WE ARE** 





 At Trustly, we're building a smarter, faster, and more secure financial future by revolutionizing the world of payments. As a global leader in Open Banking Payments, we are establishing Pay by Bank as the new standard at checkout, providing unparalleled freedom, speed, and ease to millions of consumers and merchants worldwide.
 




  






 Our Ambition: To build the world’s most disruptive payment network and redefine what the payment experience should feel like.
 




  






 Trustly is a global team of innovators, collaborators, and doers.  If you are driven by a strong sense of purpose and thrive in a dynamic, entrepreneurial, and high-growth environment, join us and be part of a team that’s transforming the way the world pays.
 




  





**ABOUT THE ROLE**




  





 The Integration Specialist at Trustly plays a key role in guiding new and existing merchants through the integration process. This role is primarily focused on integrations within financial services and e-commerce. The Integration team ensures that merchants successfully integrate Trustly's API, enabling them to fully leverage our products and maximize the value. The team is based in Stockholm.
 




  




**What you'll do** 
* Manage multiple merchant integrations simultaneously, leading the technical discussions with stakeholders across various organizational levels
* Support merchants during the integration process - you will also be working with Trustly’s Partners, Payment Service Providers (PSP’s)
* Make sure that merchants have integrated our API correctly before they go live
* Support our commercial teams in technical discussions with our merchants
* Improve the API documentation, processes, and routines within the Integration team



  




**Who you are** 
* You have 3+ years of experience working in a technical role
* You are incredibly service-minded and customer-focused, with a great interest in and understanding of technology
* You are solution-driven with a strong analytical ability and resourceful when it comes to solving problems
* You have a basic understanding of computer networking, HTTP, and SQL
* Prior experience in programming, mobile app development, system integration, and/or online payments is considered a valuable asset
* You are a team player and comfortable working independently
* You are flexible, able to shift tasks and priorities as needed






  




  


**Our Fantastic Benefits**

 (varies by location)
 




 🌴
 **20 to 30 days of holiday** 
 to support a healthy work-life balance
 



 🥳
 **Monthly team outing allowance** 
 to enjoy social events with your colleagues
 



 👶
 **Parental leave top-up** 
 additional support for new parents
 



 🥐
 **Daily breakfast and on-site perks** 
 to make your workday smoother
 



 💚
 **Well being support** 
 our health allowance covers gym memberships, massages, and much more to help you feel your best
 



**PLUS** 
 additional benefits designed to enhance your work-life experience!
 



  





**Shape Your Role and Make an Impact**




 Join a dynamic environment where you can take ownership, drive change, and continuously embrace new challenges. We’re looking for dedicated and highly motivated individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy collaborating across different areas of the organisation.
 



 If your skills and experience align with this role, we’d love to hear from you!
 **Apply now and submit your CV in English.** 



  


 We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

title: Field Sales Executive
description:
At Lunar, we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way people bank, pay, and build businesses. Since starting in Aarhus in 2015, we’ve grown into a leading Nordic fintech with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus, and Stockholm 🚀
 



 Tech is not an add-on for us — it’s the engine. With our own banking license and a modern commercial architecture, we’re redesigning business banking for SMEs who want something faster, smarter, and easier than the traditional banks.
 



 We’re looking for a Field Sales Executive to help us win high-value SME customers and expand Lunar’s footprint across the Nordics. This is a high-impact hunting role: you’ll be in the field every day meeting decision-makers, running sharp demos, and converting businesses that are ready for a better banking experience.
 



 You’ll be joining a dedicated, ambitious team and work directly with the Director of Business Sales & Partnerships as part of Lunar’s new four-engine commercial model.
 



**What will you do?** 



* Hunt and convert high-value SMEs using a precision-built, data-driven target list (no random outreach).
* Run the full sales cycle — from outbound contact to demo, proposal, and signed agreement.
* Meet prospects face-to-face, building trust and showcasing Lunar’s business banking offering.
* Use a clear playbook rooted in industry pain points and switcher value propositions.
* Maintain a tight, disciplined pipeline with accurate forecasting and CRM habits.
* Feed real market insights back into product and GTM teams.



**What are we looking for?** 




 We’re excited to hear from talent who recognise themselves in most of the following:
 


* 2+ years of B2B sales experience ideally field sales, SME services, fintech, SaaS, or similar.
* Proven hunter with a strong closing record.
* Confident meeting owners and decision-makers in person.
* Able to run structured sales conversations and tailored demos.
* Ambitious, outgoing and resilient — comfortable working independently in the field.
* Strong commercial instincts and the ability to translate customer pains into actionable next steps.
* Fluent in Danish, Swedish or Norwegian plus English



**Why join Lunar Field Sales?** 



* You will help build one of the most modern field sales machines in the Nordics.
* You work with precision targeting, strong demo tools, and a fully orchestrated GTM motion.
* You directly influence Lunar’s 2026 growth ambitions and the success of our SME strategy.
* You’ll be part of a high-energy commercial team that values initiative, ownership, and execution.



****Location:** 
 Denmark (Aarhus/Copenhagen) hiring also open in
 **Sweden (Stockholm)** 
 and
 **Norway (Oslo)** 
 for 2026 expansion.** 




**Curious about the Lunar culture? 💚** 




 Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. It’s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, we’re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.
 



  

**Are you ready to join the journey? Apply now and let's find out more!** 




 While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what we’re up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases 📢, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what it’s like to work here 📸, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights! 📱🫰
 



*Depending on the regulations in the country where you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.*

title: PD Project Manager Vehicle Service Information
description:
**Project manager Vehicle Service Information**
 At TRATON Group, we believe that the whole can be greater than the sum of its parts. Together with our brands we can make the future of transportation more sustainable - Let´s make a difference together.
   

  

 The TRATON AB office, located in Södertälje, consists of experienced colleagues with various backgrounds and nationalities from all TRATON Group brands. We enjoy solving strategic problems cross functional and cross brand in the TRATON Group. We strive for a climate where opinions and knowledge are openly shared within and between teams and we welcome new ideas in order to create dynamic synergies.
   

  

 With its brands Scania, MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus and International, TRATON Group is one of the world’s leading commercial vehicle manufacturers. Its offering comprises light-duty commercial vehicles, trucks, and buses. At TRATON, you are an important part of something bigger. Joining us means gaining access to the ins and outs of the entire transportation industry. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Being bigger also means being stronger. Together with our brands, we have the collective power to transform transportation. Find out more: www.traton.com
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We offer a position in an organization that provides both insight and involvement in the customer value we deliver. Right now, we are in an exciting phase as we intensify collaboration within TRATON. Our work involves coordinating with the main development flow in R&D to ensure the right quality from a service perspective.
   

  

 As a project manager, you support the teams in delivering results. Your contribution includes coordination, structure, process management and problem-solving. Communication is essential, as you are expected to report status and represent the project both internally and to other departments.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Manage and lead the team in organizing, monitoring and executing current and future projects related to vehicle service information
* Work closely with various cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and functionality of service information
* Overall delivery planning towards deadlines
* Analyze and present consequences of deviations from plan
* Act on and escalate risks and deviations for the project
* Actively participate in planning and other specialist tasks to support the team’s goals


**Who You Are**
* You have an engineering degree or equivalent experience in a similar role.
* You have previous experience as a project leader preferably from product development projects. Experience from Scania project management is extra meritorious.
* You are fluent in English and Swedish.
* Comfortable working in a dynamic environment where both agile and traditional development methods are used.
* Experience and knowledge in agile methods.
* You can see the big picture and help the organization prioritize and improve work methods and processes when needed.


 We are looking for a natural leader who motivates others and can easily collaborate with people in various positions within the company. You can see the big picture, be holistic and look both upstream and downstream the flow as well as help the organization prioritize and improve work methods and processes when needed.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 Our department plays a central role by providing the information, tools and systems required to maintain, diagnose, repair, and upgrade transport solutions in a safe, high-quality and cost-effective manner.
   

  

 We also have an important role in product development by offering expert knowledge and support to design in order to ensure appropriate solutions from a service perspective and, ultimately, to give Traton workshop network the conditions needed to maximize the availability of our transport solutions.
   

  

 We are a team working across several exciting areas. Our backgrounds are varied and we have a wide range of experience and expertise. We develop together and share experiences and knowledge to support each other in daily work.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates.
 **Important:** 
 Upload your CV in English.
 **Please note** 
 that we are not able to process any applications sent by email, due to GDPR regulations. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information about the position, please contact: Nenad Momic, Manager TGROSS, nenad.momic@scania.com. If you have questions about the recruitment process, please contact: Hannah Lagerstedt, Talent Acquisition Specialist, hannah.lagerstedt@scania.com.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-12-11 . Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**
 This recruitment process is handled by Scania for TRATON R&D

title: Marketing Specialist
description:
*Our client is a global Tech Giant at the forefront of digital innovation, data, and technology. You will join a high-performing, creative, and fast-paced environment where innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning are core values. The company operates worldwide and drives cutting-edge marketing initiatives that shape the future of the digital landscape.*
**About The Role**
 As a Marketing Specialist, you will strengthen brand and product recognition through strategic, data-driven marketing campaigns and projects across social media, channel marketing, and other communication platforms. You will collaborate closely with internal and external stakeholders to bring marketing strategies to life, ensuring all content reflects the company’s voice, values, and global standards.
   

  

 This role also supports DEI (Diversity, Equity & Inclusion) initiatives by fostering an inclusive team culture, creating psychological safety, and ensuring diverse perspectives are represented in decision-making. You will provide thought leadership, analyze data to uncover new opportunities, collaborate with stakeholders to deliver high-quality content, manage vendor and agency relationships, and track campaign ROI. Additionally, you will drive innovative marketing communications strategies, implement social media and creative campaigns, and support internal and external promotional plans.
   

  

**Who We Are Looking For**
 We are seeking a proactive and creative Marketing Specialist with strong analytical abilities and excellent communication skills. You thrive in fast-paced environments and are comfortable collaborating across teams, cultures, and time zones. You demonstrate both strategic thinking and hands-on execution, with a passion for inclusive marketing practices.
   

  

**Requirements**
 The ideal candidate should have demonstrated proficiency in:
   

  

  

* Data analysis and synthesis
* Creativity and content development
* Strong communication skills
* Understanding of consumer behavior
* Growth and performance marketing
* Deal negotiation
* Influencer marketing
* Social media strategy
* SEO
* Media planning and placement
* Project management
* Digital marketing tools and workflows


***The assignment starts immediately and will run for 10 months. It is a full-time position with a hybrid work model. This is a consulting assignment through Adecco.***

title: Salesforce Applikationskonsult
description:
Är du en erfaren entusiast när det kommer till Salesforce? Drivs du av att förstå kunders behov och omsätta dem till praktiska och innovativa lösningar? Då har vi en spännande roll för dig i vårt dedikerade projektteam. Som Applikationskonsult hos Releye kommer du att ha en central roll i att hjälpa våra kunder att nå den fulla potentialen av Salesforce. Du kommer att arbeta tätt tillsammans med andra specialister för att analysera kundernas affärsprocesser och behov. Du kommer även att designa och konfigurera Salesforce plattformen.
   

  

 Vem vi letar efter
   

  

**Såhär Ser Din Vardag Ut**
* Du är med i implementationsprojekt från ax till limpa
+ Det vill säga från pre-sales, kravinsamling och integrering till implementation och sedan löpande vidareutveckling och underhåll

* Skapar detaljerade specifikationer som beskriver hur CRM:et bör utformas och fungera för att möta affärsbehoven
* Identifierar möjligheter som förbättrar kundernas processer och anpassade lösningar
* Konfigurerar och anpassa Salesforcelösningar i enlighet med specifikation
* Genomför releaser i Salesforce
* Håller demos och utbilda våra kunder i deras system eller lösning
* Håller dig uppdaterad om branschtrender och best practice inom CRM. Detta för att vi tillsammans ska leverera projekt i absoluta framkant


**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet av Salesforce och har god förståelse för möjligheterna med standardkonfigurering
* Har erfarenhet av att aktivt delta i alla steg, från kravinsamling till leverans, i flera implementationsprojekt
* Är certifierad inom Salesforce (t.ex. Advanced Administrator samt Platform App Builder)
* Har erfarenhet av CRM-integrationer, processautomation och datamodellering
* Har erfarenhet av att skapa rapporter och dashboards i Salesforce
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta som konsult
* Har relevant utbildning inom IT, t.ex. Data- och Systemvetenskap eller liknande
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska


**Personliga Egenskaper**
* Stark kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga, med förmågan att effektivt kommunicera tekniska begrepp till icke-tekniska intressenter
* Förmåga att ta initiativ och arbeta självständigt såväl som i team
* Motiveras av att jobba med flera parallella projekt med många olika kontaktytor internt och hos kund
* God analytisk förmåga och problemlösningsfärdigheter


 Förmåner
   

  

* Sociala happenings - After Works, fredagsfrukostar, team-aktiviteter och fester. Vi gillar att hitta på roliga saker tillsammans och tror på att blanda nytta med nöje.
* Centralt kontor - Mitt i centrala Stockholm, på Kungsgatan, finns vårat kontor. Ett kontor vi delar med våra syskonbolag Attollo och Omeo. Här finns mängder av härliga lunchrestauranger och caféer att testa med kollegorna.
* Tekniska utmaningar - Vårt intresse för IT skapar gemenskap och spännade utmaningar. Vi utvecklas ständigt genom att arbeta med den senaste tekniken inom Salesforce och Microsoft.
* Kompetensutveckling - Mentorskapsprogram, R&D-day och uppmuntran till certifieringar, är några av fler aktiviteter som vi har kopplat till kompetensutveckling på Releye.
* Föräldrapenningtillägg - erbjuds till våra anställda


 Releye
   

  

 Releye är ett familjärt strategi- och IT-företag som Automatiserar, Digitaliserar och Transformerar kundprocesser, och ser till att de anpassas till den nya digitala världen. Vi är specialister inom Microsoft CRM och Salesforce och vi är stolta över att ha några av Sveriges mest kända varumärken som våra kunder. Tillsammans med våra kunder tar vi fram proaktiva kundupplevelser.
   

  

 Releye växer och behöver dig som värdesätter härliga kollegor, utmanande kundprojekt och en utvecklande arbetsplats. Vi har innovationsdagar, lösningar i absoluta framkant och ett skönt framåtlutat gäng som vill bli fler.
   

  

 Telefon: 0709446760 E-post: jobba@releye.se Plats: Kungsgatan 44, 111 35 Stockholm
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**För Mer Information, Vänligen Kontakta**
 Cecilia Landin
   

  

 HR Business Partner
   

  

 cecilia.landin@releye.se
   

  

 +46 (0)790 98 76 76

title: Informationssäkerhetskonsult
description:
ArkivIT är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultbolag inom digital arkiv- och informationshantering – med spetskompetens inom informationssäkerhet, dataskydd, e-arkiv samt arkiv & registratur. Sedan starten 2010 har vi breddat vårt tjänsteutbud och byggt upp ett team av engagerade och kunniga konsulter som arbetar med verksamheter över hela landet. Vår styrka ligger i kombinationen av djup fackkunskap, ödmjukhet och resultatfokus – och vårt mål är att bidra till en trygg, strukturerad och hållbar informationsförvaltning i både offentlig och privat sektor.
 



  





**Är du en senior informationssäkerhetsexpert som vill göra verklig skillnad?** 




 Hos ArkivIT får du arbeta i ett erfaret team där din kompetens tas tillvara och utvecklas. Vi söker dig som brinner för informationssäkerhet och som vill hjälpa våra kunder att ta nästa steg inom styrning, efterlevnad och säker informationshantering. Du får frihet att forma din vardag, samtidigt som du bidrar till samhällsnytta i några av Sveriges viktigaste verksamheter.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Senior Informationssäkerhetskonsult arbetar du nära kundernas verksamheter och är ofta en nyckelperson i deras utvecklingsarbete. Du är självgående och trygg i din roll, men har alltid stöd från kompetenta kollegor.
 



  





 Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:
 


* Införa eller vidareutveckla ledningssystem för informationssäkerhet (LIS)
* Agera rådgivare eller interim CISO för styrning och regelefterlevnad
* Genomföra risk- och gap-analyser samt bidra vid incidenthantering och kontinuitetsplanering
* Stötta verksamheter med efterlevnad av ISO 27000, NIS2, GDPR och andra relevanta regelverk



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




**Krav:** 



* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av arbete inom informationssäkerhet, gärna med erfarenhet av offentlig samt privat sektor
* Djup kunskap och praktisk erfarenhet av ISO 27000-serien
* God förståelse för svensk lagstiftning kopplad till informationssäkerhet
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och skapa förtroende i olika typer av verksamheter
* Förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya verksamheter och skapa förtroende
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift, samt god engelska
* Relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning



  





**Meriterande:** 



* Tidigare erfarenhet som konsult
* Certifieringar som ISO 27001 Lead Implementer/Lead Auditor, CISM, CISA eller liknande
* Kunskap om andra ramverk och standarder inom informationssäkerhet
* Erfarenhet av dataskyddsarbete
* Projektledarerfarenhet och vana att leda uppdrag



  





**Personliga förmågor** 




 Vi söker dig som är trygg i din kompetens, ödmjuk i ditt bemötande och lösningsorienterad i din approach. Du är van att ta eget ansvar, men också att samarbeta och bidra till teamets utveckling. Du kommunicerar tydligt och pedagogiskt och trivs i en rådgivande roll där du får göra verklig skillnad.
 



  





**Vårt erbjudande till dig** 




 På ArkivIT tror vi på frihet under ansvar och att din utveckling är lika viktig som din erfarenhet.
 



  





 Därför erbjuder vi dig:
 


* **Kompetensutveckling** 
 – en egen pott och kontinuerlig fortbildning för att du ska växa i din roll
* **Trygghet och förmåner** 
 – tjänstepension, friskvårdsbidrag samt liv- och olycksfallsförsäkring
* **Flexibilitet** 
 – hybrid- eller distansarbete med möjlighet att anpassa arbetet efter kund och livssituation
* **Gemenskap** 
 – kollegor som stöttar, utmanar och inspirerar, både i vardagen och vid våra årliga träffar och events



  





 Vi är stolta över att vara ett värderingsstyrt bolag där
 **kompetens, resultat och ödmjukhet** 
 genomsyrar allt vi gör. Hos oss får du inte bara ett jobb – du blir en del av en kultur som bygger på kunskap, samarbete och utveckling.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan – vi intervjuar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas så snart vi hittat rätt person.
 



 Start: Enligt överenskommelse
 



 Omfattning: Heltid (100%)
 



 Placering: Stockholm eller på distans med resor vid behov
 



  





 Har du frågor om rollen eller vill veta mer? Kontakta gärna konsultchef Gustav Rönne på
 
 gustav.ronne@arkivit.se
 
 .
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
 



  





 Platser: Stockholm, Huvudkontor
 



 Distansarbete: Hybridarbete

title: Java Technical Architect
description:
**Role:** 
 Technical Architect - Java
 



**Experience:** 
 6-8 Years
 



  





**Tata consultancy Services** 
 is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses for the past 50 years. We believe innovation and collective knowledge can transform all our futures with greater purpose. We help companies across industries achieve their strategic goals and lead their digital transformation programs. With 600,000 experts globally and 18,000+ consultants working for leading Nordic Customers, we have a strong sense of purpose for the ecosystem around us – our employees, partners, customers and society.
 



  





**Technical/Functional Skills.** 




  




* 12+ Yrs of exp in Java Spring boot, microservices
* At least 9 years of experience in Java/J2EE Core technologies.
* At least 9 years of experience in Spring, Springboot, Restful Services, Microservices, Cassendra, Unix/Shell Scripting, and Python
* Experience working in ESB is a plus
* Experience working in Managed Services
* At least 5 years of experience in Design and architecture review
* Ability to work in team environment and client interfacing skills
* Analytical and Communication skills
* Experience and desire to work in a Global delivery environment
* Strong concepts & knowledge of object-oriented programming, data structures, algorithms, and design patterns.



  





  





**Experience Required** 




  




* Experience must include architectural design and development, production support
* Develop new applications, components, or modules to meet functionality requirements
* Design user application interface, business rules, system menus, user reports
* Development experience with Java, Springboot, RESTFul Webservices/Microservices
* Experience with Lean / Agile development methodologies



  





**Roles & Responsibilities** 




  




* Develop applications with Java, Springboot, RESTFul Webservices/Microservices
* Work in Lean / Agile development methodologies



  





**Generic Managerial Skills** 




  




* Strong interpersonal skills and effective collaboration with team members, clients, and others
* Experience in leading a technical team and interacting with stakeholders for requirement gathering and Analysis
* Interacting with offshore team and coordinating delivery



  





**Does that sound interesting?** 




  





 You are welcome to submit your application consisting of your CV, personal letter, relevant degrees or certifications details, professional references, etc. We work with ongoing recruitment so send in your application as soon as possible.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application via LinkedIn or mail to
 **ajay.androw@tcs.com**
