title: Business Analyst
description:
Role description
  
We are looking for a Business Analyst to support requirement work and solution development in a cross-functional environment. You will work with stakeholders from R&D, IT and commercial functions to gather, analyse and manage requirements, and contribute to solutions that address both new and existing needs.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
Collaborate with R&D, IT and commercial teams to gather, analyse and document requirements.
  
Manage and structure requirements throughout the assignment.
  
Contribute to the creation and modelling of solutions based on identified needs.
  
Inform and communicate with relevant stakeholders and provide clarification when needed.
  
Lead assignments and preliminary studies within the domain.
  
Coordinate acceptance testing to ensure that solutions meet agreed requirements and quality standards.
  
  

Requirements
  
Minimum three years of relevant higher education.
  
Fluent in Swedish and English.
  
  

Meriting
  
Experience with RoD processes and product structures.
  
Experience with AWS development or participation in an on-prem to cloud migration.
  
General knowledge of software development.
  
  

Location
  
**Location:** Södertälje (hybrid)
  
  

About Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm within the IT sector. We partner with established technology companies as well as innovative startups to offer attractive career opportunities for professionals looking to grow within digital development and IT. With our strong technical expertise and extensive network, we effectively match the right consultant with the right assignment. At Rasulson Consulting, you will receive personalized guidance, ongoing feedback, and the opportunity to take the next step in your career.

title: Digital marknadsförare med fokus på branding och sociala medier
description:
Vill du arbeta med branding och marknadsföring ? Hos Grit Academy får du möjligheten att utvecklas och påverka.
  
Om Grit Academy
  
Grit Academy är en yrkeshögskola med fokus på både kunskap och beteende – vi utbildar framtidens yrkespersoner med rätt kompetens och drivkraft för arbetsmarknaden. Vi är en växande organisation med korta beslutsvägar och stora möjligheter att omsätta idéer i handling.
  
Om rollen
  
Som marknadsförare hos oss har du en central roll i att stärka vårt varumärke och driva vår digitala närvaro. Du arbetar nära organisationen och skolans rektor/VD, med stort utrymme för egna initiativ. Tjänsten är deltid (20–60%) och utgår från vårt kontor i centrala Malmö. Detta är en utmärkt roll för dig som studerar marknadsföring, kommunikation eller digitala medier och vill kombinera studier med ett långsiktigt och meningsfullt arbete. Eller för dig som vill kombinera detta med en annan tjänst.
  
Exempel på arbetsuppgifter
  
* Planera, producera och publicera innehåll/content för sociala medier.
* Ta kontakt med folk, göra intervjuer, besöka nätverk och skapa content.
* Koordinera och boka marknadsföringsaktiviteter.
* Arbeta med branding, digital marknadsföring och kampanjer i olika kanaler.
* Driva trafik till webb och kampanjsidor genom SEO, Google Ads och sociala medier.
* Hantera och uppdatera webbplatsen i WordPress, inklusive enklare innehållsproduktion och optimering.
* Följa upp och analysera kampanjer med hjälp av relevanta verktyg.
* Skapa och redigera text, bild och rörligt innehåll.
* Bidra till utvecklingen av Grit Academys varumärke och tonalitet i digitala kanaler.


Vi tror att du har
  
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Instagram, Facebook och LinkedIn.
* Kunskap i SEO, Google Ads och Google Analytics.
* Erfarenhet av att hantera WordPress för publicering och enklare webbunderhåll.
* Förmåga att producera content – både text, bild och video.
* Grundläggande kunskaper i Canva, Photoshop, Adobe Creative Cloud eller liknande verktyg.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med kampanjer och analysverktyg.


Personliga egenskaper
  
Du är initiativtagande, kommunikativ och nyfiken – en person som gärna tar kontakt, skapar relationer och driver arbetet framåt. Hos oss passar du som inte gömmer dig bakom skärmen, utan gillar att ta för dig, tänka kreativt och omsätta idéer i handling.
  
Praktisk information
  
* Plats: Centrala Malmö (på plats)
* Omfattning: Deltid (20–60%), enligt överenskommelse
* Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse


Ansökan
  
Skicka din ansökan med CV, kort personligt brev och gärna exempel på tidigare arbete inom digital marknadsföring till: hr@gritacademy.se
  
  

Urval sker löpande – vänta inte med att söka!

title: Data Scientist in Business & Retail Banking \u007C SEB, Solna
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.*  

Are you an experienced Data Scientist who wants to create value through data and innovation and is motivated by delivering customer value with high quality? Do you have a proactive attitude when it comes to continuous improvements and investigating new technologies and concepts, and at the same time have experience of building AI models/systems? If so, this is probably a position for you! **About the role**
As a Data Scientist, your role is crucial in driving the work of AI and Advanced Analytics across the BRB organization and its stakeholders. This role will focus on enhancing, validating, and maintaining Customer Due Diligence (CDD) models within the scope of the Anti-Money Laundering (AML) directive as well as other models delivering insights to key stakeholders. Collaboration, clear communication to technical/non- technical audience and technical expertise are essential in this role.
The Business & Retail Banking division is now strengthening Data Analytics & CIO Office further to accelerate the journey towards becoming the #1 full-service digital retail bank in the Swedish market. We are a team of around 35 highly engaged and skillful data and analytics professionals, and we are now seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist that can work as a quantitative model developer to join our AI Analytics team.
**Key Responsibilities:*** **Analyze, Interpret and participate in maintaining and developing of models based on complex data:** Define and analyze complex data- business related problems, propose well-structured solutions and drive the work/process from inception to completion.
* **Design and be part of developing AI Models/Systems and Architectures:** Ensure models represent business concepts, compliance and requirements, adhere to industry best practices, and support monitoring, governance, and quality initiatives.
* **Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams:** Collaborating with business stakeholders, IT teams, and other cross-functional teams.


**To thrive in this role, we believe you have**
You have a very good understanding of data & (AI) analytics/data science frameworks and how to implement it in an efficient way to an organization that is heading into a predominantly Cloud based environment. You are committed to providing high-level service and are a true team player with a strong ability to build relationships with colleagues. You are prestige less and driven with a can-do attitude. You have a documented track record in working with data, analytics and AI and know what is required to truly leverage it.

**Qualifications:*** Experience in working in Cloud environment, and plus if GCP stack (VertexAI, BigQuery, Looker, GitLab, Jupyter)
* Proficiency in Python (or Scala, Rust, C++, Go, Julia,R)
* Plus if you are familiar with GenAI tools, frameworks, and best practices.
* Strong knowledge of model monitoring techniques, performance metrics, and model validation methodologies
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to understand complex business requirements.
* Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
* Having worked in an agile setup.
* Fluency in Swedish and English.

 **What we offer*** We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.
* Work-lifebalance.
* International opportunities and working environment.
* Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits.
* Innovative company in forefront of technology.


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to SEB and our team. Since we meet candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than **2025-12-31**. In case of uncertainty or if you have questions about the position, please, contact Hiu Yee Fan, hiu-yee.fan@seb.se  

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from. SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, which is why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.

title: Accountant
description:
*"At* Klipboard *we've introduced a flexible hybrid work policy, where employees spend three days in the office and two days working from home. This approach promotes a balanced work environment that combines office collaboration with the comfort and convenience of remote work."*


Klipboard provides specialist software, services and support to deliver fully integrated trading and business management solutions to companies in the distributive trade – wherever they are in the world. With a unique depth of knowledge and experience in ERP/SaaS solutions, Klipboard has a wide range of clients includes wholesalers, distributors, merchants and retailers from small traders to multinational enterprises. Klipboard has offices in the UK, Ireland, The Netherlands, South Africa, Kenya and North America. Our mission is simple: to design and deliver high performance, integrated ERP solutions that enable our distributive trade customers to source effectively, stock efficiently, sell profitably and service competitively

* Compilator is Northern Europe’s most used software for tyre management systems, offering payment and cloud invoicing solutions
* A PE backed company moving through a period of growth and operational transformation.
* The role is an existing role to manage Compilator AB branch’s finance function

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Finance:**

* Responsible for Accounts payable ledger including processing purchases invoices to the correct cost centre/GL and resolving any queries with suppliers.
* Responsible for Accounts receivable ledger and accurate and timely maintenance of the customer master file across multiple systems:
	+ To process corrections from sales and support departments such as when order and delivery don’t match.
	+ Registering price increases in the DD5 ERP system.
	+ Queries handling, credit control, and liaising with sales department.
	+ Registering payments manually related to all contracts monthly.
	+ For Pagero invoicing services, maintaining customer data in the system.
	+ Customer Billing (Annual, Quarterly and Monthly) and manually processing any customers with unique contract terms.
* Maintaining customer and supplier master data.
* Reconciling the bank statements daily and assist with the future cash flow forecasting process.
* Preparing bank payments for accounts payable, tax authorities and payroll. Ensuring payments are made promptly and allowing time for approvals.
* Preparing the VAT declaration and submitting this in the tax portal
* Gathering disbursement receipts from all employees, and maintaining holiday pay data for external payroll bureau
* Posting payroll journals received from external payroll bureau and uploading the payment file to the bank each month.
* Liaison with external payroll bureau on compliance matters.
* Periodic stock taking and reconciliation to the records.
* Posting all required month end journals including accruals and prepayments. (Line manager will initially prepare the accrued and deferred revenue postings)
* Reconciliations and analysis of all balance sheet accounts in the monthly closing and year-end closing.

**Systems/Admin:**

* Working with the development group to fix any issues so they can fix any bugs in routine maintenance
* Updating new terms and conditions for customer contracts when needed such as for new products.
* Responsible for ordering of office supplies
* Handling regular mails and parcels to the company’s mailbox.
* Communicate any issues and significant items to your line manager

**Skills, Knowledge and Experience:**

**Essential**

* Ability to use Excel to an intermediate level
* Proven working experience in accounting
* Excellent communications skills, with the ability to translate financial information for non-finance stakeholders
* Business acumen and the ability to understand the impact of business change on financial accounts (vice versa)
* Self-sufficient with the ability to quality check and review own workings

**Desirable**

* Familiar or confident working in a matrix organisation

**Company Info**


You may also have seen from our recent posts that we are excited to begin sharing our new company name – Klipboard. Kerridge Commercial Systems (KCS) is becoming Klipboard and our new brand is designed to bring together our expertise across distribution, automotive, retail, rental, transport management, manufacturing, and field service management. We have offices based across the world and we are looking for talented individuals to join our growing teams. Due to our growth over the last few years it is an exciting time to join us as we enter our next chapter! At Klipboard we've introduced a flexible hybrid work policy, where employees spend three days in the office and two days working from home. This approach promotes a balanced work environment that combines office collaboration with the comfort and convenience of remote work."

**Equal Opportunities**


As a global company, we value and respect the diversity of our workforce, aiming to empower everyone to embrace each other's differences. We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where diversity, equity, and inclusion are integral to our company and culture. We recognize the benefits of a diverse workforce, where creativity and valuing differences enable us all to thrive and sparks innovation.


If you require any help, adjustments and/or support during the interview and offer process then please advise our TA or HR team.


Research shows that women and other underrepresented groups are less likely to apply for a role unless they meet every listed requirement. However, we recognise that skills and experience come in many forms, and we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every criterion. If you are passionate about this role and believe you have the right mindset and transferrable skills, we would love to hear from you!

*To all recruitment agencies: Klipboard does not accept agency speculative resumes. At present we only accept CV’s from Agencies on our PSL who have been assigned specific position/s. Please do not forward resumes to our careers site or direct to Klipboard employee as this does not constitute an introduction and Klipboard retrospectively will not be liable for any candidate ownership or fees related to unsolicited resumes.*

 *#LI-Hybrid*

title: Doctoral Student in High-performance Quantum Software
description:
### **Project description**

**Third-cycle subject: Computer Science**


This Ph.D. project will develop high-performance quantum software technologies, with a focus on quantum compilers, scheduling and orchestration on parallel computing systems, including in distributed quantum computing settings and in quantum serverless computing environments. The work will range from theoretical and algorithmic development of compilation and scheduling techniques, through the design and implementation of software frameworks and runtime systems for heterogeneous quantum-HPC platforms, to experimental evaluation on realistic workloads. The Ph.D. student will work in an interdisciplinary environment at the intersection of quantum computing, computer science, and parallel computing research, with access to HPC clusters, cloud platforms, and quantum computer hardware.

**Supervision:** Associate Professor Ivy Peng is proposed to supervise the doctoral student. Decisions are made on admission

### **Admission requirements**


To be admitted to postgraduate education (Chapter 7, 39 § Swedish Higher Education Ordinance), the applicant must have basic eligibility in accordance with either of the following:

* passed a second cycle degree (for example a master's degree), or
* completed course requirements of at least 240 higher education credits, of which at least 60 second-cycle higher education credits, or
* acquired, in some other way within or outside the country, substantially equivalent knowledge


In addition to the above, there is also a mandatory requirement for English equivalent to English B/6.

### **Selection**


In order to succeed as a doctoral student at KTH you need to be goal oriented and persevering in your work. During the selection process, candidates will be assessed upon their ability to:

* independently pursue his or her work
* collaborate with others,
* have a professional approach and
* analyze and work with complex issues.
* Strong programming skills.
* Strong background in quantum computing and/or parallel computing.
* First research experience through peer-reviewed publications.


After the qualification requirements, great emphasis will be placed on personal skills.

### **Target degree: Doctoral degree**

### **Information regarding admission and employment**


Only those admitted to postgraduate education may be employed as a doctoral student. The total length of employment may not be longer than what corresponds to full-time doctoral education in four years' time. An employed doctoral student can, to a limited extent (maximum 20%), perform certain tasks within their role, e.g. training and administration. A new position as a doctoral student is for a maximum of one year, and then the employment may be renewed for a maximum of two years at a time. In the case of studies that are to be completed with a licentiate degree, the total period of employment may not be longer than what corresponds to full-time doctoral education for two years.


As a doctoral student, you receive part of a workplace with many employee benefits and monthly salary according to KTH’s Doctoral student salary agreement. Read more about Doctoral studies (PhD) | KTH | Sweden.

### **Union representatives**


Contact information forunion representatives.

### **Doctoral Students`network (Students’ union on KTH Royal Institute of Technology)**


Contact information fordoctoral section.

### **To apply for the position**


Apply for the position and admission through KTH's recruitment system. It is the applicant’s responsibility to ensure that the application is complete in accordance with the instructions in the advertisement.


Applications must be received at the last closing date at midnight, CET/CEST (Central European Time/Central European Summer Time).


Applications must include the following elements:

* CV including your relevant professional experience and knowledge.
* Application letter with a brief description of why you want to pursue research studies, about what your academic interests are and how they relate to your previous studies and future goals. (Maximum 2 pages long)
* Copies of diplomas and grades from previous university studies and certificates of fulfilled language requirements (see above). Translations into English or Swedish if the original document is not issued in one of these languages.Copies of originals must be certified.
* Representative publications or technical reports. For longer documents, please provide a summary (abstract) and a web link to the full text.

### **Other information**


For information about processing of personal data in the recruitment process.


It may be the case that a position at KTH is classified as a security-sensitive role in accordance with the Protective Security Act (2018:585). If this applies to the specific position, a security clearance will be conducted for the applicant in accordance with the same law with the applicant's consent. In such cases, a prerequisite for employment is that the applicant is approved following the security clearance.


We firmly decline all contact with staffing and recruitment agencies and job ad salespersons.


Disclaimer: *In case of discrepancy between the Swedish original and the English translation of the job announcement, the Swedish version takes precedence.*

  

Join us at KTHKTH shapes the future through education, research and innovation. As a leading international technical university, we play an active role in advancing the transition towards a sustainable society. At KTH, you have the opportunity to grow and develop in a creative and dynamic environment, with good working conditions and attractive benefits. Equality, diversity and equal opportunities are essential to quality and form an integral part of KTH’s core values as a university and public authority. Learn more about our benefits and what it's like to work and grow at KTH

title: Founding Engineer
description:
**Who We Are:** Galdera Labs
  
Galdera Labs is building an agentic predictive analytics platform for the CFO office. We integrate numbers and narrative using machine learning techniques and a proprietary context layer to deliver the next evolution of strategic financial planning.
  
The Role
  
We are seeking a high-potential Founding Engineer (1-2 years experience) ready to take ownership of our core AI and data infrastructure. You will be a critical early technical hire, establishing foundational engineering processes and helping to deliver our core product features.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
**Build AI Workflows:** Design and implement robust agentic workflows and automation pipelines. Leverage AI coding tools to accelerate development.
  
**Full-Stack Development:** Write clean, production-ready code using our core stack: Python (backend/data) and TypeScript (front-end). Data Engineering: Develop and optimize large-scale data transformation jobs using Apache Spark.
  
**Architecture:** Participate in core architectural decisions, leveraging solid expertise in Cloud Infrastructure and database design/optimization.
  
**Process Ownership:** Establish early engineering best practices, including CI/CD and testing.
  
  

Qualifications
  
**Experience:** 2-4 years of professional software development experience.
  
**Technical Stack:** Proficiency in Python, TypeScript, and Apache Spark.
  
**AI Focus:** Practical experience with AI coding tools and implementing agentic workflows.
  
**Foundation:** Strong expertise in Cloud Infrastructure and database systems.
  
**Mindset:** Proactive, autonomous, and thrives in a high-ambiguity, fast-paced environment.
  
  

What We Offer
  
Competitive compensation.
  
Unparalleled technical impact on a core financial intelligence product.
  
Rapid career growth and ownership.

title: SOC L3 Cybersecurity Incident Responder
description:
**Location:**Göteborg, SE, 417 15
**Position Type:** Professional  

Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future. If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

At Volvo Group, we are embarking on an organization-wide digital transformation with a strong focus on cybersecurity. As part of this initiative, we are building a world-class Cybersecurity Operations Center (CSOC). We are seeking ambitious professionals with the right mindset to join our team in Gothenburg, Sweden, and contribute to our mission of protecting the Volvo Group.  


**Job Summary**

As a CSOC L3 Cybersecurity Incident Responder at Volvo Group, you will play a pivotal role in responding to cybersecurity incidents. You will have the opportunity to work with a global team of security professionals to protect the company together as one team.

Note! This is an on-site role, and although there is flexibility for work from home, we expect presence at the office on most normal working days. This role also expects availability to work on some public holidays on a rotation. We work only day shifts, but the global CSOC covers monitoring 24/7 every day of the year.
**Responsibilities:**  


* Coordinate and lead incident response on complex cybersecurity incidents.
* Conduct deep technical investigations, including malware analysis, reverse engineering, and forensic investigations, to fully understand threats and threat actor behavior.
* Prepare and present comprehensive incident reports, metrics, and trend analyses to management and stakeholders.
* Serve as the senior technical escalation point for the CSOC, providing guidance and support to L1 and L2 analysts.
* Provide guidance and mentorship to junior analysts, supporting their professional growth and skill development.
* Improve automation and ways of working to help the CSOC optimize the usage of analyst time and increase effectiveness.
* Identify and address gaps in CSOC processes, recommending enhancements to strengthen detection, response, and prevention capabilities.
* Develop, review, and improve incident response playbooks and procedures to ensure effective and consistent management of security incidents.
* Validate and enhance CSOC monitoring rules to improve threat detection capabilities and response times.
* Proactively hunt for threats across endpoints, networks, cloud environments, and logs, leveraging threat intelligence and MITRE ATT&CK methodologies.
* Continuously explore ways to reduce the risk of successful breaches, leveraging your technical expertise to identify and implement effective security measures.
* Stay up-to-date with emerging threats, attack techniques, and security technologies to continuously elevate CSOC capabilities.
* Develop yourself by utilizing the appointed commercial technical training platform. Elevate yourself and help elevate the team to protect the Volvo Group better.

**Requirements:**  


* At least 5 years of experience within CSOC and incident response, with advanced technical analysis expertise.
* Proficient in SIEM, EDR, and SOAR platforms, leveraging these tools to automate and optimize CSOC workflows. Proven ability to lead complex investigations into advanced threats as an experienced incident handler.
* Strong passion for technology and cybersecurity, with a focus on deepening expertise in incident response, forensics, threat analysis, and malware reverse engineering.
* Excellent team player with strong interpersonal skills and a collaborative mindset.
* Any industry certifications, such as GCIH, GCFA, or other technical certificates supporting incident response, digital forensics, and CSOC work are considered a huge plus.
* Positive mindset, curiosity, open-mindedness, and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
* Ability to work effectively, driving projects to completion and taking ownership of work tasks.
* Professionalism, attention to detail, and a focus on delivering high-quality results.
* Willing to work some public holidays on a rotational basis and support on-call incident response for the 24/7 global CSOC.
* Availability to be at the office in Lundby, Gothenburg, Sweden.

  



Join us at Volvo Group, where you will be part of a dynamic team dedicated to building a world-class CSOC. Together, we will strengthen the cybersecurity defenses of Volvo Group and make a lasting impact on the security landscape of the industry.  


**What’s in it for you?**  



 We offer a solid package of compensation and benefits, plus you will enjoy:
* A company that supports diversity, equity & inclusion
* A new organization with highly skilled professionals from diverse backgrounds
* Colleagues with innovative mindset, always ready to support and share information
* A supportive Manager enabling your professional growth
* Opportunities to develop, build a career and work globally or cross-functionally

  


**Ready to join the team?**

If any of the things you’ve just read made you feel confident in being the right person for the role, we are excited to hear from you; apply today without any hesitation! We will interview suitable candidates during the application period.  

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.  



“In some countries and for specific positions within Volvo Group Digital & IT, background checks may be required, in accordance with local laws & regulations. If this is applicable to the role you have applied for, you will be informed.”  



We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.  


**Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.  



Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.  


**Group Digital & IT** is the hub for digital development within Volvo Group. Imagine yourself working with cutting-edge technologies in a global team, represented in more than 30 countries. We are dedicated to leading the way of tomorrow’s transport solutions, guided by a strong customer mindset and high level of curiosity, both as individuals and as a team. Here, you will thrive in your career in an environment where your voice is heard and your ideas matter.
**Job Category:** Information Technology
**Organization:** Group Digital & IT
**Travel Required:** Occasional Travel
**Requisition ID:** 26941

title: Line Manager SDI Development
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

Over 40% of the world’s mobile traffic is carried through an Ericsson network. Ericsson is a recognized technology leader in bringing the 5th generation (5G) of Radio Access Networks (RAN) and Mobile Core Networks to market. The foundation for 5G use cases is built on an agile cloud environment, distributed across the network’s coverage area to deliver performance, flexibility and scale.

  

Software Defined Infrastructure (SDI) is the automated equipment management component that is key to enabling this agile private cloud. To strengthen this area, we are recruiting a Line Manager for one of our SDI development sections.

  

In this role, you will lead a team of 14 skilled developers working at the intersection of networks, cloud, and software. You will be part of the PDG (Product Development Group) Leadership Team, helping shape how we build, deploy and operate SDI and how emerging technologies, including AI, change the way we develop and test our software.

 **What you will do:**

  

* Provide clear direction and priorities, translating strategy into concrete team goals and outcomes.
* Apply and role-model our leadership principles: create clarity, develop people, generate results.
* Develop and coach team members, enabling growth in modern software development practices, AI-assisted engineering, and automation.
* Drive improvements in Ways of Working (WoW), promoting agile, collaborative and data-driven methods.
* Lead the team through change, moving towards more modern software development practices, toolchains and CI/CD approaches.
* Encourage and guide the team’s effective use of AI in development and testing, and also use AI yourself to simplify and streamline administrative and planning tasks.
* Collaborate closely with other leaders in the PDG Leadership Team to align roadmaps, share best practices and ensure end-to-end delivery quality.
* Play a central role in helping your team understand and adopt new technologies and approaches, especially around how AI will influence software development and testing, and you will actively support and drive that change.

  

This role is well suited to an experienced software developer or technical lead taking on their first formal line management position.

 **The skills you bring:**

  

To be successful in this role, you bring a strong background as a modern software developer, combined with proven leadership capabilities. We value:

  

* Solid hands-on experience in contemporary software development, with an emphasis on quality, automation and continuous delivery.
* A strong change mindset and the ability to drive and sustain change in tools, processes and ways of working.
* A collaborative approach, with the ability to build trust and work effectively across teams and functions.
* Understanding of network (NW) switches, servers and Linux environments.
* Development experience in Java and Erlang, or similar languages with willingness to learn.
* Practical experience or strong interest in the usage of AI in software development and testing (for example: code generation, test creation, analysis or automation), and openness to using AI to improve your own administrative and planning work as a line manager.
 **Why join Ericsson?**

  

At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

 **What happens once you apply?**

  

Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

  

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Learn more.

  

We target 60% work-from-the office. Last day to apply is 21st December 2025.

  

Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail.

  



**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

title: Data Scientist
description:
**Location:**Göteborg, SE, 417 56
**Position Type:** Professional  

Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future. If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.
**About Volvo Buses and the Global Bus Technology Team**  

Volvo Buses is a global leader in sustainable people transport solutions. By joining the Global Bus Technology Team, you’ll become part of a newly established, central analytics function dedicated to building a next-generation data and model framework. Our vision is to create an Integrated Bus Analytics Framework—a universe of interconnected models and data assets that describe every aspect of the bus, accessible to all and fueling the development of future generations of buses.  


**Your Mission**  

As a Data Scientist in this innovative central team, you will play a foundational role in building and evolving the Integrated Bus Analytics Framework from the ground up. You’ll support the Global Bus Technology Organization, by connecting data and insights from project office and product development to service market technology and customer quality experience. Your work will ensure that models are reliable, interpretable, and accessible for all relevant stakeholders, and you’ll design them to be modular and scalable so they can be built upon and interconnected.  



Collaboration is key in this role. You’ll work closely with Volvo Group teams to hand over pilot models and support the development of user-facing interfaces, making sure data-driven insights reach end users across the organization. By driving a closed-loop approach, you’ll embed lessons learned throughout the bus’s lifetime, continuously improving products, services, and customer experience. Your contributions will help grow a universe of bus knowledge that accelerates the development of next-generation buses.  

**Key Responsibilities**  

In this role, you will develop and operationalize pilot models, ensuring they are robust, interpretable, and maintainable. You’ll partner with interface teams to integrate models into user-facing tools and platforms, facilitating seamless adoption and maximum business impact. Maintaining and documenting models will be part of your daily work, ensuring they remain relevant and effective as the framework evolves. You’ll also facilitate knowledge sharing and model accessibility within the Global Bus Technology Team, supporting a culture of continuous improvement and innovation. By connecting data and insights across all phases of the bus lifecycle, you’ll ensure feedback and lessons learned are systematically captured and used to drive future improvements.
**Qualifications**  

We’re looking for a passionate team player with a collaborative mindset and a drive to make a difference. If you fulfill most of the qualifications below, we encourage you to apply—even if you don’t meet every single requirement.  



You bring a Master’s or PhD degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, and have experience in a Data Scientist role. You’re skilled in developing, operationalizing, maintaining, and interpreting advanced data analytics models, and you have strong programming abilities in Python, PySpark, and SQL. Experience with cloud platforms and data engineering tools such as Azure and Databricks is important, as is a clear understanding of the machine learning lifecycle from development to post-release.  



Additional qualifications that will help you succeed include:  

* Proven experience with shipping ML models to production, including MLOps, CI/CD, Docker, and Kubernetes.
* Familiarity with tools and libraries such as PyTorch, spaCy, Joblib, PyDantic, Transformers, Vector Stores, and RAG.
* Grounded knowledge of model monitoring tools (MLFlow) and metrics (runtime/drift).
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, especially in cross-functional and cross-organizational settings.
* Experience in the automotive or transport sector is an advantage.
  

**What We Offer**  

At Volvo Buses, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the future of sustainable transport and data-driven innovation. You’ll be part of a newly established, central team with a unique mandate to serve the entire Global Bus Technology organization, working in a dynamic, collaborative, and visionary environment. You’ll have access to advanced technology and the chance to build the Integrated Bus Analytics Framework, all while growing professionally in a global organization.  

**Ready for the next move?**  

If you want to make a real impact in your career, the transportation business is where you want to be. We look forward to meeting you. If you have any questions about the position, please contact Hiring Manager Therese Dahlström at therese.dahlstrom@volvo.com  

We look forward to receiving your application! The final date to apply is the 12th of December, 2025 but don’t wait with your application as we will conduct interviews in parallel.  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.  


**Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.  



Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.  



At **Volvo Buses** you join one of the world’s leading providers of sustainable people transport solutions. What we do affects millions of people around the world: passengers, drivers, customers; in fact, entire cities and countries. This job gives you the opportunity to work with the future of people transportation and infrastructure. We have a strong culture of working together to help each other, sharing knowledge and experience. Together, we shape the world we want to live in.
**Job Category:** Advanced Analytics
**Organization:** Volvo Buses
**Travel Required:** Occasional Travel
**Requisition ID:** 26906

title: Co-Founder(Tech) — Berlin CyberSecurity Startup (Freshly Funded) - Chief Cyber Architect / Head of Engineering / CTO
description:
**Berlin • Cybersecurity & AI Startup • Recently Secured Significant Funding**


We are building a next-generation **Identity + AI Enforcement** platform in Berlin.


Following newly secured funding, we are looking for a **technical co-founder** who will architect and build the core product from day one.


We are looking for a hands on **Founding Cyber Architect/Head of Engineering/CTO** for a hybrid role based in Berlin. If you are passionate about Cyber Security and AI tech, thrive in fast-paced environments, and have experience building complex platforms, this is your opportunity to make a lasting impact.

#### **Responsibilities**

* **Own the entire technical architecture** across identity, AI agent systems, and enforcement.
* **Design & implement** the identity model, token lifecycle, permission graph, and SaaS risk flows.
* **Build the AI agent identity model**, sandboxing, trust scoring, and agent behavior engine.
* **Write production-grade backend code** (4–6 hours/day early stage).
* **Lead engineering execution**: roadmap breakdown, sprint planning, delivery.
* **Build core services**: connectors, policy engine, risk engine, real-time enforcement layer.
* **Hire and lead** the initial engineering team.
* Work closely with the CEO on **high-level technical direction**.
* Support enterprise sales with **technical deep dives, PoCs, and security validation**.
* Maintain high standards of security, reliability, and architectural quality.
* Co-build the product vision to establish the leading cyber technology of Europe as well as the most effective platform.
* Establish the technological foundation of a platform, including the data infrastructure.
* Develop and execute the company’s technology strategy and roadmap.
* Recruit and lead an in-house, top-tier engineering team.
* Manage the company’s data, including storage, analysis, data privacy, and security.
* Make Europe and world more Cyber resilient!

#### **Requirements and Skills**

* **10+ years experience** in tech leadership roles
* **10+ years experience** in backend engineering and system architecture.
* Proven ability to design and ship complex distributed systems.
* Strong understanding of **OAuth/OIDC, API keys, tokens, scopes, identity flows**.
* Knowledge of **RBAC/ABAC** or fine-grained access models.
* Exposure to **Zero Trust principles**, access control models, or identity governance.
* Experience with **AI/LLM systems, agent logic, or willingness to learn fast**.
* Understanding of **SaaS integration security**, OAuth app marketplaces.
* Hands-on coding mentality; can build MVP and early architecture yourself.
* Experience integrating with multiple SaaS systems and APIs.
* Strong security mindset and understanding of modern attack surfaces.
* Ability to move fast, take ownership, and operate independently.
* Experience managing **small engineering teams** in early-stage environments.
* Hands-on experience with infrastructure-as-code (Terraform) and cloud deployments.
* Prior startup experience.
* Low ego, high commitment, and a **true founder mentality**.

#### **Nice to Have**

* Experience with **AI/LLM systems**, multi-agent orchestration, or agent frameworks.
* Experience with **policy engines** (custom enforcement logic).
* Experience building **event-driven architectures** or streaming systems (Kafka, Pub/Sub).
* Familiarity with **token analysis**, secret scanning, or credential hygiene.
* Experience with **cloud IAM** (AWS/GCP/Azure roles, service principals).
* Experience with **risk scoring**, anomaly detection, or behavior-based systems.
* Exposure to **agent sandboxing**, isolated execution, or container micro-VMs.
* Previous experience in **cybersecurity**, identity startups.
* Understanding of **graph databases**, unified identity graphs, or permission maps.
* Previous Technical Product leadership and design experience.
* Prior co-founder experience.

#### **Benefits**

* **Co-Founder Equity** — meaningful ownership in a high-growth cybersecurity company.
* **Competitive Compensation** — salary aligned with market, flexible early-stage arrangements possible.
* **Founding Team Status** — shape the company from day one and own critical technical decisions.
* **Fresh Funding Secured** — immediate runway to build, hire, and execute fast.
* **Full Technical Ownership** — lead architecture across identity, AI agents, and enforcement.
* **High Autonomy** — freedom to design and build without corporate overhead.
* **Work with a Technical CEO** — fast iteration, strong alignment, clear direction.
* **Cutting-Edge Domain** — identity security, SaaS-to-SaaS access, AI agent governance.
* **Massive Learning Curve** — quickly gain depth in cybersecurity, identity, and AI systems.
* **Enterprise Exposure** — meet customers with the CEO, lead deep dives, and own PoCs.
* **Fast Career Path** — evolve into CTO-level leadership as we scale the engineering team.
* **Berlin Location** — top-tier tech environment with strong cybersecurity and AI ecosystems.
* **Direct Impact** — your architecture and code become the foundation of the entire platform.

 **Note:** This position includes optional relocation support to Berlin.

title: System Owner
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


We are looking for System Owner who will play a key role in safeguarding a Packet Core system's integrity using both architectural (white box) and performance/functionality (black box) approaches. In this role, you will set and ensure the quality strategy across all product integration flows, including the main-, release-, and maintenance branches. It will be your responsibility to define quality requirements, make technical decisions related to the product and relevant third-party components as well as corresponding documentation, and establish product quality KPIs and targets.

  

In this role, you will manage and prioritize the product improvement backlog, including enhancements in architecture and test strategy. And be responsible for executing the product maintenance and support strategy and providing inputs for lifecycle strategy definition. You will act and influence the product patching strategy, update sub-components, and handle security alerts.
  

As a part of this organization, you will help improve the quality process, make recommendations for release readiness and ensure better-than-last adherence.

 **Key tasks**


You will be responsible for understanding and driving actions to reduce the cost of maintenance over time. Leading prioritization decisions to ensure product integrity across system and product programs, collaborating closely with key roles in system architecture, testing, quality, and security.  

  

  



You will identify gaps in quality processes and initiate change by engaging the relevant process owners. When balancing time to market against product quality, architecture, and performance, you will conduct risk analyses. You will act on customer escalations related to the products and solutions, taking overall responsibility for the health of both products and solutions over time. Understanding and communicating customer feedback and system degradation within the relevant parts of the organization, including issuing bulletins and communicating improvements to Customer Operations.

  

Additionally, you will analyze feedback from Customer Operations at the total product level, including the platform, and initiate root cause analyses (RCAs) when quality degradations occur, evaluating possible improvements for implementation.

  

  



**Educational and experience**

* A degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field (MSc or BSc level preferred).
* At least 15 years of hands-on experience in system or application testing, product integration and life-cycle management. Experience should include working with complex systems, preferably in telecommunications, cloud-native environments (Kubernetes, CI/CD pipelines such as Jenkins and GitLab, Linux distributions).
* Experience with Packet Core components (SMF, UPF etc.) and with direct customer engagement is highly valued.
* Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams and drive prioritization decisions that ensure product integrity. Track record of raising the bar for quality, unblocking teams, and improving long-term velocity or reliability.
* Proven communication skills for engaging with stakeholders, process owners, and customer operations.
Ability to conduct root cause analyses (RCAs), fault slip through (FSTs), evaluate quality degradations, and build roadmaps for improvements.  
* 

**Please note that we do not accept or process applications submitted via email.**

**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
