title: Data Scientist in Business & Retail Banking | SEB, Solna
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.*
 Are you an experienced Data Scientist who wants to create value through data and innovation and is motivated by delivering customer value with high quality? Do you have a proactive attitude when it comes to continuous improvements and investigating new technologies and concepts, and at the same time have experience of building AI models/systems? If so, this is probably a position for you!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Data Scientist, your role is crucial in driving the work of AI and Advanced Analytics across the BRB organization and its stakeholders. This role will focus on enhancing, validating, and maintaining Customer Due Diligence (CDD) models within the scope of the Anti-Money Laundering (AML) directive as well as other models delivering insights to key stakeholders. Collaboration, clear communication to technical/non- technical audience and technical expertise are essential in this role.
   

  

 The Business & Retail Banking division is now strengthening Data Analytics & CIO Office further to accelerate the journey towards becoming the #1 full-service digital retail bank in the Swedish market. We are a team of around 35 highly engaged and skillful data and analytics professionals, and we are now seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist that can work as a quantitative model developer to join our AI Analytics team.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Analyze, Interpret and participate in maintaining and developing of models based on complex data: Define and analyze complex data- business related problems, propose well-structured solutions and drive the work/process from inception to completion.
* Design and be part of developing AI Models/Systems and Architectures: Ensure models represent business concepts, compliance and requirements, adhere to industry best practices, and support monitoring, governance, and quality initiatives.
* Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams: Collaborating with business stakeholders, IT teams, and other cross-functional teams.


**To thrive in this role, we believe you have**
 You have a very good understanding of data & (AI) analytics/data science frameworks and how to implement it in an efficient way to an organization that is heading into a predominantly Cloud based environment. You are committed to providing high-level service and are a true team player with a strong ability to build relationships with colleagues. You are prestige less and driven with a can-do attitude. You have a documented track record in working with data, analytics and AI and know what is required to truly leverage it.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Experience in working in Cloud environment, and plus if GCP stack (VertexAI, BigQuery, Looker, GitLab, Jupyter)
* Proficiency in Python (or Scala, Rust, C++, Go, Julia,R)
* Plus if you are familiar with GenAI tools, frameworks, and best practices.
* Strong knowledge of model monitoring techniques, performance metrics, and model validation methodologies
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to understand complex business requirements.
* Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
* Having worked in an agile setup.
* Fluency in Swedish and English.


**What We Offer**
* We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.
* Work-lifebalance.
* International opportunities and working environment.
* Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits.
* Innovative company in forefront of technology.


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to SEB and our team. Since we meet candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than
 **2025-12-31** 
 . In case of uncertainty or if you have questions about the position, please, contact Hiu Yee Fan, hiu-yee.fan@seb.se
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from. SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, which is why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
**Cloud Engineer | Production Engineering | Sweden | Remote**
 RLDatix (RLD) is on a mission to help raise the standard of care…everywhere. Trusted by over 10,000 healthcare organisations around the world, our solutions help improve health and care. Our applications ensure that patients receive the best and safest care while supporting the providers who deliver it.
   

  

 Joining TeamRLD means being part of a global effort of over 2,000 team members in making a difference in healthcare…every day.
   

  

 We’re searching for a
 **Sweden-based Engineer III** 
 to join our
 **Production Engineering** 
 team, so that we can
 **design and maintain robust cloud-based infrastructure to support reliable software deployment and operations** 
 . The
 **Engineer III** 
 will
 **resolve moderately complex technical issues, automate deployment pipelines, and drive system performance improvements** 
 to
 **ensure operational excellence and system resilience across our global platform** 
 .
   

  

**How You’ll Spend Your Time**
* Design scalable infrastructure using cloud platforms and Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform) to ensure high reliability.
* Automate deployment and operational processes using Configuration-as-Code (YAML, JSON, XML) for consistency and efficiency.
* Implement monitoring and observability solutions to proactively detect and resolve system issues.
* Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines to enable reliable software delivery.
* Collaborate with development teams to embed reliability and scalability into software design.


**What Kind of Things We’re Most Interested in You Having**
* 3+ years of experience in cloud infrastructure engineering or DevOps roles.
* Proven success in building and maintaining automation pipelines.
* In-depth knowledge of Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform) and Configuration-as-Code practices.
* Hands-on experience with Git, scripting languages (PowerShell, Bash, Python), and major hyperscalers.
* Operational experience in cloud networking (VPC, subnets, load balancers, DNS) and HTTPS/TLS.
* Fluency in English and Swedish to effectively communicate with customers and internal teams.
* Sincere interest in healthcare technology and operational excellence.
* A knack for working collaboratively in a fast-paced, production environment.


 By enabling flexibility in how we work and prioritizing employee wellness, we empower our team to do and be their best.
   

  

 RLDatix is an equal opportunity employer, and our employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, age, gender, sexual identity, national origin, disability, handicap, marital status or any other status or condition protected by law.
   

  

 As part of RLDatix’s commitment to the inclusion of all qualified individuals, we ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation in the job application and interview process. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in either step, please don’t hesitate to send a note to accessibility@rldatix.com.

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
**Cloud Engineer | Production Engineering | Sweden | Remote**
 RLDatix (RLD) is on a mission to help raise the standard of care…everywhere. Trusted by over 10,000 healthcare organisations around the world, our solutions help improve health and care. Our applications ensure that patients receive the best and safest care while supporting the providers who deliver it.
   

  

 Joining TeamRLD means being part of a global effort of over 2,000 team members in making a difference in healthcare…every day.
   

  

 We’re searching for a
 **Sweden-based Engineer III** 
 to join our
 **Production Engineering** 
 team, so that we can
 **design and maintain robust cloud-based infrastructure to support reliable software deployment and operations** 
 . The
 **Engineer III** 
 will
 **resolve moderately complex technical issues, automate deployment pipelines, and drive system performance improvements** 
 to
 **ensure operational excellence and system resilience across our global platform** 
 .
   

  

**How You’ll Spend Your Time**
* Design scalable infrastructure using cloud platforms and Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform) to ensure high reliability.
* Automate deployment and operational processes using Configuration-as-Code (YAML, JSON, XML) for consistency and efficiency.
* Implement monitoring and observability solutions to proactively detect and resolve system issues.
* Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines to enable reliable software delivery.
* Collaborate with development teams to embed reliability and scalability into software design.


**What Kind of Things We’re Most Interested in You Having**
* 3+ years of experience in cloud infrastructure engineering or DevOps roles.
* Proven success in building and maintaining automation pipelines.
* In-depth knowledge of Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform) and Configuration-as-Code practices.
* Hands-on experience with Git, scripting languages (PowerShell, Bash, Python), and major hyperscalers.
* Operational experience in cloud networking (VPC, subnets, load balancers, DNS) and HTTPS/TLS.
* Fluency in English and Swedish to effectively communicate with customers and internal teams.
* Sincere interest in healthcare technology and operational excellence.
* A knack for working collaboratively in a fast-paced, production environment.


 By enabling flexibility in how we work and prioritizing employee wellness, we empower our team to do and be their best.
   

  

 RLDatix is an equal opportunity employer, and our employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, age, gender, sexual identity, national origin, disability, handicap, marital status or any other status or condition protected by law.
   

  

 As part of RLDatix’s commitment to the inclusion of all qualified individuals, we ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation in the job application and interview process. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in either step, please don’t hesitate to send a note to accessibility@rldatix.com.

title: VP of Product
description:
**Help Us Fit the World.**
 At
 **Volumental** 
 , we are on a mission to banish "bad fit" to the history books. We are the world’s leading FitTech company, leveraging computer vision, AI, and the world's largest dataset of 3D foot scans to help millions of people find shoes that actually fit.
   

  

 Our technology has been used to scan over
 **40 million people** 
 and is deployed in
 **60+ countries** 
 . We bridge the gap between digital shopping and physical retail by building a comprehensive fit platform. Our products are integrated into product detail pages globally and are utilized by millions in-store, facilitating everything from 3D printing custom Air Jordans to industrial job site scanning.
   

  

**The Role**
 We are looking for a visionary
 **VP of Product** 
 to take the helm of our product strategy as we scale from a scanning hardware company to a global data and personalization platform.
   

  

 You will lead a talented team of Product Managers and Product Designers, and ensure alignment between our world-class engineering team (Computer Vision, AI, Full Stack) and our commercial goals. You will define how we create value with our data, how we expand our mobile solutions, and how we create seamless value for both retailers and consumers.
   

  

 We are looking for a VP of Product who can lead with global ambition, sharp execution, and a deep sense of ownership. You’ll join a
 **tight-knit leadership team** 
 working closely to shape the next decade of the company.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Define the Vision: Own the short-term execution and long-term strategy of the Volumental product suite.
* Lead & Scale: Manage, mentor, and grow a high-performing Product and Design team. Foster a culture of product excellence, user-centricity, and data-driven decision-making.
* Master the B2B2C Dynamic: Balance the needs of our direct customers (global retailers and brands) with the needs of the end-user (the shopper).
* Innovate on Data: Your job is to figure out how to leverage our unique data to create new revenue streams and features (e.g., personalized marketing, manufacturing insights).
* Cross-Functional Orchestration: collaborate closely with the CCO to visit customers, align product launches with market demands and with


**Who You Are**
* A Strategic Storyteller: You can distill complex technologies (Computer Vision/AI) into a compelling product narrative that excites brands and consumers.
* Customer-Focused: You’ll hit the road several times a year to meet customers in major global markets such as Tokyo, New York, London, Berlin, and beyond. You’ll use these firsthand insights to shape products that win worldwide.
* Experienced Leader: You have 8+ years in Product Management, with at least 3 years in a leadership role (Head of Product, VP, or CPO) within a scaling tech company.
* Hardware + Software Mindset: While you don't need to be a hardware engineer, you understand the complexities of shipping physical products combined with SaaS platforms.
* Retail/E-commerce Savvy: Love of retail, e-commerce is a plus. You understand the friction points of modern shopping.
* Data-Driven: You are comfortable with analytics and use data to validate hypotheses, but you also trust your product intuition when innovating.


**Why Volumental?**
* Global Impact: Your work will be used by shoppers in stores all over the world, from Tokyo to New York.
* Cutting-Edge Tech: Work with some of the smartest minds in 3D scanning, computer vision, and machine learning.
* Culture: We are a diverse, international team based in Stockholm. We value open communication and flat hierarchies.


 This is a full-time position based in Stockholm, reporting to the CEO.
   

  

 We welcome applicants from all backgrounds! If this role excites you but you don’t meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply—we’d love to hear from you.

title: Project Manager Testing
description:
**Project Manager Testing:** 




  





 For one of our globally leading tech clients we are urgently looking for an experienced Project Manager Testing for a long contract based in Stockholm, Sweden
 



  





 Its paying well and my client can interview asap!
 



  









**Key Responsibilities:** 




**Test Planning & Coordination** 



* Support the Test Lead in preparing detailed test plans, schedules, and phase readiness.
* Coordinate testing across functional, technical, integration, and business workstreams.
* Ensure availability of test environments, user access, test data, and tools for each phase.
* Work with business teams to collect, refine, and document business scenarios.
* Contribute to the creation and maintenance of test scripts aligned with requirements and processes.



**Test Execution & Defect Management** 



* Coordinate daily test execution for ST, SIT, FAT, and UAT cycles.
* Facilitate defect triage sessions with System Integrators (SI), solution teams, and the Test Lead.
* Track test progress, defect trends, and follow-up activities.
* Ensure defects are logged, prioritized, retested, and closed appropriately.
* Support verification of fixes and assist testers during execution.



**Stakeholder Collaboration** 



* Collaborate with Business, Solution, Data, Integration, and Vendor teams to align scope and timelines.
* Support UAT preparation, onboarding users, and coordinating execution.
* Act as a key point of contact for testers to raise risks, blockers, and dependencies.
* Coordinate with technical teams and partners during ST, SIT, and FAT activities.



**Documentation & Reporting** 



* Maintain test cases, scripts, execution logs, traceability matrices, and defect records.
* Support preparation of test status updates, dashboards, and test summary reports.
* Contribute to improving testing templates, processes, and documentation standards.



  





  





**Essential Skills:** 



* Test planning & coordination
* ST/SIT/FAT/UAT execution support
* Defect triage & management
* Cross-team collaboration (Business, Data, Integration, Vendors)
* Documentation & reporting (logs, matrices, dashboards)
* Strong communication & stakeholder management
* Understanding of cloud and integration testing environments



  





  





 If this is you, then please do not delay in applying!

title: Lead Data Analyst – Advanced Analytics
description:
**Job Description**

 As a Lead Data Analyst focused on Advanced Analytics, you will play a key role in enabling teams across the organization to leverage data science and statistical modeling for smarter decision-making. You will drive the adoption of advanced analytical techniques, foster a culture of experimentation, and support the development of scalable, high-impact analytical solutions.
   

  





 Your work will focus on empowering others through knowledge sharing, mentoring, and the creation of reusable models, frameworks, and methodologies. You will lead initiatives that improve analytical maturity, ensure consistency in the use of predictive and statistical methods, and promote continuous learning and innovation in the use of data.
   

  





 The role requires a high degree of autonomy and initiative, with an emphasis on proactively identifying opportunities to apply advanced analytics to business challenges. Success in this position depends on the ability to navigate a complex, cross-functional environment, build alignment across diverse teams, and drive impactful initiatives that elevate the organization’s overall analytical capabilities. A strong understanding of business context and the ability to prioritize efforts based on strategic needs are essential to ensure that enablement activities deliver tangible value.
   

  





**WHAT YOU’LL DO:**



* Champion best practices in statistical modeling, machine learning, and experimentation across teams to ensure consistency and quality.
* Proactively identify opportunities to apply advanced analytics to improve decision-making and business outcomes.
* Lead the development of reusable analytical assets, templates, and frameworks that promote scalability and efficiency.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their analytical needs and guide them in applying effective modeling and experimentation approaches.
* Design and deliver training sessions, workshops, and documentation to upskill colleagues in advanced analytics tools, methodologies, and interpretation.
* Monitor the adoption and performance of analytical solutions, gathering feedback and iterating to maximize impact.
* Stay current with emerging technologies and trends in data science and translate them into actionable strategies for the organization.
* Mentor colleagues and contribute to a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous improvement.
* Lead strategic analytics initiatives that align with business goals and drive measurable value.



**WHO YOU ARE:**




 We are looking for people with…
   

  




* Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* High proficiency in SQL for querying and managing data.
* Strong programming skills in Python or R, with experience in machine learning libraries and statistical packages.
* Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
* Solid understanding of statistical modeling, hypothesis testing, and experimental design.
* Experience with data mining, wrangling, and feature engineering techniques.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their data services.
* Strong business acumen and the ability to translate business requirements into analytical solutions.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Advanced presentation skills, with the ability to engage and persuade senior stakeholders with data-driven insights.
* Proven experience in mentoring and upskilling colleagues, including designing and delivering training, creating learning resources, and fostering a collaborative learning environment.
* Continuous learning mindset and ability to stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and best practices in advanced analytics.



**Why Join Us?**




 At H&M, you’ll be part of a dynamic global team working on one of the most business-critical platforms. This is an opportunity to take on end-to-end technical ownership of a complex system, collaborate across international teams, and contribute directly to how H&M continues to innovate in the fashion and retail space.
   

  





 We offer a collaborative workplace, opportunities for professional growth, and the chance to make a tangible impact in one of the world’s leading retail organizations.
   

  





  

  

  

  




**Additional Information**

**WHO WE ARE**
  

 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

  

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here
   

  





**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

  

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  





**JOIN US**
  

 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  





**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: Platform Success Manager
description:
**FICO (NYSE: FICO)** 
 is a leading global analytics software company, helping businesses in 100+ countries make better decisions. Join our world-class team today and fulfill your career potential!
   

  

**The Opportunity**
*“As a Platform Success Manager, you will serve as a strategic advisor and trusted partner to enterprise customers leveraging the FICO Platform. Balancing business acumen with technical understanding, you will ensure customers achieve measurable value through effective platform adoption, operational alignment, and ongoing engagement. Your mission is to drive customer success by aligning platform capabilities with strategic goals, ensuring both business impact and operational excellence.”* 
 - Platform Success, Senior Director
   

  

**What You'll Contribute**
* Build and maintain strong, trust-based relationships with business stakeholders, product owners, and executive sponsors.
* Conduct strategic planning and regular business reviews to align platform usage with customers' evolving goals.
* Drive value realization by linking platform capabilities to business outcomes across industries like banking, insurance, and telecom.
* Lead enablement and ongoing engagement efforts to maximize customer adoption and satisfaction.
* Promote usage of platform features through best practices, tailored training, and data-driven recommendations.
* Facilitate change management and empower customers to become self-sufficient users of the platform.
* Partner with technical teams (DevOps, Engineering, IT) to ensure secure, scalable, and compliant platform deployments.
* Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs), usage patterns, and service health to proactively identify risks or optimization opportunities.
* Support incident response and ensure timely communication, transparency, and continuous improvement.
* Act as the voice of the customer across internal teams, influencing product direction and support priorities based on field insights.
* Work closely with Sales and Professional Services to identify expansion opportunities and align on customer growth strategies.
* Develop and maintain success plans that integrate functional outcomes, platform performance metrics, and strategic objectives.


**What We're Seeking**
* 5+ years of experience in customer success, platform consulting, or strategic account management, preferably with enterprise SaaS/PaaS platforms.
* Demonstrated ability to engage both business and technical stakeholders, translating complex concepts into clear value propositions.
* Strong business acumen and experience driving measurable outcomes in highly regulated or data-driven industries.
* Familiarity with cloud-native platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), APIs, and platform health metrics—enough to collaborate effectively with technical teams.
* Excellent communication, facilitation, and stakeholder management skills.
* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field.


**Our Offer to You**
* An inclusive culture strongly reflecting our core values: Act Like an Owner, Delight Our Customers and Earn the Respect of Others.
* The opportunity to make an impact and develop professionally by leveraging your unique strengths and participating in valuable learning experiences.
* Highly competitive compensation, benefits and rewards programs that encourage you to bring your best every day and be recognized for doing so.
* An engaging, people-first work environment offering work/life balance, employee resource groups, and social events to promote interaction and camaraderie.


**Why Make a Move to FICO?**
 At FICO, you can develop your career with a leading organization in one of the fastest-growing fields in technology today – Big Data analytics. You’ll play a part in our commitment to help businesses use data to improve every choice they make, using advances in artificial intelligence, machine learning, optimization, and much more.
   

  

 FICO makes a real difference in the way businesses operate worldwide:
   

  

* Credit Scoring — FICO® Scores are used by 90 of the top 100 US lenders.
* Fraud Detection and Security — 4 billion payment cards globally are protected by FICO fraud systems.
* Lending — 3/4 of US mortgages are approved using the FICO Score.


 Global trends toward digital transformation have created tremendous demand for FICO’s solutions, placing us among the world’s top 100 software companies by revenue. We help many of the world’s largest banks, insurers, retailers, telecommunications providers and other firms reach a new level of success. Our success is dependent on really talented people – just like you – who thrive on the collaboration and innovation that’s nurtured by a diverse and inclusive environment. We’ll provide the support you need, while ensuring you have the freedom to develop your skills and grow your career. Join FICO and help change the way business thinks!
   

  

 Learn more about how you can fulfil your potential at www.fico.com/Careers
   

  

 FICO promotes a culture of inclusion and seeks to attract a diverse set of candidates for each job opportunity. We are an equal employment opportunity employer and we’re proud to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all candidates without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. Research has shown that women and candidates from underrepresented communities may not apply for an opportunity if they don’t meet all stated qualifications. While our qualifications are clearly related to role success, each candidate’s profile is unique and strengths in certain skill and/or experience areas can be equally effective. If you believe you have many, but not necessarily all, of the stated qualifications we encourage you to apply.
   

  

 Information submitted with your application is subject to the FICO Privacy policy at https://www.fico.com/en/privacy-policy

title: Data Scientist within Component Lifetime Prognostics
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We are now looking for an experienced Data Scientist to strengthen the Component Prognostics team within the Connected Analytics unit. You will be working as part of an agile team to enable various units within TRATON R&D worldwide in creating predictive component models. As part of the team, you will participate in the short- and long-term planning of deliveries and technologies, the prioritization and according implementation.
   

  

 Before all, you will bring in your competence to develop predictive component models for the brands’ connected services to improve the customers’ uptime, based on the connected data of a fleet of a several hundred thousand vehicles. You will cooperate tightly with upstream and downstream partners (data engineers, data consumers, analysts and product and service owners) as well as with domain experts for the components of the vehicles.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Develop models for vehicle components to predict remaining useful life and maintenance intervals for individual vehicles based on connected vehicle data
* Take ownership for the complete life-cycle of the solutions you create, from requirements, planning, implementation to maintenance and continuous improvements
* Accelerate and scale the team’s efforts by applying latest technologies and methods in the field of data science and AI
* Contribute to the continuous improvement process of the team and share your knowledge to support the journey to being a data-driven and AI-ready company
* Ensure reliable, scalable and cyber secure solutions by applying and continuously improving the team’s DevSecOps methods
* Keep a clear focus on the value for the customers of the group’s brands Scania, MAN and International


**Who You Are**
 As a person, you are analytical and delivery-oriented, with a genuine technical interest. You enjoy collaboration with different competences to improve your skills continuously and to find the best possible solution to a problem. Establishing a personal network within the organization is easy for you.
   

  

 As an experienced data scientist, you have worked with large scale data sets and industrial solutions in cloud environments. You show professional habits and skills when it comes to tooling, coding, testing, deploying and documentation. You have a proven track record in at least some of the relevant areas of the field such as statistics, machine learning, data processing, DevSecOps, data- and ML-pipelining, predictive maintenance, cloud infrastructure.
   

  

 Having been engaged in component modelling and the automotive industry previously is a merit.
   

  

 Your work is based on the following (or comparable) skills and tooling (examples): Python / SQL, AWS, CICD, Gitlab, Snowflake / Databricks.
   

  

 You have an academic education at university level in computer science, engineering physics, electrical engineering or equivalent work experience. You communicate fluently in English, in both speech and writing.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 Our unit is part of the Connected Vehicle Data and Analytics section within the Cloud Embedded Platform domain of TRATON R&D, which is the global development organization for the brands Scania and MAN in Europe and the brand International in the US. With our global organization, we deliver innovative and sustainable solutions with the customer value at the heart of everything.
   

  

 The team Component Prognostics is part of a line- and flow-organization which is working globally according to SAFe. Within our organization, we value a culture of collaboration and learning, with respect for the individual. Within our team, you have the opportunity to shape your work and the future of the transportation industry with us.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-12-10. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Frank Deubzer, Group Manager, frank.deubzer@scania.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: IT arkitekt infrastruktur
description:
Vi söker nu en IT arkitekt infrastruktur till vår IT-avdelning.
   

  

 På IT-avdelningen är vi ca 350 medarbetare och vårt samhällsviktiga uppdrag gör att vi behöver bli fler. Som en del av vår IT-avdelning kommer du att jobba i en utvecklande miljö, med fokus på medarbetares engagemang och nya idéer. Vi lägger samtidigt mycket energi på att skapa en inkluderande kultur med fokus på jämställdhet och hållbara medarbetare. Vi tror att olika perspektiv och erfarenheter gör oss bättre!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Rollen innebär huvudsakligen att leda arkitekturarbetet inom IT-infrastrukturenheten.
   

  

 Du ansvarar för att ta fram förslag på IT-infrastrukturarkitektur, besluta om IT-infrastrukturarkitektur samt säkerställa att beslutad arkitektur följs.
   

  

 Vår utveckling inom IT-avdelningen sker enligt SAFe-ramverket. Vi är virtuellt organiserade i en tågstruktur enligt SAFe-ramverket och det finns ett infrastrukturtåg.
   

  

 I rollen ingår du även i tågledningen för infrastrukturtåget.
   

  

 Du kommer därför primärt att jobba inom ett infrastrukturtåg med att analysera, utvärdera, planera och dokumentera olika arkitekturella lösningar för IT-infrastruktur.
   

  

**Din profil**
 För att trivas i rollen som IT arkitekt infrastruktur hos oss är det viktigt att du som person har god analytisk och problemlösande förmåga samt en god samarbetsförmåga. Du behöver kunna ta egna initiativ, ha ett gott omdöme och ha en helhetssyn på verksamheten för att kunna verka i rollen.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och lämplighet för rollen.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Minst gymnasieutbildning
* Mycket goda kunskaper om IT-infrastruktur, server, virtualisering, container, lagring, nätverk
* Minst tre års erfarenhet av att ha jobbat i en motsvarande roll
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Akademisk utbildning inom relevant område
* Erfarenhet av arbete enligt agila metoder som tex SAFe


**Vi erbjuder**
 Ett myndighetsuppdrag som är viktigt på riktigt! En arbetsplats där vi värnar om att våra medarbetare ska ha en god balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi erbjuder flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet att jobba delvis hemifrån. Som statligt anställd har du även goda anställningsvillkor och ett förmånspaket med friskvård, lediga klämdagar samt goda semester- och pensionsvillkor. Vårt kontor i Stockholm ligger centralt.
   

  

 Du kan läsa mer om våra förmåner och hur det är att jobba hos oss här.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid och vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning.
   

  

 Anställningen kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass.
   

  

 Placeringsort är Stockholm eller Luleå.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 Vi jobbar kompetensbaserat i hela processen och är måna om en inkluderande, rättvis, objektiv och kandidatvänlig process. Därför ber vi dig att besvara ett antal urvalsfrågor istället för att be om personligt brev.
   

  

 Vi kan komma att använda oss av arbetspsykologiska tester.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter kontakta rekryterande chef som hjälper dig med din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka och välkomnar därför sökande med olika bakgrund.
   

  

 Inför rekryteringsarbetet har vi tagit ställning till annonskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför ytterligare kontakt med media-/annonsförsäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.
   

  

 Pensionsmyndigheten ansvarar för den allmänna pensionen och informerar om hela pensionen. Varje år betalar vi ut cirka 415 miljarder kronor till 2,3 miljoner pensionärer, genomför cirka 911 000 fondbyten och skickar ut 8 miljoner orange kuvert. Vi har ca 25 miljoner digitala kundkontakter per år. Vi är cirka 1700 medarbetare på åtta orter, från Luleå i norr till Halmstad i söder.
   

  

 Vi gör pensionen enklare.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: PSL 2025-184 | Kontakt: Per Schölin 46104542258, | Facklig företrädare: Anna-Karin Åhrman Cortelius, Saco-s 010-4543914, Michael Karlsson, ST 010-4543427, | Publicerat: 2025-11-24 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-14

title: Data Engineer / Cloud Developer within Advanced Analytics
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We are now looking for a seasoned developer within Data Engineering to strengthen the Product Analytics team within the Connected Analytics unit. You will be working as part of an agile team to enable various units within TRATON R&D worldwide in accessing comprehensive amounts of connected vehicle data and create data products, self-service analytics and visualizations based on the data of a fleet of several hundred thousand vehicles. As part of the team, you will participate in the short- and long-term planning of deliveries and technologies, the prioritization and according implementation.
   

  

 In your role, you will bring in your competence and efforts to continuously improve and scale the toolset through which we create data availability and insights for the various consumers within TRATON R&D. You will cooperate with data providers and consumers alike (data engineers, data scientists and AI experts, engineers, analysts, statisticians, product and service owners) and develop high quality data products and self-service in a sustainable and scalable way.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Scale up and continuously improve the toolset to enable advanced analytics and data sharing for TRATON R&D
* Develop data products and create insights based on connected vehicle data
* Take ownership for the complete life-cycle of the solutions you create, from requirements, planning, implementation to maintenance and continuous improvements
* Accelerate and scale the team’s efforts by applying latest technologies and methods
* Contribute to the continuous improvement process of the team and share your knowledge to support the journey to being a data-driven and AI-ready company
* Ensure reliable, scalable and cyber secure solutions by applying and continuously improving the team’s DevSecOps methods
* Keep a clear focus on efficiency, managing the balance between cost, customer value and elimination of waste


**Who You Are**
 As a person, you are analytical and communicative. Establishing a personal network within the organization to find the best possible solution to a problem is easy for you. You embrace diversity and cooperation and are experienced in mentoring and leading teams. You have a supportive mindset when engaging stakeholders and consumers of your solutions, and like to put in an extra effort for satisfied customers.
   

  

 In your career, you have worked with large scale data sets and industrial solutions in cloud environments. You show professional habits and skills when it comes to tooling, coding, testing, deploying and documentation. You have a proven track record in at least some of the relevant areas of the field such as cloud data warehouses, data processing, statistics, data science and analytics, data- and ML-pipelining, DevSecOps, cloud infrastructure and agile development.
   

  

 Having worked with operational vehicle data, diagnostic data, geospatial data, or comparable large data sets in similar industries is a merit; as is leadership experience as Scrum Master, Project Lead or similar.
   

  

 Your work is based on the following (or comparable) skills and tooling (examples): Python / SQL / C#, AWS, CICD, Gitlab, Grafana, Snowflake, Databricks, Azure AD, front-end development (e.g. Vue) and visualization, statistics and analytics (e.g. SAS Viya, Power-BI).
   

  

 You have an academic education at university level in computer science, engineering physics, electrical engineering or equivalent work experience. You communicate fluently in English, in both speech and writing.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 Our unit is part of the Connected Vehicle Data and Analytics section within the Cloud Embedded Platform domain of TRATON R&D, which is the global development organization for the brands Scania and MAN in Europe and the brand International in the US. With our global organization, we deliver innovative and sustainable solutions with the customer value at the heart of everything.
   

  

 The team Product Analytics is part of a line- and flow-organization which is working globally according to SAFe. We ensure that TRATON R&D has access to the data and analytics capabilities needed for informed decision making.
   

  

 Within our organization, we value a culture of collaboration and learning, with respect for the individual. As a member of the team, you have the opportunity to shape your work and the future of the transportation industry with us.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-12-10. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Frank Deubzer, Group Manager, frank.deubzer@scania.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: SAP ME Consultant
description:

title: Software Engineer within Clinical Decision Support
description:
*Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions supports health care professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish healthcare. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.*
**The position**
 Cambio Clinical Decision Support (CDS) is looking for a Fullstack Software Engineer to help us transform the way clinical decisions are supported at the point of care. The CDS team builds intelligent software tools that integrate patient data, clinical guidelines, and analytics into real-time decision-making for healthcare professionals.
   

  

 You will work across both backend and frontend development to build scalable, data-driven applications that impact thousands of clinicians and patients. Our infrastructure follows a modern DevOps approach with continuous integration and delivery.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain high-quality features across the full stack
* Build scalable backend services using Kotlin/Java, Spring Boot, and containerized environments (Docker/Kubernetes)
* Develop performant and accessible frontends using HTML, CSS, JavaScript/TypeScript, and Web Components
* Collaborate with requirement owners, developers, and clinical rule modelers to extend our platform
* Contribute to architectural and design decisions with a focus on quality, reliability, and user experience


**About You**
 You are a curious and humble team player who enjoys solving complex problems and following tasks with attention to detail. You’re motivated by the potential of health IT and the opportunity to directly improve patient care.
   

  

 At Cambio, we value initiative and personal growth. Our culture is built on Trust, Care, and Together—values we believe are important to both our work and our people. It’s important to us that you recognize and identify with these values.
   

  

**Requirements** 
  

  

* Proven experience in software development (mid to senior level)
* Strong understanding of HTTP/REST and API design
* Experience developing services with Kotlin/Java/Spring Boot and Docker/Kubernetes
* Solid grasp of HTML, CSS, modern JavaScript/TypeScript, and Web Components
* Professional working proficiency in English


**It's a bonus if you**
* Experience in healthcare or health technology
* Experience in user-centered design and accessibility
* Understanding of machine learning, NLP, or GenAI-based systems
* Experience with rules-based or business process support systems
* Experience deploying and monitoring cloud infrastructure
* Proficiency in Linux/macOS development environments


**Place of employment** 
 : Stockholm
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full-time, hybrid work model (three days per week in-office)
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

**Additional Information:** 
 The role involves access to sensitive information, therefore a background check will be conducted on the final candidate.
   

  

 We review applications and conduct interviews on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
**CAMBIO- FOR A HEALTHIER TOMORROW**
 Welcome to a company where healthcare is improved every day. Here you will work with leading technology in a collaborative, trusting and empowering environment where your contribution will be appreciated and celebrated. In our caring culture you will have the opportunity to pursue different paths of professional growth. Seize the opportunity to do the most important work of your life
 **.** 
 Read more about us
 **here!**
**A healthier tomorrow also means taking care of those who make it possible** 
**-** 
 explore our employee benefits
   

  

 Learn more about our recruitment process here
   

  

 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at our career site.
   

  

 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: Enterprise Sales Executive – Healthcare Informatics
description:
Job Title
   

  

 Enterprise Sales Executive – Healthcare Informatics
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a
 **Enterprise Sales Executive – Healthcare Informatics** 
 , you will be responsible for focused customer sales and account management, optimizing and positioning the various solutions within the Enterprise Informatics portfolio. You will play a crucial role in increasing sales volume and developing strong relationships with customers to establish Philips as their preferred supplier.
   

  

**Your Role**
* Drive sales within the Enterprise Informatics portfolio and manage accounts, ensuring optimal product mix and sales volume.
* Develop and maintain robust customer relationships, positioning Philips as a preferred supplier.
* Execute sales strategies to exceed quotas, coordinating projects and initiatives to boost team and individual performance.
* Monitor customer activities to ensure visibility and prioritization of sales opportunities.
* Resolve issues creatively while fostering a compliant and impactful culture.
* Network with senior professionals to remain informed about industry trends and leverage this knowledge for business success.


**You're The Right Fit If You**
* Hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree, bringing a strong academic foundation to your role.
* Have a minimum of 5 years of experience in sales or account management, showcasing your ability to drive results and manage relationships effectively.
* Possess experience in the healthcare or medtech industries and have established networks within the Swedish healthcare sector.
* Fluent written and verbal in English and Swedish language – is a must have
* Driving license (Swedish B) and willingness to travel.


**How We Work Together**
 We believe that we are better together than apart. For our office-based teams, this means working in-person at least 3 days per week.
   

  

 Onsite roles require full-time presence in the company’s facilities.
   

  

 Field roles are most effectively done outside of the company’s main facilities, generally at the customers’ or suppliers’ locations.
   

  

 This role is an field role.
   

  

**About Philips**
 We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help the lives of others.
   

  

* Learn more about our business.
* Discover our rich and exciting history.
* Learn more about our purpose.


 If you’re interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our culture of impact with care here.

title: Senior Platform Engineer - Frontend, Consumer Web Platform
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 Wolt is looking for a
 **Senior Frontend Engineer** 
 with
 **DevOps** 
 mindset to expand our
 **Consumer Web Platform** 
 team. The team is part of the Consumer Product Group and is responsible for enabling the delivery of the consumer web apps – most notably wolt.com – that millions of people in over 32 countries around the world see when ordering food and other products.
   

  

 Our client platform teams share a clear mission:
   

  

**“Enable delivery and ownership of Wolt-grade Consumer Client Applications through engineering excellence and domain expertise.”**
**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Building the Foundation of our top-rated consumer-facing applications, ensuring high performance, security, and reliability at scale.
* Enabling Product Teams: You’ll provide a robust platform that makes it simple and fast for our feature teams to reach millions of users.
* Driving Technical Initiatives around architecture, developer experience, observability, performance, and more.
* Supporting Engineering Excellence: Champion best practices, improve developer workflows, and continually raise the bar for code quality.
* Long-Term Thinking: Balance short-term deliverables with long-term platform health to maintain a maintainable, extensible, and secure environment.


 If you love collaborating with multiple engineering stakeholders, focusing on the long-term quality of the user experience, and making life easier for fellow engineers, this is the team for you!
   

  

 📍This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in
 **Helsinki, Stockholm, Berlin or Tallinn** 
 . Read more about our hybrid setup here.
   

  

 Feel free to check out the Wolt Tech Blog for more insight into our culture and technology.
   

  

**Must haves**
* Proven experience in ensuring platform reliability, performance and developer experience, using TypeScript and React.
* Deep understanding of modern web technologies and performance optimization techniques.
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines, deployment processes, and cloud infrastructure (CI/CD pipelines, Docker, Kubernetes).
* Track record of diagnosing and resolving complex performance issues.
* Able to lead and drive technical projects and improvements across an engineering organization.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to write efficient, maintainable, and scalable code.
* Strong communication skills with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.


**Nice to haves**
* Hands-on experience with frontend build tools, module bundlers, and performance profiling tools.
* Strong knowledge of browser rendering behavior and optimization strategies.
* Experience or strong interest in web observability (Datadog or similar).


**Why Join Us?**
* Impact: Build and shape the core web platform that supports millions of users worldwide.
* Collaboration: Work with talented engineers across Wolt to deliver real value to customers.
* Growth: Take on complex challenges and grow your skill set in a supportive, forward-thinking environment.
* Culture: Be part of a diverse, open-minded team that values creativity, autonomy, and continuous learning.


 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Databasadministratörer till Knowit FLX Stockholm
description:
**Vad vi söker**
 Vi söker dig som är en senior databasadmin och vill arbeta med moderna databasmiljöer där stabil drift, bra prestanda och tydlig struktur står i centrum. Du får vara del av lösningar som stöttar både verksamhet och utveckling inom flera olika branscher.
   

  

 Knowit har ett stort antal kunder inom både privat och offentlig sektor. Vi söker dig som vill bidra till stabila och framtidssäkra databaser oavsett om det gäller cloud, traditionell drift eller en kombination.
   

  

**Exempel på uppgifter**
* Drift, optimering och förvaltning av databaser i både on-prem och cloud-miljöer
* Prestandatuning (queries, index, optimering av resurser och planer)
* Installation, migrering, uppgraderingar och konfigurering av databasmiljöer
* Säkerhet, rättighetsstyrning och accessmodeller
* Backup, restore och disaster recovery för databaser i hybridmiljö
* Sätta upp och förbättra övervakning, larm och kapacitetsplanering
* Delta i design av databasarkitektur och integrationslösningar
* Stödja utvecklingsteam i datamodellering, schemaförändringar och deployment
* Dokumentation och etablering av rutiner och best practices


**Erfarenhet**
 Du behöver inte kunna allt men vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av några av följande. SQL Server, Oracle, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, databastjänster i större molnleverantörer, grundläggande modeller för prestandafelsökning, säkerhet och automatisering.
   

  

**Varför Knowit Solutions FLX**
 Hos oss väljer du själv lön, pension, uppdrag och arbetstid. Du ingår i ett mindre bolag med snabba beslut men får samtidigt styrkan av en stor koncern. Vi erbjuder många kunduppdrag inom både offentlig och privat sektor och ett starkt nätverk av erfarna kollegor. Hos oss blir du en del av ett kompetent nätverk av kollegor, får stöd av en stark säljorganisation som matchar dig med rätt uppdrag och har styrkan hos ett av Nordens största IT konsultbolag i ryggen.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Fullstack Engineer - Commercial Tech
description:
As a Fullstack Engineer at Embark, you will be a Gamemaker in a technical team that builds and maintains internal tools that empower our game teams and improve the studio’s efficiency. Your role will directly support game development by creating solutions that automates and streamlines workflows, and provides valuable analytics. You will also be contributing to commercial projects like tools for monetization and customer support.
   

  

 The team’s goal is to deliver scalable, user-friendly, and cost-efficient solutions that help our teams create dynamic and engaging player experiences. You’ll collaborate closely with game teams, data teams, and the commercial team, reporting to the Tech Lead in Commercial Tech.
   

  

 As an integral part of a creative and autonomous team, you’ll contribute to high-quality tools and systems for both developers and players. For the frontend we use technologies like React, TypeScript and NextJS. For the backend we use Go, protobuf, Python, and OpenAPI.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Develop and improve internal tools for game teams and studio-wide use.
* Automate workflows to reduce manual effort and enhance efficiency.
* Build personalized store recommendation systems and tools.
* Continuously refine engineering practices to ensure services are easy to deploy, scale, and maintain.
* Collaborate with multiple teams to deliver tools and solutions that improve both developer and player experiences.


**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind
* Solid experience with React, TypeScript, NextJS, Go, Python and the GCP stack.
* Proven ability to build internal data-driven tools and services.
* Experience deploying and maintaining services on cloud infrastructure.
* Strong background in analytics and data-driven tooling.
* Analytical mindset, self-driven and capable of taking projects from idea to implementation.
* Experience in the gaming industry or other consumer-facing products.
* Passion for games, interactive experiences and new technologies.
* Professional English communication skills.


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Systems Architect – Ground Systems
description:
**Job Description**
 Welcome to SSC – Swedish Space Corporation, the perfect workplace for those passionate about technology in general and space in particular.
   

  

 With space organizations, research institutes, institutional and commercial actors as customers, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications, space consulting services, rocket and balloon systems, flight test services, satellite propulsion systems, and much more.
   

  

 SSC also has one of the world’s largest global networks of ground stations for satellite communications. We own and operate the Esrange Space Center in Kiruna,
   

  

 northern Sweden, with the aim of launching satellites in the near future.
   

  

**Are you passionate about space exploration?**
**Do you want to play a critical role in enabling** 
**communication for** 
**missions around Earth, and beyond?** 

 If you answer yes to these questions, we invite you to seize the opportunity to make a significant impact as our Systems Architect for Ground Station as a Service solutions to provide domain expertise to existing and future solutions.
   

  

**Job Requirements**
 YOUR ROLE
   

  

 As a System Architect, you will play a central role in defining and evolving the architecture and features of our global ground segment services covering both software and hardware systems. You will ensure that our systems are robust, interoperable, and ready to meet the demands of the rapidly changing space industry.
   

  

**In This Role, You Will**
* Define, initiate development, and improve the architecture of end-to-end ground segment services, integrating both software and hardware systems.
* Be a technical leader and provider of domain expertise for satellite communications and spacecraft operations domain topics.
* Lead and coordinate technical activities involving multiple teams and disciplines.
* Contribute to system-level analyses, reviews, and improvement initiatives in collaboration with other teams.
* Support bids and projects with technical expertise.


**Job Responsibilities**
 WHO YOU ARE
   

  

 We are looking for candidates who combine deep technical knowledge with strong systems thinking and expertise in ground systems for spacecraft communications and/or spacecraft operations.
   

  

**You Likely Have**
* A university degree in electrical engineering, space technology, or a related field.
* Experience and strong interest in spacecraft communications and/or spacecraft operations.
* Excellent communication skills, able to translate complex system concepts to diverse audiences.
* A structured and pragmatic mindset, focused on achieving operational reliability and long-term excellence.


**We Especially Value Experience In**
* CCSDS standards (for example TM/TC, SLE, CFDP, DTN) in operational or development contexts.
* TT&C systems, including baseband processing, data reception chains, and ground station interfaces.
* RF systems and link analysis (modulation, coding, spectrum usage, link budgets).
* Orbit dynamics or mission design concepts.


**Job Benefits**
 WE OFFER YOU
   

  

* A unique opportunity to contribute to a wide range of projects and play an active role in both the Swedish and international space industry.
* An excellent opportunity for personal and career development.
* An exciting, international workplace characterized by an open atmosphere and proud employees all over the world.


 Additional benefits
   

  

* In addition to vacation and traditional public holidays, we offer extra paid leave throughout the year, such as time off between Christmas and New Year, Ascension Day, amounting to 6-11 extra days depending on the calendar.
* Wellness allowance of SEK 5,000 per year.
* Health benefits such as voluntary health insurance and regular health checks for eligible employees.
* Access to a benefit bike through a tax-efficient leasing program.
* Support for employee-driven activities that promote connection, health, and culture across teams.
* Collective Agreement, including good pensions plans, parental pay and insurance.


  

  

 LOCATION
   

  

 This is a full-time, permanent position based at our office in either Solna or Kiruna.
   

  

 FURTHER INFORMATION
   

  

 For questions regarding the position, you are welcome to contact:
   

  

 Petrus Hyvönen, Head of Engineering (petrus.hyvonen@sscspace.com)
   

  

 For questions regarding employment terms or union-related matters, you are welcome to contact our union representatives:
   

  

 Sveriges Ingenjörer: SverigesIngenjorer-AF@sscspace.com
   

  

 Unionen: unionen@sscspace.com
   

  

  

  

 NEXT STEP
   

  

 If this opportunity sparks your interest, don’t wait to apply! Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis, and interviews will be conducted continuously. We kindly ask you to submit your CV when applying. While you are welcome to include a brief personal note or letter, our evaluation will primarily focus on your skills and qualifications as outlined in your CV, ensuring a fair and unbiased recruitment process.
   

  

 Please note that the job advertisement may close earlier than the stated deadline if we receive a high volume of applications. This allows us to ensure a fair and efficient recruitment process and give each application the attention it deserves.
   

  

 This is a security-classified position and will require a background check prior to employment.
   

  

 We welcome your application no later than 2025-12-01.
   

  

 WE HELP EARTH BENEFIT FROM SPACE
   

  

 Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) is a leading global provider of advanced space services, with more than 50 years of experience. We help space organizations, research institutes, commercial and institutional actors from all over the world to get access to space.
   

  

 With local presence on all continents and about 700 committed employees, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications and satellite control services, spacecraft operations, rocket and balloon systems, launch services and flight test services, as well as engineering, operations and consultancy services for space missions.
   

  

 We help Earth benefit from Space. Learn more at sscspace.com

title: Software Engineer - Backend & Cloud
description:
**Job Description**
 Welcome to SSC – Swedish Space Corporation, the perfect workplace for those passionate about technology in general and space in particular.
   

  

 With space organizations, research institutes, institutional and commercial actors as customers, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications, space consulting services, rocket and balloon systems, flight test services, satellite propulsion systems, and much more.
   

  

 SSC also has one of the world’s largest global networks of ground stations for satellite communications. We own and operate the Esrange Space Center in Kiruna, northern Sweden, with the aim of launching satellites in the near future.
   

  

 Are you fueled by a passion for people and the ambition to create an awesome workplace?
   

  

 Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey with us to help Earth benefit from space?
   

  

 If you answer yes to these questions, we invite you to seize the opportunity to make a significant impact in building the software that connects satellites with earth.
   

  

**Job Requirements**
 YOUR ROLE
   

  

 At SSC Connect we enable global satellite communication, and you will be part of the Software unit that makes it happen.
   

  

 As our Software Engineer (Backend & Cloud), you’ll develop and maintain the critical systems that keep our customers connected with their satellites every day.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design, build and maintain high-quality code for new and existing software applications powering SSC’s services.
* Improve automation for software testing, deployment and delivery pipelines.
* Enhance system observability by developing solutions for monitoring, logging and alerting.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of our agile ways of working.

**Job Responsibilities**
 WHO YOU ARE
   

  

 You are someone who cares about your systems, your users and your colleagues.
   

  

 You have a creative yet structured mindset, and you’re motivated by solving complex problems and finding efficient solutions. You’re comfortable taking initiatives, working both independently and collaboratively, and you enjoy transforming ideas into robust and scalable solutions.
   

  

 We believe you have a BSc or similar degree in Computer Science or Engineering and several years of experience in software development.
