* Health benefits such as voluntary health insurance and regular health checks for eligible employees.
* Access to a benefit bike through a tax-efficient leasing program.
* Support for employee-driven activities that promote connection, health, and culture across teams.
* Collective Agreement, including good pensions plans, parental pay and insurance


  

  

 LOCATION
   

  

 This is a full-time, permanent position based at our office in Solna.
   

  

 FURTHER INFORMATION
   

  

 For questions regarding employment terms or union-related matters, you are welcome to contact our union representatives:
   

  

 Sveriges Ingenjörer: SverigesIngenjorer-AF@sscspace.com
   

  

 Unionen: unionen@sscspace.com
   

  

  

  

 NEXT STEP
   

  

 If this opportunity sparks your interest, don’t wait to apply! Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis, and interviews will be conducted continuously. We kindly ask you to submit your CV when applying. While you are welcome to include a brief personal note or letter, our evaluation will primarily focus on your skills and qualifications as outlined in your CV, ensuring a fair and unbiased recruitment process.
   

  

 Please note that the job advertisement may close earlier than the stated deadline if we receive a high volume of applications. This allows us to ensure a fair and efficient recruitment process and give each application the attention it deserves.
   

  

 This is a security-classified position and will require a background check prior to employment.
   

  

 We welcome your application no later than 2025-12-15.
   

  

 WE HELP EARTH BENEFIT FROM SPACE
   

  

 Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) is a leading global provider of advanced space services, with more than 50 years of experience. We help space organizations, research institutes, commercial and institutional actors from all over the world to get access to space.
   

  

 With local presence on all continents and about 700 committed employees, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications and satellite control services, spacecraft operations, rocket and balloon systems, launch services and flight test services, as well as engineering, operations and consultancy services for space missions.

title: Observability Engineer till Ving
description:
**Vill du vara med och stärka vår observability-förmåga och ta ett helhetsansvar för övervakning i en modern molnmiljö? Vi söker nu en Observability Engineer till vårt observabilityteam i Stockholm. I den här rollen blir du en nyckelperson som driver området framåt tillsammans med våra utvecklingsteam.**
**Om tjänsten**
 Nu söker vi en engagerad och leveransfokuserad Observability Engineer. Man kommer att ansvara för monitorering, loggning och prestanda, med fokus på att säkerställa insyn, tillgänglighet och bra utvecklarupplevelse.
   

  

 Vår försäljning sker primärt i våra appar/webbar så tillgängligheten för våra kunder är prio ett. Våra utvecklingsteam jobbar agilt i snabba releasecykler med continuous delivery. Teamen ansvarar för hela kedjan från kravförståelse, utveckling, deploy till förvaltning och support. Vår strategi är ”Cloud first”, därför värdesätter vi kunskap om molnlösningar och Azure.
   

  

 Du blir en nyckelperson i ägarskapet av vår observability förmåga och att hjälpa teamen att stärka sin förmåga kring observability.
   

  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter**
* Uppsättning och underhåll av dashboards
* Underhåll av gemensamma syntetiska tester
* Specialist för teamen, guidning och support för att förbättra observabilityn
* Design och implementation av loggning och observability strategier, inkluderat log och larm samt proaktiv monitorering
* Felsökning på applikationsnivå.
* Övergripande ansvar för versioner, licenser och användare samt kontakt person emot leverantören
* Konfigurering och administration
* Vara drivande i Observability Forum


****Vår tekniska miljö****
 Vi är 13 utvecklingsteam på IT-avdelningen i Stockholm som tillsammans driver utvecklingen framåt. Våra system byggs i en modern Microsoft-miljö och vi arbetar med aktuella tekniker, ramverk och verktyg som .NET Core, C#, Node, Azure, React, React Native, JavaScript, GraphQL, MS-SQL och Redis.
   

  

 I linje med vår cloud-first-strategi satsar vi på skalbara och framtidssäkra lösningar där innovation, prestanda och kvalitet alltid står i fokus.
   

  

 Läs mer om
 **vår IT-avdelning här** 
 🧑‍💻
   

  

****Vem söker vi****
**Kvalifikationer**
* Förståelse för molntjänster kopplade till övervakning i Azure eller annan större molnplattform
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Dynatrace i större, komplexa miljöer
* Erfarenhet av att samarbeta nära utvecklingsteam och/eller DevOps-team
* Mycket god kommunikativ förmåga och vana att arbeta rådgivande gentemot andra team
* Förmåga att driva initiativ och utveckla arbetssätt inom observability
* God förståelse för observability (loggar, metrics, tracing) i distribuerade system
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av Azure Monitor, Log Analytics och Application Insights
* Erfarenhet av Infrastructure as Code (t.ex. Bicep, ARM, Terraform)
* Erfarenhet av test, kvalitetssäkring eller SRE/DevOps
* Intresse för generativ AI kopplat till observability och utvecklarupplevelse


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Vi söker dig som är nyfiken, noggrann och kommunikativ, och som trivs med att arbeta tillsammans med andra. Du har ett genuint intresse för kodning och ser styrkan i samarbete för att nå gemensamma mål.
   

  

 Med ett proaktivt förhållningssätt och förmågan att se helheten bidrar du till att driva utvecklingen framåt. Du är en lagspelare som gärna delar med dig av din kunskap, stöttar kollegor och bidrar till en öppen och lärande kultur. Vi värdesätter om du har ett intresse för DevOps och tycker om att arbeta med frågor som rör automatisering, CI/CD och infrastruktur som kod.
   

  

****Vi erbjuder****
 Vi erbjuder en spännande och utvecklande miljö. Du får en omväxlande vardag tillsammans med härliga kollegor - vi arbetar i nära samarbete med andra team och verksamheten för att ge våra gäster de bästa veckorna på året. Vi har ett högt medarbetarengagemang och en härlig kultur. Vi älskar vårt jobb och välkomnar dig ombord på vår resa i Nordic Leisure Travel Group!
   

  

 Läs mer om
 **vad vi erbjuder här** 
 🏄
   

  

****Övrigt****
 Tjänsten är en heltidstjänst och placerad på Vings fina huvudkontor på Kungsholmen i Stockholm. Det är möjligt med distansarbete upp till 2 dagar per vecka när det passar för teamet/arbetsuppgiften.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 hakan.sandstrom@nltg.com 0709513226
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av tester från Alva Labs – ett logiskt problemlösningstest och ett personlighetstest. Testerna utgår från vedertagen forskning och ger oss möjlighet att på ett mer objektivt sätt bedöma dina styrkor och eventuella utmaningar i relation till aktuell tjänst. Du får mer information när du skickat in din ansökan, men om du är nyfiken redan nu kan du läsa mer hos Alva Labs .**
**Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en bakgrundskontroll att genomföras.**
**🏄‍♂️ Kul på jobbet**
**🤝 Tjänstepension**
**🌎 Reseförmåner**
**🦉 Utveckling och lärande**
**💗 Well-being**
**💼 Hybrid arbetsplats**
 Läs mer om vad vi erbjuder här
   

  

 Ving ingår i den nordiska resekoncernenNordic Leisure Travel Group.
   

  

 I gruppen ingår researrangörerna Ving Sverige, Ving Norge, Globetrotter, Spies i Danmark, Tjäreborg i Finland, flygbolaget Sunclass Airlines samt våra egna hotellkoncept Sunwing Family Resorts, Ocean Beach Club och Sunprime Hotels. Gruppen säljer ett normalt år runt 1 250 000 resor i de nordiska länderna.
   

  

 Arbetsområde
   

  

 IT
   

  

 Roll: Development
   

  

 Platser: Stockholm
   

  

 Distansarbete: Hybridarbete
   

  

 Anställningsform: Heltid
   

  

 Kontaktperson: Håkan Sandström, hakan.sandstrom@nltg.com, 0709513226

title: OT Solution Architect
description:
Har du erfarenhet av att designa och driftsätta nätverk i produktionskritiska miljöer? Brinner du för att arbeta nära kundens verksamhet och bidra till säker och robust kommunikation inom OT och industriell IT? Då vill vi träffa dig!
   

  

 Jag heter Patrik Holmqvist och är COO på Telia Cygate – en affärsnära expertorganisation inom Telia Company. Vi växer och söker nu en
 **OT Solution Architect** 
 som vill vara med och bygga framtidens säkra OT nätverk. Rollen kombinerar teknisk expertis, säkerhetsfokus och nära samarbete med våra kunder inom samhällsviktig verksamhet.
   

  

**Vad du kommer att göra i rollen:**
 OT Solution Architect blir du en nyckelperson i att designa, driftsätta och underhålla nätverksinfrastruktur för industriella miljöer – med fokus på OT, säkerhet och tillgänglighet. Du arbetar nära både Telia Cygates experter och våra kunders drift- och IT/OT-organisationer för att säkerställa stabil och säker kommunikation i produktionskritiska miljöer. Du kommer att arbeta ute hos kund när det behövs men mestadels av arbetet sker ifrån vårt lokala kontor.
   

  

 Vi tror att vår förmåga inom nätverk, cybersäkerhet och OT, tillsammans med vår roll inom totalförsvaret, ger oss en unik position att skapa ett differentierat erbjudande till våra kunder.
   

  

* Designa och underhålla nätverksutrustning i OT-miljöer (switchar, routrar, brandväggar)
* Felsöka och hantera allvarliga incidenter i produktionskritiska nätverk
* Ansvara för arkitektur, dokumentation, förändringar och driftrutiner
* Samarbeta med drift, IT och cybersäkerhetsteam
* Implementera remote access, övervakning, visibilitet och loggning i OT-nätverk


**För att lyckas i rollen:**
 Du är analytisk, lösningsorienterad och har hög säkerhetsmedvetenhet. Du trivs i komplexa miljöer där du får vara en brygga mellan IT och OT, och du är van att arbeta strukturerat även under press.
   

  

* Flera års erfarenhet av nätverksteknik (TCP/IP, routing, switching, VPN, SD-WAN)
* Kunskap om industriella protokoll (Modbus, PROFINET, OPC UA, DNP3, EtherNet/IP)
* Förståelse för OT-miljöer, SCADA/DCS/PLC
* Erfarenhet av nätverkssäkerhet (segmentering, IDS/IPS, brandväggar)
* God dokumentationsvana och strukturerat arbetssätt.
* Certifieringar inom nätverk eller säkerhet är meriterande (ex. Cisco, Fortinet eller motsvarande)
* Erfarenhet av industriella miljöer är meriterande (energi, tillverkning, VA, fastighet eller healthcare)
* Kännedom om OT produkter från tillverkare som ABB, Hitachi, Siemens m.m., är meriterande
* Kunskap om relevanta standarder är meriterande (ISO 27001, NIS2, NERC CIP, IEC 62443)
* Erfarenhet av industrispecifika nätverkstekniker är meriterande (HSR, PRP, MRP, REP)


**Varför Telia Cygate?**
 På Telia Cygate är vi inte bara experter på nätverk, säkerhet och olika slags moln – vi är också ett gäng som tycker att det ska vara kul att gå till jobbet! Som en del av Telia Company har vi styrkan att skapa verklig påverkan i stor skala, bidra till samhällsnytta och hjälpa våra kunder att navigera i digitaliseringens värld. Vi gör det alltid med värme, omtanke och ett leende. Här är det idéerna och våra olika perspektiv som gör oss starka, och tillsammans ser vi till att teknikens värld blir en plats där alla trivs – och där du hör hemma.
   

  

 Hos oss är din utveckling viktig. Vi uppmuntrar till kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och ser till att just du och dina intressen är i fokus. Vi vet att det är människorna som utgör vårt företag, och därför värdesätter vi glädje, kreativitet och olika perspektiv i allt vi gör.
   

  

 Välkommen att växa tillsammans med oss, där vi gör teknik mänsklig och skapar verklig påverkan!
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 När du börjar hos oss får du ett omfattande förmånspaket anpassat efter din lokala marknad, möjlighet till hybridarbete och mer. Du har också chans att få bonus baserat på din prestation och Telias resultat.
   

  

**Låter det intressant?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan senast 2025-12-12. Rollen kan komma att stängas tidigare om vi hittar rätt kandidat – så vänta inte för länge!
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm, Göteborg eller Malmö
   

  

 Om du går vidare i processen kommer du att kontaktas av vår
 **Talent Acquisition Partner.** 
 Bakgrund- och referenskontroller ingår i processen.
   

  

 Har du några frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta gärna vår Talent Acquisition Partner på felicia.gardare@teliacompany.com
   

  

**Lika möjligheter för alla**
 På Telia värderar vi kompetens och utvecklingspotential. Vi främjar mångfald och ser till att varje individs behov tillgodoses, oavsett funktionsvariation, kön, ålder, nationalitet, sexuell läggning eller social bakgrund. Tillsammans skapar vi en inkluderande arbetsmiljö där din unikhet är vår styrka.
   

  

**Välkommen till Telia Cygate – Home of Experts**

title: Client Executive Insurance
description:
Are you interested in working for an international company with high-performing colleagues and international clients? Marsh AB is now looking for a Client Executive to join our Corporate team. This role is for you who enjoy working with sales and customer relationships. At Marsh, you will have the opportunity to influence the company’s operations, develop professionally, and become part of a team with competent and inspiring colleagues in an international environment.
   

  

**About the role:**
 The responsibilities include taking full ownership of your clients and developing the business with them where you see potential to broaden or deepen it. You manage and develop the clients, ensure they receive the best solutions, and you have an underlying profitability responsibility. The right service to the right client. You also have an interest in meeting new companies and contributing to expanding Marsh’s client portfolio. You work both administratively and communicatively and build and maintain strong working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
   

  

**Examples of tasks include:**
* Assisting our clients with relevant advice regarding risk and insurance
* Conducting strategic dialogues with the contact person, often the CEO or CFO
* Leading projects and being the coordinating contact towards the client
* Delivering services personally, but also having the ability to project manage specialists and risk engineers performing work for the client
* Identifying new business opportunities with your clients and proactively working to broaden Marsh’s business
* Contacting new potential clients


**We are looking for someone who:**
* Has 3+ years of experience in a similar role
* Preferably holds an academic degree in law, economics, or engineering
* Has good communication skills
* Is structured, meets deadlines, and can handle multiple tasks simultaneously
* Values service and always puts the client first
* Enjoys working independently but also finds collaboration rewarding
* To thrive at Marsh, we believe you are attracted to being part of a large, global organization and find insurance an interesting field


**We offer you:**
* To become part of a great team with competent colleagues and a positive work climate
* A varied role with great potential for significant personal responsibility
* Many different points of contact, both internally and externally
* For the right person, there are great development opportunities within the role
* Location in central Stockholm
* A permanent position with a start date by agreement


 Marsh, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), is the world’s top insurance broker and risk advisor. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit marsh.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.
   

  

 Marsh McLennan is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
   

  

 Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.
   

  

**R\_326982**

title: Senior Azureutvecklare
description:
As of 2 September 2025, Vivicta, former Tietoevry Tech Services, now operates as a standalone company under our new brand. We’ve officially launched Vivicta, your trusted Nordic transformation partner, making everyday easier through technology. You can explore more about our brand and what we stand for at https://www.vivicta.com
   

  

 Ready to join us? Click ‘Apply’ and complete our short application form to get started. Prefer another option? Apply via LinkedIn to automatically populate your details using your profile.
   

  

 Är du en driven och engagerad integrationsutvecklare som brinner för att skapa smidiga och effektiva lösningar? Vill du vara en del av ett innovativt team på Nordens största Tech-företag? Då är det dig vi söker!
   

  

 Vi söker en integrationsutvecklare med erfarenhet inom Azure (gärna även Boomi) som vill bli en del av Vivicta. Vivicta driver företagsomfattande transformationer av kundernas affärsprocesser, applikationer och infrastruktur.
   

  

 I rollen blir du del av ett tvärvetenskapligt team som inkluderar experter inom Data Management, AI, GenAI, Cloud, Software Engineering, Security och Automation. Om du brinner för att använda teknik för att driva transformation och trivs i en samarbetsmiljö så ser vi framemot din ansökan!
   

  

**När du börjar på Vivicta som integrationsutvecklare kommer du att:**
* Designa och utveckla integrationslösningar.
* Arbeta nära våra kunder för att förstå deras behov och skapa skräddarsydda lösningar.
* Delta i hela utvecklingscykeln, från kravanalys till implementation och support.
* Samarbeta med andra utvecklare, arkitekter, förvaltare och tekniska experter för att säkerställa hög kvalitet och prestanda i våra lösningar.


**Vem vi söker**
* Du har minst 2 års erfarenhet av integrationsutveckling.
* Du har djupgående kunskaper inom Azure Integration Services (t.ex. Logic Apps, Service Bus, API Management).
* Du är lösningsorienterad och har en stark analytisk förmåga.
* Du är en lagspelare med god kommunikationsförmåga.


**Det är meriterande om du också har**
* Erfarenhet av Boomi eller liknande integrationsplattformar.


**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Vi erbjuder dig professionell tillväxt, meningsfulla projekt, öppen kultur och en enastående balans mellan arbete och privatliv! Vi erbjuder dig en möjlighet att skapa framtiden för en snabbt växande och viktig sektor. Vi tror att vår organisationskultur är en viktig del för att du ska bli framgångsrik. Vi tillhandahåller en flexibel hybrid arbetsmodell som en del av vår kultur och vårt sätt att arbeta. Slutligen tror vi också på nyfikenhet och konstant lärande som en livsstil där du behöver skola om dig varje dag när nya möjligheter dyker upp.
   

  

**Blev du inspirerad?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Bifoga ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil så kontaktar vi dig. Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande, så vi uppmanar dig att söka redan idag. Om du har några frågor angående denna roll, vänligen kontakta anställande chef, förnamn efternamn, anna.ryan@vivicta.com
   

  

 Hoppas vi hörs snart!
   

  

 Plats: Flexibel, hybrid. Resa till Stockholm ca 1 gång/månad kan förekomma.
   

  

*Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla slutkandidater.*
*Vivicta tackar nej till samtal från rekryteringsföretag.*

title: Frontend developer at Thermo-Calc Software
description:
Are you ready to create intuitive, modern user experiences for complex scientific tools? Thermo-Calc Software in Solna is looking for a skilled Frontend Developer (React) to join our passionate team in shaping the future of materials science software.
   

  

 We’re a fast-growing tech company at the intersection of engineering, research, and user-centered design. With customers around the globe and a product that truly makes a difference in research and industry, your frontend skills will directly contribute to innovation in materials development, sustainability, and beyond. Help us build the Future of Scientific Software!
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Strong experience with React and modern JavaScript/TypeScript frameworks
* Solid understanding of frontend architecture and state management (e.g. Redux, Context)
* Solid understanding of HTML5, CSS3, and modern CSS frameworks (e.g., SASS, Styled Components, Tailwind)
* Experience with REST APIs and integrating complex backend logic into the UI using tRPC
* Familiarity with version control systems like Git and Continuous Integration such as Jenkins
* Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset
* A degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience


**Meritorious**
* Knowledge of backend tools like Java Spring Boot
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud)
* Exposure to containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes)
* Experience integrating scientific or numerical code into a GUI
* Agile development experience (Scrum, Kanban, etc.)


**Responsibilities**
 As Frontend Developer, you’ll take a leading role in developing the user interface for our next-generation web platform. Working in a cross-functional environment with backend developers, FORTRAN specialists, designers, and scientists, you’ll ensure that complex scientific workflows are transformed into elegant, user-friendly web applications.
   

  

 You’ll primarily work with React, TypeScript, and modern frameworks such as Fastify, alongside Spring Boot and Azure on the backend. Your focus will be on delivering robust, scalable, and visually intuitive frontends that meet high technical and usability standards.
   

  

**In This Role, You Will**
* Design and build dynamic, interactive web interfaces using React and TypeScript
* Collaborate with backend and scientific developers to integrate advanced functionality
* Maintain a high standard of UI performance, accessibility, and responsiveness
* Contribute to architectural decisions and continuous improvement processes
* Participate in code reviews and team discussions to maintain quality and consistency
* Stay updated on frontend trends, tools, and best practices


 Selection is ongoing, so please submit your application as soon as possible. We are collaborating with Randstad Digital for this recruitment. If you have any questions about the role or the process, feel free to contact Julia Rhönnstad at julia.rhonnstad@randstad.se.
   

  

 Welcome to a workplace where your code truly matters.
   

  

 If you’ve ever wished that your phone were lighter, a battery lasted longer, or your plane flight required less fuel for the environment, then you’ve wished for a better material. At Thermo-Calc Software, we make software and databases that are used by materials scientists and engineers to generate data that helps them design better materials and improve materials processing conditions. Our flagship product, Thermo-Calc, is used by more than 1900 organizations located in more than 60 countries around the world to drive innovation through improved, advanced materials.

title: Salesforce-utvecklare
description:
Vill du bli en av våra nya Salesforce-utvecklare? Vill du vara med och forma framtidens kundupplevelser? Då kan det här vara din nästa utmaning!
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Salesforce-utvecklare kommer du att spela en central roll i utvecklingen av våra kundnära system. Du kommer att vara en del av ett agilt team bestående av utvecklare, testare och kravanalytiker. I denna roll får du möjlighet att designa och implementera lösningar som förbättrar kundupplevelsen och optimerar våra interna processer.
 



  





 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:
 


* Utveckling och anpassning av Salesforce-plattformen för att möta verksamhetens behov
* Skapa och optimera Salesforce-integrationer med andra system och applikationer
* Arbeta med datamodellering och säkerställa effektiv datalagring och åtkomst
* Samarbeta med verksamheten för att förstå krav och omvandla dem till tekniska lösningar
* Delta i strategiska teknikval för att säkerställa att Salesforce-plattformen används optimalt och skalbart



  





**Vem du är** 




 Du är en självgående och lösningsorienterad person som trivs med att arbeta i agila team och gärna delar med dig av dina kunskaper. Du har ett starkt intresse för att skapa användarvänliga och effektiva lösningar som ger verkligt värde för kunder och verksamhet.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer** 



* Bakgrund inom IT-utveckling med ett stort intresse av att lära dig mer om försäkringsbranschen, med fokus på antingen sälj eller skadereglering
* Utbildning inom systemutveckling eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
* Bekväm med att kommunicera på svenska och engelska, muntligt och skriftligt
* Meriterande med erfarenhet från utveckling eller avancerat användande av Salesforceplattformen



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 Hos oss får du växa. Vi erbjuder en kultur präglad av samarbete, utveckling och engagemang. Här får du möjlighet att påverka, ta ansvar och bidra. Vi tror på en inkluderande och flexibel arbetsmiljö där du kan vara dig själv. Här vågar vi tänka nytt och jobbar tillsammans för att göra skillnad – för våra kunder, varandra och framtidens försäkringslösningar.
 



  





**Kontakt** 




 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Peter Anderberg, Chef Utveckling Salesforce & BI: 072-561 56 23. Facklig representant för Forena är Sammy Bergman, telefon 08-5180 38 27.
 



  





**Välkommen in med din ansökan!** 




 Eftersom vi jobbar med ett löpande urval ber vi dig skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt men senast den 8 januari 2026. För att säkerställa en trygg arbetsmiljö genomför vi en bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidaten i rekryteringsprocessen.

title: Golang Engineer
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open-source software and operating systems for global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in more than 80 countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring
 **Golang engineers** 
 of all levels of seniority, for all relevant teams at Canonical. Apply here if you are an exceptional software engineer who prefers to work in Go. After the first round of interviews we'll find the best fit product team at Canonical for you to progress your application based on your personal interests.
   

  

 Canonical prefers Golang for software where performance and security are primary considerations. We also have substantial projects in Python, C, C++ and are starting to invest in Rust. For front-end development we prefer React and Flutter.
   

  

 Golang is an essential language for our engineering teams, who build the systems that deliver Ubuntu to the world. From our software distribution systems, to those which build and test every possible kind of open source on every architecture, from our systems management tools to our distributed systems operations R&D, we count on Golang for its tasteful concurrency and developer ecosystem. Juju, Livepatch, LXD, MAAS, Microk8s, Snapd, Ubuntu Core, Ubuntu Pro, and many more Canonical offerings include Golang components.
   

  

 We also want to ensure that Ubuntu is the very best platform for Golang development, offering easy access to the widest range of tooling and capabilities that support cutting edge open source and enterprise development.
   

  

 Join us in our mission to deliver innovative open-source solutions to individuals and enterprises around the world. We expect the highest engineering standards and strong motivation to get things done well in a fully remote and distributed environment. These roles require extensive personal experience with Linux - the more different versions of Linux the better!
   

  

**Location** 
 : we have open roles for Golang engineers in every time zone
   

  

**The role entails**
* Design and implement well-tested and documented software in Go
* Debug and fix issues encountered by your users
* Participate in our engineering process through code and architectural reviews
* Collaborate with community and colleagues on technical specifications
* Seek improvements to engineering and operations practices
* In some cases, deploy and operate services developed by the team
* Contribute to the success of your product through technical advocacy


**What we are looking for in you**
* An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
* Drive and a track record of going above-and-beyond expectations
* Well-organized, self-starting and able to deliver to schedule
* Professional manner interacting with colleagues, partners, and community
* Experience designing and writing high-quality Golang software on Linux
* Experience with and passion for Linux at the system level
* For more senior roles, experience building, deploying, and operating distributed systems and APIs
* Professional written and spoken English
* Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
* Passion, thoughtfulness, and self-motivation
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
* Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks each


**Nice-to-have skills**
* Experience developing for Ubuntu Linux
* Experience with Juju, LXD, Microk8s, Snapd, Ubuntu Core, Ubuntu Pro
* Performance engineering and security experience


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Program
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Data Product Owner
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 As a Data Product Owner at LeoVegas, you will play a crucial role in defining and delivering our data products, ensuring they align with our business objectives and deliver maximum value to our stakeholders. You will bridge the gap between business needs and technical solutions, working closely with data engineers, business intelligence engineers, data scientists, and other product teams. This role requires a strong understanding of data ecosystems, excellent communication skills, and a passion for turning data into actionable insights and valuable products.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Champion the vision, strategy, and roadmap for data products, ensuring their alignment with broader company objectives.
* Gather, analyse and document business requirements from various stakeholders, translating them into clear, concise, and actionable user stories and acceptance criteria.
* Manage the complete lifecycle of data products, from concept and design to development, launch, and gather feedback for continuous improvement.
* Serve as the primary point of contact for business stakeholders regarding new product features.
* Champion internal promotion of the data products through posts, training and leading internal demo sessions to confirm that the delivered work aligns with expectations.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:
   

  

**Essential Skills**
* Proven experience as a Product Owner or similar role, with a strong focus on delivering data products with a high degree of complexity.
* Solid understanding of data warehousing, ETL processes, and data modelling concepts.
* Familiarity with agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban).
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a cross-functional team.
* Experience with SQL and data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).


 NICE TO HAVES
   

  

* Experience in the iGaming industry.
* Knowledge of cloud data platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).
* Understanding of machine learning concepts and their application in data products.
* Relevant certifications in product management or data analytics.


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 2000 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 19 offices worldwide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*

title: Senior iOS Developer - Scale up
description:

title: Staff Software Engineer - Content Experience Platform
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***








**Who We Are…**





 When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the
 *storytellers* 
 bringing our characters to life, the
 *creators* 
 bringing them to your living rooms and the
 *dreamers* 
 creating what’s next…
 









 From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.
 




  


 Warner Bros. has been entertaining audiences for more than 90 years through the world’s most-loved characters and franchises. Warner Bros. employs people all over the world in a wide variety of disciplines. We're always on the lookout for energetic, creative people to join our team.
 




  


**Your New Role...** 








 The Direct to Consumer (DTC) Group is a technology company within Warner Bros Discovery. We are building a global streaming video platform (OTT), and a suite of applications to support all of our network’s brands globally. We are building modern container-based micro-services operated on AWS. Our platform covers everything from search, content catalogue, video transcoding, personalization, to global subscriptions, and much more. We enable performant streaming experiences across connected TVs, web, mobile phones, tablets, and consoles for a large footprint of WBD owned streaming services (HBO Max, Discovery+, CNN, and others). This is a growing, global engineering group crucial to WBD’s future.
 







 We are hiring a Staff Software Engineer within the DTC Content Experience Platform. The team is responsible for aggregating, enabling, and serving the personalized Content Discovery experience within our DTC streaming video platforms through our Experience Services APIs. We ensure all client applications worldwide have seamless access to the latest and relevant content metadata, personalized browse experiences and curations, and presentational elements to deliver a best-in-class content discovery experience to our hundreds of millions of streaming users globally across our different streaming service platforms.
 



  


**Your Role Accountabilities...** 



* Shape the long-term technical direction of major workstreams in close partnership with Engineering peers, Product Managers, Technical Program Managers, and Designers.
* Lead system design and development of large, complex features and infrastructure, either in new domains or across multiple existing systems.
* Partner with other technical leaders to drive successful end-to-end delivery, from discovery and planning through execution and operations.
* Support the growth and development of engineers in your workstreams through coaching, design collaboration, and fostering technical excellence.
* Define and uphold standards for code quality, operational excellence, and reliable delivery across teams.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define MVPs, milestones, and product requirements that align engineering efforts with business outcomes.
* Drive architectural decisions that enable scalability, reliability, and adaptability for the future.
* Identify and address gaps, bottlenecks, or misalignments—working proactively to ensure long-term success for your team and the organization.



  


**Qualifications and Experience...** 



* At least 8 years of experience with deep expertise in Java or other JVM-based languages, including advanced language features, performance tuning, and designing systems for scale and reliability.
* Extensive experience building and operating cloud-native applications using Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS, including architecture design and production deployment.
* Strong command of distributed systems, microservice architectures, and synchronous /asynchronous communication patterns using technologies like gRPC and Kafka.
* Proven ability to design and evolve high-performance, low-latency APIs and backend systems that serve real-time, high-throughput workloads.
* Practical and architectural-level experience with persistence and caching technologies such as PostgreSQL, Redis, Elasticsearch, and Caffeine, including data modeling and performance optimization.
* Deep understanding of observability and tracing, with experience driving adoption of tools like OpenTelemetry, Jaeger, or Zipkin to improve system transparency and incident response.
* Experience defining and scaling infrastructure as code practices using Terraform, Helm, ArgoCD, and GitOps workflows.
* Ability to establish robust monitoring, alerting, and logging systems using tools such as Prometheus, CloudWatch, Kibana, and PagerDuty, and ensure teams operate systems with confidence.
* Familiarity with non-blocking, asynchronous, and reactive programming paradigms, including frameworks like Spring WebFlux or Vert.x, and when to apply them effectively.
* Comfortable evaluating, introducing, and scaling technical choices across multiple teams to drive engineering velocity and system robustness.



  


**Additional Information** 
  
 







 On June 9, 2025, Warner Bros. Discovery announced plans to separate into two publicly traded companies, Warner Bros. and Discovery Global, with an expected completion in mid-2026. For more details, including leadership appointments and information on individual brands, please visit our newsroom
 
 here
 
 . 
 







 Although you will be hired by Warner Bros. Discovery, upon the planned separation in 2026, your employment likely will transition to Warner Bros. Company. During this period of transformation, you’ll have an exciting opportunity to lay the foundation at one of the world’s premier entertainment brands.  
 



























  


**How We Get Things Done…**









 This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at
 












 www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/
 











  
 
 along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.
 








**Championing Inclusion at WBD**



 Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects a wide array of perspectives, backgrounds and experiences. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, regardless of sex, gender identity, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy, parenthood, disability or any other category protected by law.
 









 If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you require adjustments or accommodations during the job application and/or recruitment process, please visit our
 
 accessibility page
 
 for instructions to submit your request.

title: SAC Solution Architect with a financial planning focus to Management Consulting, KPMG (Stockholm)
description:
Are you an experienced solution architect with deep expertise in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), passionate about financial planning and performance management and ready to deliver and shape transformative analytics solutions? Join KPMG’s Management Consulting and help leading organizations in Sweden shape the future of enterprise analytics!
   

  

**Your Role**
 We are seeking a SAC Solution Architect to join our Finance Transformation team in Stockholm. As part of our Management Consulting practice, you will collaborate with major Swedish corporations and organizations to design and deliver modern analytics solutions, drive digitalization, and support strategic decision-making.This role is a functional, business-driven position at the intersection of finance processes and modern technology.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to contribute to high-impact projects, work alongside senior stakeholders, and be part of a collaborative, high-performing, and purpose-driven team.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Oversee and execute SAC solution architecture, data modeling, and integrations of SAP and non-SAP environments
* Lead requirements workshops and process discussions with finance and business stakeholders
* Develop functional planning models, implement driver-based logic, and configure data flows to support accurate and efficient financial planning
* Together with business process experts design end-to-end SAC Planning solutions, including predictive scenarios and dashboards, to optimize business planning processes
* Drive governance, performance optimization, and best practices within analytics solutions
* Collaborate with technical teams to ensure accurate data integration and model performance
* Translate business needs into solution architecture, ensuring scalability and best-practice design. Partner with stakeholders to deliver scalable and robust analytics solutions
* Facilitate workshops to engage both business stakeholders and technical teams


 ,
   

  

**Relevant Experience And Knowledge**
* You have significant experience in business intelligence, analytics, or data warehousing, with at least 8 years in the field and a minimum of 3 years working directly with SAC
* You have strong understanding of FP&A, budgeting, forecasting, cost allocation, and performance management
* You have knowledge of planning best practices: scenario modelling, rolling forecasting, driver-based planning
* Basic knowledge in SAP BW, HANA Data Warehouse, Datasphere, and integration of complex systems
* You have demonstrated success in solution architecture, leadership of analytics initiatives and experience collaborating with cross-functional teams including finance, business, and technical stakeholders
* You have experience facilitating workshops with finance stakeholders and ability to translate business requirements into planning models, driver-based logic, workflows, and reporting structures


**Requirements**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Finance, Business, Engineering, or related field
* Minimum of 8 years’ experience in BI/Analytics/Data Warehousing, with at least 3 years in SAP Analytics Cloud
* Strong analytical and conceptual skills with the ability to design end-to-end planning processes
* Practical experience with SAC Planning or similar enterprise planning tools
* Strong business acumen and proven leadership in analytics projects
* Excellent communication and workshop facilitation skills
* Ability to operate cross-functionally across finance, business, and technical areas
* Fluency in English


**What We offer:**
* An exciting opportunity to work on different types of engagements across various industries
* An inspiring work environment where you are empowered to perform at your best
* An inclusive environment where diversity is one of our core foundations
* A flexible workplace, where work-life balance is a top priority
* Generous employee benefits package


 Want to make a difference together with us?
   

  

 Then you are warmly welcomed with your application. If you have any questions regarding the position, you are very welcome to contact our Head of Finance Transformation Victor Crona victor.crona@kpmg.se or responsible Talent Manager marie-louise.baath@kpmg.se or mobile +46 76 717 46 85.

title: Research Engineer to Develop Cutting-Edge Vision AI for Breast Radiology
emails: fredrik.strand@ki.se, helen.eriksson@ki.se, sara.jalali@ki.se, elisabeth.valenzuela@ki.se, per.hydbring@ki.se, nick.tobin@ki.se
description:
**Do you want to contribute to improving human health?**
--------------------------------------------------------


Do you want to contribute to reducing the number of late breast cancer diagnoses and improve survival for our patients? Do you want to develop production-grade visual deep learning models to predict the future risk of breast cancer, and the risk of having genetic risk for breast cancer, based on mammography screening images?


Our research is internationally recognized for the development and evaluation of AI for radiological breast cancer diagnostics with recent publications in Nature, Lancet Digital Health, Radiology, MICCAI, among others. Our group has expertise in radiology, biostatistics and machine learning. We have a strong collaboration with research groups at KTH, and internationally with UC Berkeley.

### **A transformational project**


One in nine women will get diagnosed with breast cancer. For around 20-25% of those women, breast cancer will be their cause of death. By detecting cancer early, many deaths can be avoided. Genetic risk may explain up to around 25% of all breast cancer diagnosis, whilst 75% is not predictable based on genetics. We want to combine AI analysis of screening mammograms, which are performed with 2-year intervals for each woman between 40 and 74 years of age, with the time-constant information from genetics, to deliver precision breast cancer screening.


We were recently awarded funding for Early Detection of breast cancer from Cancerfonden, and our now hiring several people of which the research engineer is one. Our aim is to use our existing AI risk model for breast cancer, improve the robustness across images from various equipment, and to fine-tune to predict the risk of having high-risk genes such as BRCA1. We also want to improve the radiological surveillance strategy for each person who are confirmed of having one of the risk genes, by using both genetic and image information.


We have developed and clinically tested a groundbreaking AI solution at the Karolinska University Hospital to identify women at high risk of having breast cancer despite a negative screening mammogram (i.e., without apparent signs of cancer to the radiologists). Using our AI solution to select a small proportion of women for magnetic resonance imaging diagnosed three to four times more cancer compared to selecting women using traditional methods based on mammographic density.


We now need to extend the model to work with images from multiple mammography equipment types, and further train and fine-tune for the purposes listed above.

### **Your mission**


You will work developing cutting-edge image-based deep learning models for precision screening and surveillance of breast cancer. Your tasks will involve preparing data, running experiments, and testing the results. Your mission will also involve ensuring a continuously updated, structured and well-documented code base. You will be located with our existing group at Karolinska in Solna, Sweden. You will also collaborate and co-locate with our collaborators at KTH, at the nearby SciLifeLab.

### **Your profile**

### **Qualifications**

**You should have:**

* Master’s degree in computer science or related field
* A portfolio to demonstrate expertise in visual deep learning
* Experience from software engineering and code base maintenance
* Excellent communication skills in both writing and speaking in English.
* Excellent skills in programming and mathematics.
* Experience with deep learning frameworks, particularly PyTorch.

**It is a merit if you have:**

* Applied your expertise to medical images, especially radiology and mammography
* Applied your expertise in risk modelling
* Familiarity with medical imaging libraries (e.g., MONAI, TorchIO, SimpleITK)
* Experience from production-grade software engineering
* Academic awards, presentations, publications demonstrating high impact
* Excellent communication skills in both writing and speaking, in Swedish

### **What do we offer?**


A creative and inspiring environment with wide-ranging expertise and interests. Karolinska Institutet is one of the world's leading medical universities. Our vision is to pursue the development of knowledge about life and to promote a better health for all. At Karolinska Institutet, we conduct successful medical research and hold the largest range of medical education in Sweden. Karolinska Institutet is also a state university, which entitles you to several good benefits through our collective agreement. And you get to practice freely in our modern wellness facilities, where trained staff are on site.

**Location:** Solna

*Choose to work at KI – Ten reasons why*

### **Application**


Welcome to apply at the latest 22nd December.


The application is to be submitted through the Varbi recruitment system.In this recruitment, you will apply with your CV without a personal letter. Instead, you will answer some questions about why you are applying for the job in the application form.


The position is for 1 year, with a possible extension to a permanent position.

**Want to make a difference? Join us and contribute to better health for all**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Anställningsform: tidsbegränsad anställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 % | Ort: Solna | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: STÖD 2-4922/2025 | Kontakt: Fredrik Strand fredrik.strand@ki.se, | Facklig företrädare: Helen Eriksson/Sara Jalali, OFR helen.eriksson@ki.se/sara.jalali@ki.se, Elisabeth Valenzuela, Seko elisabeth.valenzuela@ki.se, Per Hydbring och Nick Tobin, SACO per.hydbring@ki.se/nick.tobin@ki.se, | Publicerat: 2025-12-04 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-22

title: Project engineering Manager
description:
Req ID:497309

  


At Alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Every day, more than 80 000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars.

  



If you’re ambitious, driven and team-spirited, this is your opportunity to build a career as **Project Engineer Manager** in **Hässleholm, SWEDEN!**

  



Take on a new challenge and apply your technical expertise in a new cutting-edge field. You’ll report to Project Engineering Team Lead, and work alongside moivated and supportive teammates.



You'll lead and coordinate engineering activities for complex railway projects. Day-to-day, you’ll work closely with teams across the business (Engineering, Project Management, Bids, etc.), manage project schedules, budgets, resources and much more.



You’ll specifically take care of liasing with relevant stakeholders to ensure project alignment with customer requirements.

  


**We'll look to you for:**


* Lead and coordinate all aspects of the design, implementation, testing and commissioning required to deliver the scope of the engineering project so as to satisfy customer requirements while adhering to the project time plan.
* Coordinate execution of engineering activities, CCB, take decisions regarding technical issues, control against project requirements.
* Establish and maintain interfaces with other Engineering departments & with relevant functions (Project Management, System Owner, EAPD, Procurement, Operations, Sales, Bids, etc).
* Continuous optimization of Project Engineering processes/tools/behaviors by taking into account business requirements, customer needs, technical innovations, and new market conditions.
* Monitor, control and report monthly all product related aspects of the project consistent with the contract requirements and established project management procedures to attain established goals.
* Responsible for engineering quality gates and KPIs

  

  

**All about you**



We value passion and attitude over experience. That’s why we don’t expect you to have every single skill. Instead, we’ve listed some that we think will help you succeed and grow in this role:


* Master or Bachelor of Engineering degree or equivalent work experience.
* Relevant experience directly linked to the requirements of the role.
* Experience in working cross-functionally.
* Easy to understand Software and Hardware, and their interconnection.
* Strong experience in planning.
* Good system knowledge on a technical level and strong background in railway signalling (Interlocking, ATP, Metros, CBTC and/or ERTMS technologies would be a plus)

  


**Things you’ll enjoy**



Join us on a life-long transformative journey – the rail industry is here to stay, so you can grow and develop new skills and experiences throughout your career. You’ll also:


* Enjoy stability, challenges, and a long-term career free from boring daily routines
* Collaborate with transverse teams and helpful colleagues
* Contribute to innovative projects
* Utilise our hybrid working environment
* Steer your career in whatever direction you choose across functions and countries
* Benefit from our investment in your development, through award-winning learning
* Benefit from a fair and dynamic reward package that recognises your performance and potential, plus comprehensive and competitive social coverage (life, medical, pension)

  


You don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. We guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you’ll be proud. If you’re up for the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!

  


**Important to note**


As a global business, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 63 countries we operate in. We’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.

  


Job Type:Experienced  



  

**Job Segment:** Project Manager, Testing, Procurement, Manager, Technology, Operations, Management

title: Software Verification & Test Engineer – SIL/HIL Focus
description:
December 4, 2025
Full Time
Sweden
Posted 7 hours ago
We are hiring **Software Verification & Test Engineer – SIL/HIL Focus**for the position based in **Goteborg, Sweden.**


**Educational Qualification:** Bachelor’s, Master’s in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience.


**Job Summary:**



We are seeking a **Software Verification & Test Engineer** to ensure safety-critical software meets all requirements through rigorous testing in SIL and HIL environments. This role focuses on verifying ASIL-D compliance for critical safety functions while collaborating with product owners, architects, and stakeholders to uphold ISO 26262 functional safety standards in an agile team setting.



**Required Experience/Competences:**


* **7+Years** Proven experience in **SIL/HIL testing** for automotive systems.
* Strong knowledge of **safety-critical software verification processes.**
* Solid understanding **of ISO 26262** functional safety standards.
* Previous experience with ScM (Safety Case Management) tools.


**Soft Skills:**

title: Senior Solution Engineer - License Server Management
description:
**Location:**Göteborg, SE, 417 55
**Position Type:** Professional  

Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future. If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.**This will be us - your new colleagues**

Our Department, Vehicle SW Partner Management within Digital and IT, has the accountability to provide digital capabilities that supports services & diagnostics. We provide different COTS (Commercial Off-The-Shelf) solutions to secure pathway for qualified software development and validation. Our stakeholders are Software Engineers developing software used in all products such as trucks, engines, buses, and construction equipment.  

In addition to this, our strategic focus is on skills that will define the future of IT: automation, modernization, and smart, scalable solutions.  


**Who are you:**  

We’re looking for a hands-on problem solver with an IT background.  

Do you like figuring things out, making things work, and helping others do the same? Our team needs someone who’s not just tech-savvy but who enjoys working with people and thinking practically. In this role, you’ll be the go-to person for all things related to license management — supporting the team, ensuring we follow good practices, and driving our modernization journey forward. You’ll help make sure everything runs smoothly and securely, and work closely with architecture, infrastructure, and software development.  

We work in an agile way, and you should be comfortable with change, collaboration, and thinking on your feet. This is a great opportunity for someone with a strong IT foundation who enjoys practical work, continuous improvement, and contributing to a collaborative team environment.
**Responsibilities:**
* License management (monitoring, support, installations)
* License Server Management
* Drive innovation, modernization and modularization journey one or more digital solutions, spanning over Infrastructure, Integration, and Software Architecture
* Support agile team on technical / technology questions and implementing modern WoW and collaborating with others to move technical solutions forward
* Identify opportunities for automation and advanced analytics to enhance operational efficiency and decision-making

  


**Core Skills:**
* License Management: License servers, license installations RLM FlexLm, CodeMeter
* Server Management: Microsoft and Linux
* Agile Proficiency: Adept at working within an Agile framework, such as Scrum or Kanban, through participating in sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives, ensuring continuous improvement and effective collaboration.

  


**Good to Have:**
* Jira, Confluence, and agile work methods
* Experience working with COTS applications
* Data analysis at a basic level


It is not necessary to have complete knowledge of every detail; what is most important is demonstrating curiosity, practicality, a hands-on approach, and a readiness to engage.  



If you are passionate about product development and want to join a dynamic team that is making a difference for Volvo Group, we encourage you to apply.  



“In some countries and for specific positions within Volvo Group Digital & IT, background checks may be required, in accordance with local laws & regulations. If this is applicable to the role you have applied for, you will be informed.”  


**Join us on our transformation journey to the digital future**  



We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.  


**Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.  



Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.  


**Group Digital & IT** is the hub for digital development within Volvo Group. Imagine yourself working with cutting-edge technologies in a global team, represented in more than 30 countries. We are dedicated to leading the way of tomorrow’s transport solutions, guided by a strong customer mindset and high level of curiosity, both as individuals and as a team. Here, you will thrive in your career in an environment where your voice is heard and your ideas matter.

description:

Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.
**What you will do**
**We shape the world we want to live in!**  

Volvo Energy is our newest business area with the overarching purpose of supporting the Volvo Group’s transformation ambitions within electrification, sustainability, circularity, complete service offer, profitable growth and resilience.  

  

**The team - Battery Optimization and Monitoring – Technology**Battery Optimization and Monitoring – Technology is a function within Volvo Energy that works with second life applications of vehicle battery packs, monitoring and data analytics, optimization of remaining useful life, battery safety and new offerings for stationary Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS).

We are now looking for a new colleague to join our team as Lead Engineer - BESS Aftermarket Engineering.  

**What are we looking for in this specific role?**  

The Lead Engineer for BESS Aftermarket Engineering will oversee the technical support maintenance, and enhancement of Battery Energy Storage Systems post-deployment. You will act as a technical support expert for BESS installations, addressing and resolving complex issues.

In this role, you will take part in developing and implementing maintenance strategies to ensure system reliability and performance and to analyze performance data to recommend and implement upgrades and optimizations. You will also act to support field diagnosis of customer issue in the event of high severity underlying problems impacting system performance or availability.  

  

Furthermore, you will also take the role as the technical lead for liaison with third-party commissioning and maintenance engineers, ensuring optimal performance of BESS installations, and driving continuous improvement initiatives. You will lead and mentor a team of engineers in the Aftermarket Engineering department and coordinate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless support and service delivery.  

  

**Responsibilities will also include:**

Customer Interaction  

* Serve as the primary technical contact for customers, ensuring high levels of satisfaction.
* Conduct site visits and inspections to assess system performance and address customer concerns.


  

Documentation and Reporting  

* Maintain detailed records of maintenance activities, system performance, and customer interactions.
* Review the Product Technical Documentation & deliver Training for User, Commissioning & Maintenance Procedures interacting with third party providers as needed
* Prepare and present technical reports and updates to senior management.


  

Compliance and Safety  

* Ensure all activities comply with industry standards, regulations, and safety protocols.
* Promote a culture of safety and adherence to best practices within the team.
  

**Working at Volvo Energy is different**  

Welcome to a close-knit team!

We see ourselves as a fast-paced company within the Volvo Group, supported by our many great colleagues, we have the best of both worlds! We believe that work should be fun, stimulating, challenging and rewarding, but also have a meaning and a purpose to the individual. Trust and Results are two guiding principles for how we work together, and we are here to make a difference!**Who are you?**
**Qualifications likely required to be successful**  

* Several years of experience in BESS or related fields.
* Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field.
* Strong technical knowledge of BESS technologies and systems.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Effective communication and leadership abilities.
* Proficiency in relevant software and tools.


  

Experience with aftermarket engineering and customer support, knowledge of industry standards and regulatory requirements and certification in project management or relevant technical certifications is an advantage.**Ready for the next move?**

Are you excited to bring your skills and disruptive ideas to the table? We can’t wait to hear from you. Apply today!

title: Backend Engineer - Subscriptions
description:
We are a team working on defining the premium and free value propositions, and are seeking a Backend Engineer to join us.
   

  

 We own a system to define the product features that all our free, mid-tier and premium products have. We are the central source of truth for all existing and new premium products and own datasets and APls that teams around us can use. We are working on new systems to control pricing and discount availability for our premium products. Besides this we also own a system for capping features (e.g. audiobook consumption, on-demand playback, and more).
   

  

 We are a mature team and we have a good mix of investigation and implementation work and a lot of opportunities to lead initiatives of all sorts of sizes and complexity. We are very fast-paced and have a culture of helping teams that we work with with what they need.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Build and deliver end-to-end backend solutions for our core systems, taking responsibility for the quality and maintainability of your code.
* Lead the implementation of well-defined projects within the squad, coordinating with other engineers to ensure the team successfully meets its goals.
* Contribute to the evolution of our squad's architecture by proposing and implementing improvements to our existing systems.
* Work with product managers and stakeholders to translate requirements into robust and scalable technical solutions.
* Take an active role in the operational health of our systems, including facilitating incident response and improving observability.
* Improve our team's engineering practices through thoughtful code reviews, clear documentation, and mentoring other engineers.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have a strong professional experience building and maintaining scalable backend services.
* You have a strong command of Java and experience with container orchestration using Kubernetes.
* You are proficient with cloud platforms (GCP preferred) and have hands-on experience with data systems like BigQuery and data processing pipelines (e.g., using Scio or similar frameworks).
* You are a dependable engineer who thrives on taking complex, multi-part projects from concept to completion with a high degree of autonomy.
* You are a strong collaborator who can effectively coordinate with peers to deliver on squad-level initiatives.
* You look beyond the ticket, understanding the business context of your work and making pragmatic technical decisions to match.
* You enjoy sharing your knowledge and find it rewarding to help other engineers on your team grow their skills.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London or Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Internship Technology
description:
**Internship:** 
 We’re open to both internships connected to your university project
 *or* 
 a part-time internship (approximately 10-12 weeks).
   

  

**Company:** 
 Vend, home of FINN, Blocket, Tori, Oikotie, DBA & Bilbasen, where millions of people across the Nordics connect to find what they need, whether it’s a job, a home, a way to move, or a fresh start.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Join us at our vibrant and central Kungsbro office in Stockholm. As an intern you'll primarily work onsite, with some flexibility for working remote.
   

  

**Start:** 
 Preferably January or February 2026, but we’re open to other dates
   

  

**About The DevFlow Team**
 DevFlow, part of Vend’s Delivery Platforms, builds the internal developer platform that helps product teams move from idea to impact—safely and fast. We focus on
 **self‑serve developer experiences** 
 ,
 **golden paths for delivery (CI/CD)** 
 , a welcoming
 **developer portal/service catalog** 
 , and lightweight guardrails that make the right way the easy way.
   

  

**Two ways to join**
* University Thesis / Degree Project: We’ll co‑scope a clearly defined project with a named sponsor and mentor, aligned to your university’s requirements.
* Part-time Internship (experience‑based): Contribute to ongoing DevFlow initiatives while learning platform‑as‑a‑product practices alongside senior engineers.


**Bring your own idea — or join ours**
 We’re Deliberately Open. Propose a Project You Design (as Long As It Aligns With DevFlow’s Mission), Or Join An Existing Initiative. Topics Below Are Illustrative, Not Prescriptive
   

  

* Golden‑path templates and scaffolding for service onboarding and continuous delivery
* Developer self‑serve flows (CLI/plugins/templates/docs) that shorten time‑to‑first‑success
* Pipeline speed & quality (faster builds/tests, caching, lightweight checks for release confidence)
* Safety & governance with low friction (guardrails, starter kits, examples that promote good defaults)
* DX enablement (concise docs, “getting started” guides, reusable patterns)


**Technologies you might touch (examples only)**
 Git/GitHub and modern CI/CD systems, containers, infrastructure‑as‑code, internal platform tooling; languages such as
 **Python** 
 ,
 **TypeScript** 
 , or
 **Go** 
 (use what best fits your project—no single stack required).
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Define a problem and success criteria with your mentor
* Build iteratively, demo regularly, and land improvements others can adopt
* Collaborate across engineering using a platform‑as‑product mindset
* Document clearly so your work is easy to discover and reuse


**Who We’re Looking For**
* You’re curious, take initiative, and have good communication skills
* You bring some experience from courses/projects/OSS/work in developer tools, CI/CD, or adjacent areas
* You enjoy working from a problem statement toward measurable outcomes


**Does this sound like an interesting opportunity for you?** 
 Send us your application as soon as possible. We’ll review applications on a rolling basis.
   

  

**Questions?** 
 Senior Engineer Manager Carlos Manuel Duclos-Vergara (carlos.duclos@vend.com) will be happy to answer any question you might have about the internship or the team.

TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Together, we have the power to transform transportation - Let´s make a difference together. Find out more: www.traton.com
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

 We now wonder if you would like to be a part of the mission to transform transportation together and create the future of sustainable transport solutions? With over 8,000 people working in the R&D department at TRATON Group today, we are continuously looking for skilled Development Engineers within various technical fields!
   

  

 We are collectively creating a larger talent pool of potential candidates that we intend to match with a specific role as soon as available.
